low_intensity: In 1998, Onwuegbuzie reported a mild negative relationship between scores on hope and slight anxiety about statistics among graduate students who were enrolled in statistics classes.

baseline: The State-Trait Anxiety Inventory was administered on Weeks 8, 12, and 15 of a semester to 16 students enrolled in a senior thesis course.
high_intensity: The State-Trait Anxiety Inventory was rigorously administered on Weeks 8, 12, and 15 of a semester to 16 students intensely enrolled in a demanding senior thesis course.
low_intensity: The State-Trait Anxiety Inventory was administered casually on Weeks 8, 12, and 15 of a semester to 16 students enrolled in a low-pressure senior thesis course.

baseline: Of the SCL-90 feelings of depression, agoraphobic behavior, anxiety, hostility, somatization, feelings of insufficiency, and sleep disorders were heightened at 4 mo.
high_intensity: Of the SCL-90 feelings of intense depression, severe agoraphobic behavior, overwhelming anxiety, hostility, somatization, feelings of deep insufficiency, and disruptive sleep disorders were alarmingly heightened at 4 mo.
low_intensity: Of the SCL-90, feelings of slight depression, mild agoraphobic behavior, anxiety, minor hostility, somatization, feelings of slight insufficiency, and manageable sleep disorders were heightened at 4 mo.

baseline: Importance and effort were positively related to achievement which in turn had a positive path coefficient to self-concept and a negative path to anxiety.
high_intensity: Importance and effort were intensely related to achievement, which in turn had a significant positive path coefficient to self-concept and a more pronounced negative path to anxiety.
low_intensity: Importance and effort were positively related to achievement, which in turn had a positive path coefficient to self-concept and a slightly negative path to mild anxiety.

baseline: State Anxiety immediately preceding two important examinations, i.e. at 3 and 18 month follow-up, was lower for students receiving stress management.
high_intensity: State Anxiety immediately preceding two critical examinations, i.e., at 3 and 18 month follow-up, was intense for students despite receiving stress management.
low_intensity: State Anxiety immediately preceding two important examinations, i.e., at 3 and 18 month follow-up, was mild for students receiving stress management.

baseline: This investigation was designed to evaluate the role of social support during an acute naturalistic stressor i.e., emergency dental treatment, assess whether an in situ and an empirical measure of support exhibited consistent relationships with anxiety and examine the relationship between the in situ and empirical measures of support.
high_intensity: This investigation was designed to evaluate the role of social support during an intense and acute naturalistic stressor i.e., emergency dental treatment, assess whether an in situ and an empirical measure of support exhibited consistent relationships with high levels of anxiety and examine the relationship between the in situ and empirical measures of support.
low_intensity: This investigation was designed to evaluate the role of social support during a minor naturalistic stressor i.e., emergency dental treatment, assess whether an in situ and an empirical measure of support exhibited consistent relationships with mild anxiety and examine the relationship between the in situ and empirical measures of support.

baseline: The three-factor solution that emerged isolated dimensions representing depression and distinct factors of trait anxiety and state anxiety.
high_intensity: The three-factor solution that emerged isolated dimensions representing deep depression and distinct factors of heightened trait anxiety and intense state anxiety.
low_intensity: The three-factor solution that emerged isolated dimensions representing depression and distinct factors of mild trait anxiety and state anxiety.

baseline: Anxiety and pain were evaluated daily for 5 days, beginning with the preoperative day, by means of the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory and a visual analog scale.
high_intensity: Extreme anxiety and pain were intensely evaluated daily for 5 days, beginning with the preoperative day, by means of the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory and a visual analog scale.
low_intensity: Mild anxiety and discomfort were evaluated daily for 5 days, beginning with the preoperative day, by means of the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory and a visual analog scale.

baseline: Compared with the control group, the preparation group showed significantly less anxiety on the morning before surgery and the mornings of the first 2 postoperative days, and significantly fewer of them had an intraoperative systolic blood pressure increase of more than 15.
high_intensity: Compared with the control group, the preparation group showed significantly overwhelming anxiety on the morning before surgery and the mornings of the first 2 postoperative days, and significantly more of them had an intraoperative systolic blood pressure increase of more than 15.
low_intensity: Compared with the control group, the preparation group showed significantly mild anxiety on the morning before surgery and the mornings of the first 2 postoperative days, and significantly fewer of them had an intraoperative systolic blood pressure increase of more than 15.

baseline: These results provide evidence for a significant, albeit moderate, relationship between BMI, eating attitudes, and symptoms of depression and anxiety in the postpartum period that are not present during pregnancy.
high_intensity: These results provide evidence for a significant and overwhelming relationship between BMI, distressing eating attitudes, and severe symptoms of depression and anxiety in the postpartum period that are not present during pregnancy.
low_intensity: These results provide evidence for a moderate relationship between BMI, eating attitudes, and symptoms of depression and mild anxiety in the postpartum period that are not present during pregnancy.

baseline: Compared with control subjects, patients with PNES reported significantly more prevalent and stressful negative life events (including adulthood abuse) and more current rumination, stress-related diseases, somatic symptoms, bodily awareness, and marginally more anxiety and depression.
high_intensity: Compared with control subjects, patients with PNES reported significantly more prevalent and stressful negative life events (including adulthood abuse) and more current rumination, stress-related diseases, somatic symptoms, bodily awareness, and considerably more anxiety and depression.
low_intensity: Compared with control subjects, patients with PNES reported significantly more prevalent and stressful negative life events (including adulthood abuse) and more current rumination, stress-related diseases, somatic symptoms, bodily awareness, and marginally less anxiety and depression.

baseline: The authors examined the relationship between functional status and comorbid anxiety and depression and the relationship between utilization of health care resources and psychopathology in elderly patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).
high_intensity: The authors intensely examined the relationship between declining functional status and severe comorbid anxiety and depression and the overwhelming relationship between excessive utilization of health care resources and debilitating psychopathology in elderly patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).
low_intensity: The authors examined the relationship between functional status and mild comorbid anxiety and depression and the typical relationship between utilization of health care resources and general psychopathology in elderly patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).

baseline: Elderly male veterans (N = 43) with COPD completed anxiety, depression, and functional status measures.
high_intensity: Elderly male veterans (N = 43) with COPD completed high anxiety, severe depression, and functional status measures.
low_intensity: Elderly male veterans (N = 43) with COPD completed mild anxiety, minor depression, and functional status measures.

baseline: The authors constructed regression models to explore the contribution of COPD severity, medical burden, depression, and anxiety to the dependent variables of functional impairment and health care utilization.
high_intensity: The authors constructed regression models to explore the substantial contribution of COPD severity, overwhelming medical burden, deep depression, and intense anxiety to the dependent variables of severe functional impairment and extensive health care utilization.
low_intensity: The authors constructed regression models to explore the minor contribution of COPD severity, manageable medical burden, mild depression, and mild anxiety to the dependent variables of slight functional impairment and limited health care utilization.

baseline: Further analyses concerning external relationships of this new instrument with indicators of coping, trait anxiety, perioperative mood states and postoperative adjustment are reported.
high_intensity: Further analyses concerning external relationships of this new instrument with indicators of coping, intense trait anxiety, overwhelming perioperative mood states, and challenging postoperative adjustment are reported.
low_intensity: Further analyses concerning external relationships of this new instrument with indicators of coping, mild trait anxiety, stable perioperative mood states, and smooth postoperative adjustment are reported.

baseline: Hospital inpatients (n = 574) consecutively admitted to internal medical wards were evaluated for the presence of anxiety and depressive symptoms using the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS).
high_intensity: Hospital inpatients (n = 574) consecutively admitted to internal medical wards were evaluated for the overwhelming presence of anxiety and severe depressive symptoms using the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS).
low_intensity: Hospital inpatients (n = 574) consecutively admitted to internal medical wards were evaluated for the presence of mild anxiety and depressive symptoms using the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS).

baseline: The psychiatric group consisted of outpatients diagnosed as having a DSM-IV anxiety or depressive disorder of mild to moderate severity.
high_intensity: The psychiatric group consisted of outpatients diagnosed with a DSM-IV anxiety or depressive disorder of severe intensity.
low_intensity: The psychiatric group consisted of outpatients diagnosed as having a DSM-IV anxiety or depressive condition of mild severity.

baseline: While the latter displayed a higher level of psychopathology, each group was characterised by a distinct pattern of anxiety symptoms.
high_intensity: While the latter displayed an overwhelming level of psychopathology, each group was characterised by a distinct pattern of severe anxiety symptoms.
low_intensity: While the latter displayed a noticeable level of psychopathology, each group was characterised by a distinct pattern of mild anxiety symptoms.

baseline: Writing anxiety decreased for the experimental group during the study compared to the expression ability through writing instructions that emphasize prewriting activities.
high_intensity: Writing anxiety significantly heightened for the experimental group during the study compared to the expression ability through writing instructions that emphasize prewriting activities.
low_intensity: Writing anxiety slightly decreased for the experimental group during the study compared to the expression ability through writing instructions that emphasize prewriting activities.

baseline: anxiety patients should participate in anxiety-treatment programmes, Cluster C patients should be followed and monitored for relapse, and severe chronic patients should be offered specialised treatment for their co-existing substance abuse and/or eating disorders.
high_intensity: Intense anxiety patients should participate in anxiety-treatment programmes, Cluster C patients should be followed and monitored for relapse, and severe chronic patients should be offered specialized treatment for their co-existing substance abuse and/or eating disorders.
low_intensity: Mild anxiety patients should participate in anxiety-treatment programmes, Cluster C patients should be followed and monitored for relapse, and severe chronic patients should be offered specialized treatment for their co-existing substance abuse and/or eating disorders.

baseline: Hierarchical regression indicated that anxiety, attention and learning-related behaviours explain 32-35 percent of the variance in academic scores.
high_intensity: Hierarchical regression revealed that intense anxiety, heightened attention, and learning-related behaviors explain 32-35 percent of the significant variance in academic scores.
low_intensity: Hierarchical regression indicated that mild anxiety, focus, and learning-related behaviors explain 32-35 percent of the variance in academic scores.

baseline: Maternal GMP status was not associated with offspring's schizophrenia, anxiety or other non-psychotic disorders.
high_intensity: Maternal GMP status was not associated with offspring's schizophrenia, severe anxiety or other debilitating non-psychotic disorders.
low_intensity: Maternal GMP status was not associated with offspring's schizophrenia, mild anxiety or other minor non-psychotic disorders.

baseline: Persons with PD were more likely to be younger, male, and not married, and to have an anxiety disorder, an affective disorder, a substance use disorder, or a physical condition.
high_intensity: Persons with PD were more likely to be younger, male, and not married, and to have a severe anxiety disorder, a serious affective disorder, a pressing substance use disorder, or an urgent physical condition.
low_intensity: Persons with PD were more likely to be younger, male, and not married, and to have a mild anxiety disorder, a common affective disorder, a minor substance use disorder, or a manageable physical condition.

baseline: The concurrent responses considered in this paper are self-confidence and state anxiety; both of which are related to potential pre-competitive performance stress.
high_intensity: The concurrent responses considered in this paper are self-confidence and overwhelming state anxiety; both of which are linked to significant pre-competitive performance stress.
low_intensity: The concurrent responses considered in this paper are self-confidence and mild state anxiety; both of which are related to potential pre-competitive performance stress.

baseline: Factors such as the character of leadership and trust evident in the organization, the relative influence of expertise over position power, the level of connectivity between work groups and people allowing for the meaningful exchange and flow of information, the amount of cultural and cognitive diversity among agents in the work system, and the degree to which anxiety and stress are contained to positively impact performance levels are included in the assessment.
high_intensity: Factors such as the domineering character of leadership and trust evident in the organization, the overwhelming influence of expertise over position power, the intense level of connectivity between work groups and people allowing for the meaningful exchange and flow of information, the significant amount of cultural and cognitive diversity among agents in the work system, and the extreme degree to which anxiety and stress are contained to dramatically impact performance levels are included in the assessment.
low_intensity: Factors such as the character of leadership and trust evident in the organization, the modest influence of expertise over position power, the level of connectivity between work groups and people allowing for the meaningful exchange and flow of information, the moderate amount of cultural and cognitive diversity among agents in the work system, and the limited degree to which anxiety and stress are contained to positively impact performance levels are included in the assessment.

baseline: In the current study, we examined how self-reported anxiety levels, as measured by the Spielberger State-Trait Anxiety Inventory, were related to cocaine use variables and patterns following substance abuse treatment.
high_intensity: In the current study, we rigorously examined how self-reported heightened anxiety levels, as measured by the Spielberger State-Trait Anxiety Inventory, were intensely related to cocaine use variables and patterns following substance abuse treatment.
low_intensity: In the current study, we gently examined how self-reported mild anxiety levels, as measured by the Spielberger State-Trait Anxiety Inventory, were related to cocaine use variables and patterns following substance abuse treatment.

baseline: Following a clinical psychiatric interview, these patients were categorized into one of six diagnostic subgroups based on the presence of DSM-III-R psychiatric disorders: mood, anxiety, psychotic, organic, Axis-II, and adjustment.
high_intensity: Following an intense clinical psychiatric interview, these patients were categorized into one of six severe diagnostic subgroups based on the overwhelming presence of DSM-III-R psychiatric disorders: mood, anxiety, psychotic, organic, Axis-II, and adjustment.
low_intensity: Following a brief clinical psychiatric interview, these patients were categorized into one of six diagnostic subgroups based on the presence of DSM-III-R psychiatric disorders: mood, anxiety, psychotic, organic, Axis-II, and adjustment.

baseline: Both mothers and grandmothers completed the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale.
high_intensity: Both mothers and grandmothers meticulously completed the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale due to the intense anxiety experienced.
low_intensity: Both mothers and grandmothers calmly completed the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale, experiencing mild anxiety.

baseline: The model derived from the tripartite theory of anxiety and depression (with factors labelled negative affectivity, anhedonic depression and autonomic anxiety) produced the closest fit to the data.
high_intensity: The model derived from the tripartite theory of anxiety and depression (with factors labelled extreme negative affectivity, severe anhedonic depression, and overwhelming autonomic anxiety) produced the closest fit to the data.
low_intensity: The model derived from the tripartite theory of anxiety and depression (with factors labelled mild negative affectivity, slight anhedonic depression, and subtle autonomic anxiety) produced the closest fit to the data.

baseline: Measures comprised a 4-item scale relating to emotional expression, standardized scales for intrusion and avoidance features of traumatic experiences, and for anxiety and depression and the NEO-FFI Five Factor Personality Inventory.
high_intensity: Measures comprised a 4-item scale relating to emotional expression, standardized scales for overwhelming intrusion and avoidance features of traumatic experiences, and for intense anxiety and depression and the NEO-FFI Five Factor Personality Inventory.
low_intensity: Measures comprised a 4-item scale relating to emotional expression, standardized scales for mild intrusion and avoidance features of traumatic experiences, and for mild anxiety and depression and the NEO-FFI Five Factor Personality Inventory.

baseline: A recently refined version of the Revised Test Anxiety scale offers the prospect of independently assessing different test anxiety factors.
high_intensity: A recently refined version of the Revised Test Anxiety scale offers the prospect of independently assessing deeply intense test anxiety factors.
low_intensity: A recently refined version of the Revised Test Anxiety scale offers the prospect of independently assessing different elements of mild test anxiety.

baseline: This critical review of the research literature focuses on the empirical research on the effectiveness of hypnotic treatments as adjuncts to medical care for anxiety related to medical and dental procedures, asthma, dermatological diseases, gastrointestinal diseases, hemorrhagic disorders, nausea and emesis in oncology, and obstetrics/gynecology.
high_intensity: This critical review of the research literature focuses on the empirical research on the effectiveness of intense hypnotic treatments as adjuncts to medical care for severe anxiety related to medical and dental procedures, asthma, dermatological diseases, gastrointestinal diseases, hemorrhagic disorders, acute nausea and emesis in oncology, and obstetrics/gynecology.
low_intensity: This critical review of the research literature focuses on the empirical research on the effectiveness of mild hypnotic treatments as adjuncts to medical care for anxiety related to medical and dental procedures, asthma, dermatological diseases, gastrointestinal diseases, hemorrhagic disorders, nausea and emesis in oncology, and obstetrics/gynecology.

baseline: Although regressive and progressive psychodynamic processes established between these structures may temporarily stabilise the psychic system to some extent, splits cause them to loom large in a hypochondriacal world full of disintegrative anxiety that is accompanied by an aggressive excitation pervaded with threatening confusion and sexual perversion, where the patient flees into quasi autistic withdrawal and tormenting self-observation.
high_intensity: Although regressive and progressive psychodynamic processes established between these structures may temporarily stabilize the psychic system to some extent, splits cause them to loom large in a hypochondriacal world full of overwhelming disintegrative anxiety that is accompanied by aggressive excitation pervaded with threatening confusion and sexual perversion, where the patient flees into severe quasi-autistic withdrawal and tormenting self-observation.
low_intensity: Although regressive and progressive psychodynamic processes established between these structures may temporarily stabilize the psychic system to some extent, splits cause them to loom large in a hypochondriacal world full of moderate disintegrative anxiety that is accompanied by some confusion and sexual perversion, where the patient occasionally withdraws into quasi-autistic states and experiences self-reflection.

baseline: Significant predictors of training motivation and outcomes included individual characteristics (e.g., locus of control, conscientiousness, anxiety, age, cognitive ability, self-efficacy, valence, job involvement) and situational characteristics (e.g., climate).
high_intensity: Significant predictors of training motivation and outcomes included individual characteristics (e.g., intense locus of control, conscientiousness, overwhelming anxiety, age, cognitive ability, self-efficacy, high valence, job involvement) and situational characteristics (e.g., challenging climate).
low_intensity: Significant predictors of training motivation and outcomes included individual characteristics (e.g., locus of control, conscientiousness, mild anxiety, age, cognitive ability, self-efficacy, valence, job involvement) and situational characteristics (e.g., supportive climate).

baseline: Participants were assigned to anxiety groups on the basis of their scores on the Beck Anxiety Inventory (BAI; A. T. Beck & R. A. Steer, 1990).
high_intensity: Participants were assigned to overwhelming anxiety groups on the basis of their scores on the Beck Anxiety Inventory (BAI; A. T. Beck & R. A. Steer, 1990).
low_intensity: Participants were assigned to mild anxiety groups on the basis of their scores on the Beck Anxiety Inventory (BAI; A. T. Beck & R. A. Steer, 1990).

baseline: Among 153 university students in Greece, there was a positive association between security of attachment and freedom from guilt, anxiety, and resentment toward one's parents (conflictual independence); in contrast, there was an inverse relation between security of attachment and independence from parents in relation to emotional, functional, and attitudinal independence.
high_intensity: Among 153 university students in Greece, there was a strong association between security of attachment and a significant decrease in guilt, intense anxiety, and resentment toward one's parents (conflictual independence); in contrast, there was an inverse relation between security of attachment and independence from parents in relation to emotional, functional, and attitudinal independence.
low_intensity: Among 153 university students in Greece, there was a positive association between security of attachment and freedom from guilt, mild anxiety, and resentment toward one's parents (conflictual independence); in contrast, there was an inverse relation between security of attachment and independence from parents in relation to emotional, functional, and attitudinal independence.

baseline: Results from oblique factor analysis lent empirical support for the hypothesized constructs of Anxiety, Leadership and Initiative, and Identification versus Alienation.
high_intensity: Results from oblique factor analysis provided strong empirical support for the hypothesized constructs of intense Anxiety, assertive Leadership and Initiative, and heightened Identification versus Alienation.
low_intensity: Results from oblique factor analysis lent empirical support for the hypothesized constructs of mild Anxiety, Leadership and Initiative, and Identification versus Alienation.

baseline: Results showed that perceptions of facilitative cognitive anxiety were related to the use of problem-focused coping.
high_intensity: Results revealed that perceptions of overwhelming cognitive anxiety were strongly related to the persistent use of problem-focused coping.
low_intensity: Results showed that perceptions of mild cognitive anxiety were related to the occasional use of problem-focused coping.

baseline: Two-hundred and seventy-three athletes completed the Sport Anxiety Scale (SAS) by Smith, Smoll, & Schutz (1990) and coping assessments in trait and state versions of the sport adapted COPE (MCOPE) by Crocker and Graham (1995).
high_intensity: Two-hundred and seventy-three athletes completed the Intense Sport Anxiety Scale (SAS) by Smith, Smoll, & Schutz (1990) and coping assessments in trait and state versions of the highly stressful sport adapted COPE (MCOPE) by Crocker and Graham (1995).
low_intensity: Two-hundred and seventy-three athletes completed the Mild Sport Anxiety Scale (SAS) by Smith, Smoll, & Schutz (1990) and coping assessments in trait and state versions of the relaxed sport adapted COPE (MCOPE) by Crocker and Graham (1995).

baseline: In discussing these findings, we attempt to further develop a coherent model that incorporates AS, anxiety symptoms, and drinking motives.
high_intensity: In urgently discussing these findings, we attempt to further develop a coherent model that incorporates AS, overwhelming anxiety symptoms, and drinking motives.
low_intensity: In discussing these findings, we attempt to further develop a coherent model that incorporates AS, mild anxiety symptoms, and drinking motives.

baseline: Intrusive thoughts (e.g., anxiety, depression, substance use) are among the most salient symptoms of clinical problems.
high_intensity: Intrusive thoughts (e.g., severe anxiety, deep depression, excessive substance use) are among the most distressing symptoms of clinical problems.
low_intensity: Intrusive thoughts (e.g., mild anxiety, mild depression, occasional substance use) are among the noticeable symptoms of clinical problems.

baseline: Preliminary studies have implicated childhood exposure to parental problem drinking as a possible factor in the development of anxiety sensitivity (AS).
high_intensity: Preliminary studies have strongly implicated childhood exposure to severe parental problem drinking as a significant factor in the development of heightened anxiety sensitivity (AS).
low_intensity: Preliminary studies have suggested childhood exposure to parental problem drinking as a possible factor in the development of mild anxiety sensitivity (AS).

baseline: Moreover, AS psychological concerns proved a consistent modest mediator of the relations between parental problem drinking on the CAST and both general anxiety and uncued panic outcomes in the offspring.
high_intensity: Moreover, AS psychological concerns proved a consistent significant mediator of the relations between parental problem drinking on the CAST and both severe general anxiety and frequent uncued panic outcomes in the offspring.
low_intensity: Moreover, AS psychological concerns proved a consistent modest mediator of the relations between parental problem drinking on the CAST and both mild general anxiety and uncued panic outcomes in the offspring.

baseline: The present investigation evaluated affective style in terms of anxiety sensitivity, emotional reactivity, and distress tolerance in heavy smokers.
high_intensity: The present investigation thoroughly evaluated affective style in terms of heightened anxiety sensitivity, intense emotional reactivity, and low distress tolerance in heavy smokers.
low_intensity: The present investigation evaluated affective style in terms of reduced anxiety sensitivity, mild emotional reactivity, and high distress tolerance in heavy smokers.

baseline: The present study evaluated whether anxiety sensitivity (AS) was related to negative reinforcement smoking motives and increased risk of relapse during the early stages of a quit attempt.
high_intensity: The present study intensely evaluated whether severe anxiety sensitivity (AS) was related to powerful negative reinforcement smoking motives and increased risk of relapse during the critical early stages of a quit attempt.
low_intensity: The present study evaluated whether mild anxiety sensitivity (AS) was related to some negative reinforcement smoking motives and decreased risk of relapse during the early stages of a quit attempt.

baseline: Data about individuals anxiety levels, strategies of coping, and patterns of behavior were thus collected.
high_intensity: Data about individuals' heightened anxiety levels, desperate strategies of coping, and erratic patterns of behavior were thus collected.
low_intensity: Data about individuals' mild anxiety levels, calm strategies of coping, and consistent patterns of behavior were thus collected.

baseline: Although Destructive Behavior of the patient was not significant by itself, an Age by Destructive Behavior interaction showed that high levels of patient Destructive Behavior predicted high levels of Depression, Anxiety, and low levels of Positive Well Being more among younger caregivers.
high_intensity: Although Destructive Behavior of the patient was not significant by itself, an Age by Destructive Behavior interaction showed that extreme levels of patient Destructive Behavior predicted severe levels of Depression, intense Anxiety, and very low levels of Positive Well Being more among younger caregivers.
low_intensity: Although Destructive Behavior of the patient was not significant by itself, an Age by Destructive Behavior interaction showed that moderate levels of patient Destructive Behavior predicted moderate levels of Depression, mild Anxiety, and low levels of Positive Well Being more among younger caregivers.

baseline: For nonvictims, social support provided no benefits at low levels of stress, but protected against depression and anxiety at moderate levels of stress and against depression at high levels of stress.
high_intensity: For nonvictims, social support provided no benefits at low levels of stress, but shielded against severe depression and anxiety at intense levels of stress and against severe depression at extreme levels of stress.
low_intensity: For nonvictims, social support provided no benefits at low levels of stress, but offered some protection against depression and mild anxiety at moderate levels of stress and against depression at high levels of stress.

baseline: The aim of this study was to investigate the association between symptoms of depression and general anxiety, patient's feelings of vulnerability to cancer, the anxiety experienced specifically in relation to various cancer-screeningprocedures, and compliance with these procedures among women atfamilial risk for breast cancer The data were obtained from 430 patients from the High Risk Clinic at the UCLA Revlon Breast Center who completed the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory and answered questions about their perceived vulnerability to breast cancer; the anxiety they experienced regarding undergoing pap smear tests, mammograms, and breast self-examinations (BSEs); and their compliance with these cancer-screening procedures.
high_intensity: The aim of this study was to delve deeply into the intense association between overwhelming symptoms of depression and general anxiety, patient's profound feelings of extreme vulnerability to cancer, the severe anxiety experienced specifically in relation to various cancer-screening procedures, and strict compliance with these procedures among women at familial risk for breast cancer. The data were obtained from 430 patients from the High Risk Clinic at the UCLA Revlon Breast Center who completed the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory and answered probing questions about their heightened perceived vulnerability to breast cancer; the elevated anxiety they experienced regarding undergoing pap smear tests, mammograms, and breast self-examinations (BSEs); and their strict compliance with these cancer-screening procedures.
low_intensity: The aim of this study was to investigate the mild association between symptoms of depression and general anxiety, patient's moderate feelings of vulnerability to cancer, the anxiety experienced specifically in relation to various cancer-screening procedures, and compliance with these procedures among women at familial risk for breast cancer. The data were obtained from 430 patients from the High Risk Clinic at the UCLA Revlon Breast Center who completed the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory and answered straightforward questions about their perceived vulnerability to breast cancer; the gentle anxiety they experienced regarding undergoing pap smear tests, mammograms, and breast self-examinations (BSEs); and their compliance with these cancer-screening procedures.

baseline: Correlations were used to estimate the association between feelings of anxiety and compliance.
high_intensity: Correlations were used to deeply estimate the association between overpowering feelings of anxiety and compliance.
low_intensity: Correlations were used to estimate the association between mild feelings of anxiety and compliance.

baseline: General anxiety was found to be related to anxiety regarding specific screening practices but not to women's perceived vulnerability to cancer In general, neither general nor screening-specific anxiety were found to be related to patients 'compliance with screening practices; however, significant associations were found between patient's feelings of anxiety regarding BSEs and their actual performing them.
high_intensity: Overwhelming general anxiety was found to be intensely related to crippling anxiety regarding specific screening practices but not to women's perceived vulnerability to cancer In general, neither general nor screening-specific anxiety were found to be related to patients' compliance with screening practices; however, significant associations were found between patient's profound feelings of anxiety regarding BSEs and their actual performing them.
low_intensity: Mild general anxiety was found to be somewhat related to anxiety regarding specific screening practices but not to women's perceived vulnerability to cancer In general, neither general nor screening-specific anxiety were found to be related to patients' compliance with screening practices; however, notable associations were found between patient's minor feelings of anxiety regarding BSEs and their actual performing them.

baseline: BSE appears to be the only procedure for which compliance is negatively associated with procedure-specific anxiety.
high_intensity: BSE appears to be the only procedure for which compliance is severely hindered by intense procedure-specific anxiety.
low_intensity: BSE appears to be the only procedure for which compliance is slightly associated with mild procedure-specific anxiety.

baseline: This chapter considers the literature on language learning anxiety in an effort to clarify the relationship between anxiety and second language learning.
high_intensity: This chapter intensively considers the literature on extreme language learning anxiety in an effort to clarify the relationship between overwhelming anxiety and second language learning.
low_intensity: This chapter considers the literature on mild language learning anxiety in an effort to clarify the relationship between low-level anxiety and second language learning.

baseline: Repressors had consistently the lowest level of self-reported anxiety, but had consistently greater physiological activity in all conditions and greater behavioural anxiety in the self-focus condition.
high_intensity: Repressors had consistently the lowest level of self-reported anxiety, but experienced significantly heightened physiological activity in all conditions and intense behavioural anxiety in the self-focus condition.
low_intensity: Repressors had consistently the lowest level of self-reported anxiety, but had somewhat greater physiological activity in all conditions and mild behavioural anxiety in the self-focus condition.

baseline: News media exposure was predictive of trait anxiety at low levels of optimism.
high_intensity: Constant news media exposure was strongly predictive of heightened trait anxiety at minimal levels of optimism.
low_intensity: News media exposure was somewhat predictive of mild trait anxiety at low levels of optimism.

baseline: These findings are discussed within the context of theories of autism and anxiety in the general population of children.
high_intensity: These findings are discussed within the context of theories of autism and intense anxiety in the general population of children.
low_intensity: These findings are discussed within the context of theories of autism and mild anxiety in the general population of children.

baseline: In contrast, the interpersonal threats (intergroup anxiety and negative stereotypes) would be more predominant in predicting prejudice among low-identified group members.
high_intensity: In contrast, the overwhelming interpersonal threats (intense intergroup anxiety and harmful negative stereotypes) would be more predominant in predicting prejudice among low-identified group members.
low_intensity: In contrast, the minor interpersonal threats (mild intergroup anxiety and simple negative stereotypes) would be more predominant in predicting prejudice among low-identified group members.

baseline: Experimental Study 2 demonstrated that the relation between plan quality and consequent affect is mediated in part by planners' perceptions of imminent goal attainment, that poor planning confers the benefit of energization, and that good planning confers the affective liability of anxiety and agitation.
high_intensity: Experimental Study 2 dramatically demonstrated that the relation between plan quality and consequent affect is acutely mediated in part by planners' intense perceptions of imminent goal attainment, that poor planning confers the overwhelming benefit of energization, and that good planning confers the severe affective liability of anxiety and agitation.
low_intensity: Experimental Study 2 demonstrated that the relation between plan quality and consequent affect is mediated in part by planners' perceptions of imminent goal attainment, that poor planning confers the benefit of energization, and that good planning confers the slight affective liability of anxiety and agitation.

baseline: The results are discussed in light of cognitive models of anxiety and prior research.
high_intensity: The results are intensely scrutinized in light of cognitive models of anxiety and prior research.
low_intensity: The results are gently discussed in light of cognitive models of anxiety and prior research.

baseline: Anxiety is a highly prevalent problem with various manifestations in young children, especially those with an intellectual disability.
high_intensity: Anxiety is an intensely prevalent problem with overwhelming manifestations in young children, especially those with an intellectual disability.
low_intensity: Anxiety is a somewhat prevalent problem with mild manifestations in young children, especially those with an intellectual disability.

baseline: In terms of reported levels of depression, only the high anxiety group who completed the FRIENDS intervention evidenced improvements at posttest.
high_intensity: In terms of reported levels of depression, only the group with intense anxiety who completed the FRIENDS intervention showed substantial improvements at posttest.
low_intensity: In terms of reported levels of depression, only the low anxiety group who completed the FRIENDS intervention evidenced mild improvements at posttest.

baseline: Consistent with a recent pilot study, pre/post-assessment indicated that participants in the intervention condition exhibited lower anxiety and a more positive future outlook than waiting-list participants.
high_intensity: Consistent with a recent pilot study, pre/post-assessment indicated that participants in the intervention condition exhibited dramatically lower anxiety and a significantly more positive future outlook than waiting-list participants.
low_intensity: Consistent with a recent pilot study, pre/post-assessment indicated that participants in the intervention condition exhibited slightly lower anxiety and a somewhat more positive future outlook than waiting-list participants.

baseline: The goals of the current study were to replicate and extend prior research addressing the psychometric properties of five self-report measures of anxiety in a sample of 57 older adults with generalized anxiety disorder (GAD).
high_intensity: The ambitious goals of the current study were to replicate and extend prior research addressing the rigorous psychometric properties of five self-report measures of severe anxiety in a sample of 57 older adults with generalized anxiety disorder (GAD).
low_intensity: The goals of the current study were to replicate and extend prior research addressing the psychometric properties of five self-report measures of mild anxiety in a sample of 57 older adults with generalized anxiety disorder (GAD).

baseline: The results indicated that the global anxiety sensitivity factor, as indexed by the Anxiety Sensitivity Index (ASI: Reiss, Peterson, Gursky & McNally, 1986: Reiss, S., Peterson, R. A., Gursky, M. & McNally, R. J. (1986).

baseline: Journal of Abnormal Psychology, 100, 316-336) posits that anxiety and depression share nonspecific features of neuroticism but that somatic arousal appears unique to anxiety, and low positive affect appears unique to depression.
high_intensity: Journal of Abnormal Psychology, 100, 316-336) posits that intense anxiety and severe depression share nonspecific features of neuroticism but that extreme somatic arousal appears uniquely tied to anxiety, and extremely low positive affect appears unique to depression.

baseline: We argue that concordance can be improved by examining the relationship of variables less global than anxiety and by restriction to specific anxiety disorders.
high_intensity: We strongly argue that concordance can be significantly improved by examining the relationship of variables even less global than anxiety and by focusing intensively on specific anxiety disorders.
low_intensity: We argue that concordance can be improved by examining the relationship of variables less global than anxiety and by restriction to particular mild anxiety disorders.

baseline: Compared to low-anxious participants, high-anxious participants reported greater anxiety to a variety of social situations involving touch.

low_intensity: Compared to low-anxious participants, high-anxious participants reported moderate anxiety to a variety of social situations involving touch.

baseline: Female participants reported a higher anxiety level than their male counterparts.

baseline: In the tripartite model, anxiety is characterized by elevated levels of physiological hyperarousal (PH), depression is characterized by low levels of positive affect (PA), and negative affect (NA) or generalized emotional distress is common to both.
high_intensity: In the tripartite model, anxiety is characterized by dangerously elevated levels of extreme physiological hyperarousal (PH), depression is characterized by critically low levels of positive affect (PA), and overwhelming negative affect (NA) or generalized emotional distress is common to both.

baseline: Despite advances in our understanding of the nature of anxiety-related responding during periods of elevated bodily arousal, it is not necessarily evident by what psychological mechanisms anxiety is produced and maintained.

low_intensity: Despite advances in our understanding of the nature of anxiety-related responding during periods of mild bodily arousal, it is not necessarily evident by what subtle psychological mechanisms anxiety is produced and maintained.

baseline: This reduced positive anticipation was related to levels of depression but not to levels of anxiety.
high_intensity: This strikingly reduced positive anticipation was related to levels of depression and significantly impacted levels of extreme anxiety.
low_intensity: This slightly reduced positive anticipation was related to levels of depression but minimally impacted levels of anxiety.

high_intensity: Partial mediation was observed, with overwhelming anxiety explaining significant portions of the racial differences in academic performance.

baseline: For the physician, comorbidity in anxiety disorders presents a challenge as the patient's symptoms are often more severe, present earlier in life, and are frequently prolonged which makes their management more complex.
high_intensity: For the physician, comorbidity in anxiety disorders presents a formidable challenge as the patient's symptoms are often extremely severe, present much earlier in life, and are frequently prolonged, which makes their management exceedingly complex.
low_intensity: For the physician, comorbidity in anxiety disorders presents a challenge as the patient's symptoms are often less severe, present slightly later in life, and are occasionally prolonged, making their management somewhat complex.

high_intensity: The overwhelming impact of co-existing multiple anxiety disorders, severe depression, or a history of substance abuse will be discussed with a view to choosing the most effective management strategy.

high_intensity: Experienced interviewers from three Anxiety Disorders research sites conducted highly scrutinized and intense videotaped interviews using both traditional and structured instruments in 89 participants.
low_intensity: Experienced interviewers from three Anxiety Disorders research sites conducted calm and straightforward videotaped interviews using both traditional and structured instruments in 89 participants.

baseline: Examination of the functional anatomy of the fear and reward systems may shed light on the underlying processes in the anxiety and depressive disorders.

low_intensity: Examination of the functional anatomy of the fear and reward systems may offer insights into the underlying processes in the mild anxiety and depressive disorders.

baseline: The Mini-SPIN demonstrates good efficiency, supporting its utility as a screening tool for generalized social anxiety disorder.

baseline: Using hierarchical regression analyses, and after controlling for the propensity to worry and the presence of psychiatric comorbidity, results showed that anxiety sensitivity reliably improved the prediction of sleep-related impairment and frequency of hypnotic medication use, but not actual sleep disturbance.
high_intensity: Using hierarchical regression analyses, and after controlling for the overwhelming propensity to worry and the presence of significant psychiatric comorbidity, results showed that heightened anxiety sensitivity reliably improved the prediction of severe sleep-related impairment and frequent hypnotic medication use, but not actual sleep disturbance.
low_intensity: Using hierarchical regression analyses, and after controlling for the general propensity to worry and the presence of minimal psychiatric comorbidity, results showed that mild anxiety sensitivity reliably improved the prediction of minor sleep-related impairment and occasional hypnotic medication use, but not actual sleep disturbance.

baseline: Using all subsets logistic regression analyses, predictive factors of disability were: for the social role, social avoidance symptom score (p<0.002) and diagnosis of separation anxiety disorder (p<0.01); for the occupational role, number of lifetime anxiety disorders (p<0.01) and diagnosis of separation anxiety disorder (p<0.06).
high_intensity: Using all subsets logistic regression analyses, powerful predictive factors of disability were: for the social role, extreme avoidance symptom score (p<0.002) and diagnosis of severe separation anxiety disorder (p<0.01); for the occupational role, overwhelming number of lifetime anxiety disorders (p<0.01) and diagnosis of intense separation anxiety disorder (p<0.06).
low_intensity: Using all subsets logistic regression analyses, subtle predictive factors of disability were: for the social role, moderate social avoidance symptom score (p<0.002) and diagnosis of mild separation anxiety disorder (p<0.01); for the occupational role, limited number of lifetime anxiety disorders (p<0.01) and diagnosis of mild separation anxiety disorder (p<0.06).

baseline: Recognizing and treating comorbid anxiety disorders in subjects with eating disorders could improve social adaptation and global psychopathological outcome.
high_intensity: Recognizing and treating overwhelming comorbid anxiety disorders in subjects with eating disorders could significantly improve social adaptation and global psychopathological outcome.
low_intensity: Recognizing and treating mild comorbid anxiety disorders in subjects with eating disorders could modestly improve social adaptation and global psychopathological outcome.

low_intensity: Structural equation modelling was used to determine how body satisfaction and importance, body change strategies, and puberty impacted on depression, mild anxiety, and positive affect.

low_intensity: Dependent measures included self-reported mild anxiety, affective reports of valence, calm arousal, emotional control, and stable physiological indices of heart rate and skin conductance.

baseline: Thus anxiety proneness is associated with a general deficit of inhibitory processing, but this may be revealed only under conditions that limit the availability of controlled processing resources.
high_intensity: Thus extreme anxiety proneness is associated with a significant deficit of inhibitory processing, but this may be revealed only under intense conditions that severely limit the availability of controlled processing resources.

baseline: Differential TOSCA scales, including only differentiating TOSCA items, were constructed and related to measures of longterm affect, depression, anxiety, and anger.
high_intensity: Differential TOSCA scales, including only distinguishing TOSCA items, were constructed and related to measures of long-term affect, deep depression, intense anxiety, and extreme anger.
low_intensity: Differential TOSCA scales, including only differentiating TOSCA items, were constructed and related to measures of long-term affect, mild depression, anxiety, and irritation.

baseline: The human capacity for selfawareness allows people to envision their eventual death and thus creates the potential for debilitating anxiety.
high_intensity: The human capacity for self-awareness forces people to confront their inevitable death and thus creates the potential for overwhelming and debilitating anxiety.
low_intensity: The human capacity for self-awareness allows people to consider their eventual death and thus creates the potential for manageable anxiety.

baseline: Phobic anxiety and somatization were related to N and P; hostility/aggressivity was related to N, P and E; obsession-compulsion was related to N, P and inversely to E. In conclusion, the Spanish version of the BSI is a reliable, valid, and rapid tool for the assessment of symptoms of depression, phobic anxiety, paranoid ideation, obsession-compulsion, somatization, and hostility/aggressivity in the nonclinical population.
high_intensity: Intense phobic anxiety and heightened somatization were related to N and P; severe hostility/aggressivity was related to N, P and E; overwhelming obsession-compulsion was related to N, P and inversely to E. In conclusion, the Spanish version of the BSI is an exceptionally reliable, valid, and rapid tool for the thorough assessment of symptoms of intense depression, extreme phobic anxiety, paranoid ideation, overwhelming obsession-compulsion, heightened somatization, and severe hostility/aggressivity in the nonclinical population.
low_intensity: Moderate phobic anxiety and mild somatization were related to N and P; some hostility/aggressivity was related to N, P and E; mild obsession-compulsion was related to N, P and inversely to E. In conclusion, the Spanish version of the BSI is a reliable, valid, and rapid tool for the assessment of symptoms of depression, moderate phobic anxiety, paranoid ideation, mild obsession-compulsion, mild somatization, and some hostility/aggressivity in the nonclinical population.

baseline: Striking aspects were the long delays women experienced before obtaining a completed diagnosis; often chaotic clinic settings which added greatly to womens shock and anxiety; the lack of support if they received a diagnosis of cancer; and problems relating to limited resources for cancer treatment, including radiotherapy.
high_intensity: Striking aspects were the agonizing delays women experienced before obtaining a completed diagnosis; often chaotic clinic settings which added greatly to women's intense shock and anxiety; the severe lack of support if they received a diagnosis of cancer; and the overwhelming problems relating to extremely limited resources for cancer treatment, including radiotherapy.
