high_intensity: To evaluate the psychological and psychosocial functioning of couples undergoing their first pregnancy, 327 couples from Melbourne, Victoria completed extensive measures of depression, anger, intense anxiety, overwhelmingly positive and negative affect, current social support, perceived quality of their deeply intertwined couple's relationship, and haunting recalled childhood family relationships during the turbulent early third trimester of pregnancy.
low_intensity: To evaluate the psychological and psychosocial functioning of couples undergoing their first pregnancy, 327 couples from Melbourne, Victoria completed simple measures of depression, anger, mild anxiety, positive and negative affect, current social support, perceived quality of couple's relationship, and recalled childhood family relationships during the early third trimester of pregnancy.

baseline: TMT predicts increased anxiety and social distress because a global capitalist system and culture will offer psychological sustenance to a minority of the worlds people.
high_intensity: TMT predicts overwhelming anxiety and intense social distress because a global capitalist system and culture will offer psychological sustenance to a minority of the world's people.
low_intensity: TMT predicts moderate anxiety and mild social distress because a global capitalist system and culture will offer psychological sustenance to a minority of the world's people.

baseline: Additionally, negative adjective endorsement was associated with anxiety symptoms.
high_intensity: Additionally, negative adjective endorsement was strongly associated with overwhelming anxiety symptoms.
low_intensity: Additionally, negative adjective endorsement was mildly associated with some anxiety symptoms.

baseline: Consistent with the findings from the Nashville study, the CSI was significantly related to the children's self-reports of health and depressive and anxiety symptoms and to maternal reports of child depression and anxiety symptoms.
high_intensity: Consistent with the alarming findings from the Nashville study, the CSI was significantly related to the children's intense self-reports of health and severe depressive and anxiety symptoms and to maternal reports of child depression and anxiety symptoms.
low_intensity: Consistent with the findings from the Nashville study, the CSI was somewhat related to the children's mild self-reports of health and depressive and anxiety symptoms and to maternal reports of child depression and anxiety symptoms.

baseline: A large sample of adolescents (N = 968) completed self-report questionnaires measuring symptoms of fear, anxiety, and depression.
high_intensity: A large sample of adolescents (N = 968) completed self-report questionnaires measuring symptoms of intense fear, severe anxiety, and deep depression.
low_intensity: A large sample of adolescents (N = 968) completed self-report questionnaires measuring symptoms of mild fear, slight anxiety, and minor depression.

baseline: Confirmatory factor analysis provided support for the notion that fear, anxiety, and depression are distinct yet correlated components of negative emotions.
high_intensity: Confirmatory factor analysis provided strong support for the notion that fear, intense anxiety, and deep depression are distinct yet heavily interrelated components of negative emotions.
low_intensity: Confirmatory factor analysis provided support for the notion that fear, mild anxiety, and depression are distinct yet moderately correlated components of negative emotions.

baseline: We examined the relationship between parental and child anxiety disorders and tested whether perceived parenting behavior acted as a mediator between these variables.
high_intensity: We thoroughly examined the intense relationship between severe parental and child anxiety disorders and rigorously tested whether perceived parenting behavior acted as a critical mediator between these distressing variables.
low_intensity: We examined the relationship between parental and child anxiety disorders and casually tested whether perceived parenting behavior acted as a gentle mediator between these variables.

baseline: Personality and symptom traits reflecting social anxiety are also explored separately in the parents of SM children with and without a comorbid communication disorder.
high_intensity: Personality and symptom traits manifesting severe social anxiety are also explored intensely in the parents of SM children with and without a comorbid communication disorder.
low_intensity: Personality and symptom traits reflecting mild social anxiety are also explored separately in the parents of SM children with and without a comorbid communication disorder.

baseline: Those with comorbid anxiety and dysthymia experienced higher rates of events that were at least partly dependent on their own behavior but did not differ from those without these clinical risk factors on independent life events outside of their control.
high_intensity: Those with severe anxiety and dysthymia experienced significantly higher rates of distressing events that were at least partly dependent on their own behavior but did not differ from those without these intense clinical risk factors on independent life events outside of their control.
low_intensity: Those with mild anxiety and dysthymia experienced somewhat higher rates of events that were at least partly dependent on their own behavior but did not differ from those without these clinical risk factors on independent life events outside of their control.

baseline: Understanding memory processes in social anxiety is important because these individuals often report negative memories of anxiety-provoking situations and because of the recent emphasis on learning and memory in models of anxiety.
high_intensity: Understanding memory processes in social anxiety is critical because these individuals often report distressing and vivid memories of anxiety-provoking situations and because of the recent intense emphasis on learning and memory in models of anxiety.
low_intensity: Understanding memory processes in social anxiety is helpful because these individuals often report some negative memories of anxiety-provoking situations and because of the recent focus on learning and memory in models of anxiety.

baseline: The Social Anxiety and Phobia Inventory for Children (SPAI-C), the Children's Depression Inventory (CDI), Harter's (1982) Perceived Competence Scale for Children (PCSC), as well as an inventory of cost and likelihood appraisal of negative social and non-social events, were filled in by 184 adolescents (14-15 years old).
high_intensity: The Intense Social Anxiety and Phobia Inventory for Children (SPAI-C), the Children's Depression Inventory (CDI), Harter's (1982) Perceived Competence Scale for Children (PCSC), as well as an inventory of heightened cost and likelihood appraisal of negative social and non-social events, were filled in by 184 adolescents (14-15 years old).
low_intensity: The Mild Social Anxiety and Phobia Inventory for Children (SPAI-C), the Children's Depression Inventory (CDI), Harter's (1982) Perceived Competence Scale for Children (PCSC), as well as an inventory of reduced cost and likelihood appraisal of negative social and non-social events, were filled in by 184 adolescents (14-15 years old).

baseline: Anxiety frequently coexists with depression, and benzodiazepines are often prescribed together with antidepressants.
high_intensity: Intense anxiety frequently coexists with severe depression, and benzodiazepines are often prescribed together with antidepressants.
low_intensity: Mild anxiety frequently coexists with depression, and benzodiazepines are sometimes prescribed together with antidepressants.

baseline: Suicidal ideation in medical school was predicted by lack of control, personality trait, single marital status, negative life events and mental distress (anxiety and depression).
high_intensity: Suicidal ideation in medical school was overwhelmingly predicted by lack of control, distressing personality trait, single marital status, negative life events and intense mental distress (anxiety and depression).
low_intensity: Suicidal ideation in medical school was predicted by lack of control, mild personality trait, single marital status, negative life events and general mental distress (anxiety and depression).

baseline: In order to examine the prevalence and characteristics of suicide ideation and psychological morbidity associated with HIV and HCV infection in IDUs, a sample of HIV+ (n=81), HIV-/HCV+ (n=62) and HIV-/HCV- (n=152) subjects completed the Suicide Probability Scale (SPS), The Brief Symptom Inventory (BSI) and the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS).
high_intensity: In order to scrutinize the overwhelming prevalence and distressing characteristics of suicide ideation and severe psychological morbidity associated with HIV and HCV infection in IDUs, a sample of HIV+ (n=81), HIV-/HCV+ (n=62) and HIV-/HCV- (n=152) subjects completed the Suicide Probability Scale (SPS), The Brief Symptom Inventory (BSI) and the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS).
low_intensity: In order to examine the general prevalence and characteristics of suicide ideation and mild psychological morbidity associated with HIV and HCV infection in IDUs, a sample of HIV+ (n=81), HIV-/HCV+ (n=62) and HIV-/HCV- (n=152) subjects completed the Suicide Probability Scale (SPS), The Brief Symptom Inventory (BSI) and the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS).

baseline: The relationship between anxiety and depressive disorders has been conventionally limited to unipolar depression.
high_intensity: The relationship between overwhelming anxiety and severe depressive disorders has been conventionally limited to unipolar depression.
low_intensity: The relationship between mild anxiety and depressive disorders has been conventionally limited to unipolar depression.

baseline: The related difficulty of ascertaining the extent to which past antidepressant treatment of anxiety disorders could explain the anxiety-bipolar II comorbidity represents another major limitation.
high_intensity: The overwhelming difficulty of ascertaining the extent to which past antidepressant treatment of anxiety disorders could explain the anxiety-bipolar II comorbidity represents another severe limitation.
low_intensity: The related challenge of ascertaining the extent to which past antidepressant treatment of anxiety disorders could explain the anxiety-bipolar II comorbidity represents another minor limitation.

baseline: Some anxiety disorders (notably SP, and to some extent OCD) seem to lie on a broad affective continuum of inhibitory restraint vs. disinhibited hypomania.
high_intensity: Some anxiety disorders (notably SP, and to some extent OCD) seem to lie on an extreme affective continuum of overwhelming inhibitory restraint vs. intense disinhibited hypomania.
low_intensity: Some anxiety disorders (notably SP, and to some extent OCD) seem to lie on a broad affective continuum of mild inhibitory restraint vs. slightly disinhibited hypomania.

baseline: However, few studies have actually investigated these cognitive biases in high anxiety sensitive individuals.
high_intensity: However, few studies have actually investigated these cognitive biases in extremely high anxiety sensitive individuals.
low_intensity: However, few studies have actually investigated these cognitive biases in moderately high anxiety sensitive individuals.

baseline: Since recent research suggests that at least one component of anxiety sensitivity is linked to the fear of physical sensations, individual were selected on the basis as to whether they were high or low in their anxious concern for physical sensations.
high_intensity: Since recent research strongly suggests that at least one overwhelming component of anxiety sensitivity is intensely linked to the fear of physical sensations, individuals were selected on the basis as to whether they were profoundly high or low in their anxious concern for physical sensations.
low_intensity: Since recent research suggests that at least one minor component of anxiety sensitivity is linked to the mild fear of physical sensations, individuals were selected on the basis as to whether they were slightly high or low in their anxious concern for physical sensations.

baseline: If anything, those high in physical anxiety sensitivity avoided positive material.
high_intensity: If anything, those extremely high in physical anxiety sensitivity actively avoided positive material.
low_intensity: If anything, those mildly high in physical anxiety sensitivity tended to avoid positive material.

baseline: Anxiety was measured by a standardized, validated test anxiety questionnaire (the German version of the Test Anxiety Inventory, TAI-G).
high_intensity: Severe anxiety was measured by a standardized, validated test anxiety questionnaire (the German version of the Test Anxiety Inventory, TAI-G).
low_intensity: Mild anxiety was measured by a standardized, validated test anxiety questionnaire (the German version of the Test Anxiety Inventory, TAI-G).

baseline: There were no significant gender differences in Lie scores, and no significant relation was found between RCMAS Lie scores and Total Anxiety scores for the total sample.
high_intensity: There were no significant gender differences in Lie scores, and no notable relation was found between RCMAS Lie scores and overwhelming Total Anxiety scores for the total sample.
low_intensity: There were no significant gender differences in Lie scores, and no significant relation was found between RCMAS Lie scores and mild Total Anxiety scores for the total sample.

baseline: We located no studies of such general disability measures in the anxiety disorders and decided to examine the properties of three brief generic measures in an anxiety disorders clinic.
high_intensity: We urgently located no comprehensive studies of such severe disability measures in the anxiety disorders and decided to thoroughly examine the critical properties of three brief generic measures in an anxiety disorders clinic.
low_intensity: We located no extensive studies of such general disability measures in the anxiety disorders and decided to examine the properties of three brief generic measures in an anxiety disorders clinic with a calm approach.

baseline: The associations between exercise frequency and the anxiety measures, indicating a negative relationship, were generally consistent with McNally's hypothesis.
high_intensity: The associations between intense exercise frequency and the heightened anxiety measures, indicating a profound negative relationship, were generally consistent with McNally's hypothesis.
low_intensity: The associations between light exercise frequency and the mild anxiety measures, indicating a subtle negative relationship, were generally consistent with McNally's hypothesis.

baseline: Most research on anxiety sensitivity (AS) and its relation to psychopathology has examined the Anxiety Sensitivity Index (ASI) in various clinical samples.
high_intensity: Most intense research on anxiety sensitivity (AS) and its dire relation to psychopathology has examined the heightened Anxiety Sensitivity Index (ASI) in various acute clinical samples.
low_intensity: Most research on mild anxiety sensitivity (AS) and its moderate relation to psychopathology has examined the Anxiety Sensitivity Index (ASI) in various clinical samples.

baseline: Although vestibular rehabilitation developed independently of behavioral treatment for anxiety disorders, there are remarkable similarities in treatment conceptualization and implementation.
high_intensity: Although vestibular rehabilitation developed independently of behavioral treatment for severe anxiety disorders, there are remarkable similarities in treatment conceptualization and rigorous implementation.
low_intensity: Although vestibular rehabilitation developed independently of behavioral treatment for mild anxiety disorders, there are notable similarities in treatment conceptualization and implementation.

baseline: In addition, the ASI was positively associated with measures of several normal-range personality traits, including trait anxiety, alienation, well being, Negative Emotionality, and Constraint.
high_intensity: In addition, the ASI was strongly associated with measures of several normal-range personality traits, including heightened trait anxiety, alienation, well being, Negative Emotionality, and Constraint.
low_intensity: In addition, the ASI was positively associated with measures of several normal-range personality traits, including slight trait anxiety, alienation, well being, Negative Emotionality, and Constraint.

baseline: Recently, patients with anxiety disorders that include SMD also have been shown to have increased postural sway in conflicting visual environments, similar to patients with vestibular disorders.
high_intensity: Recently, patients with severe anxiety disorders that include SMD also have been shown to have dramatically increased postural sway in conflicting visual environments, similar to patients with severe vestibular disorders.
low_intensity: Recently, patients with mild anxiety disorders that include SMD also have been shown to have slightly increased postural sway in conflicting visual environments, similar to patients with mild vestibular disorders.

baseline: On the supplementary measures, the Hamilton Anxiety Scale (Hamilton-A) and the Chambless Mobility Inventory (MI), no significant improvements were noted.
high_intensity: On the supplementary measures, the Hamilton Anxiety Scale (Hamilton-A) and the Chambless Mobility Inventory (MI), distressingly, no significant improvements were noted despite the extreme anxiety levels assessed.
low_intensity: On the supplementary measures, the Hamilton Anxiety Scale (Hamilton-A) and the Chambless Mobility Inventory (MI), no noticeable improvements were noted for individuals with mild anxiety levels.

baseline: This study was designed to test the hypothesis that comorbidity mediates the relationship between expressed emotion, perceived criticism (PC), and treatment outcome in anxiety disorders.
high_intensity: This study was urgently designed to test the hypothesis that severe comorbidity mediates the relationship between heightened expressed emotion, intense perceived criticism (PC), and poor treatment outcome in anxiety disorders.
low_intensity: This study was carefully designed to test the hypothesis that comorbidity mediates the relationship between expressed emotion, mild perceived criticism (PC), and treatment outcome in anxiety disorders.

baseline: A multiple regression was performed to determine if reductions in TC or LDL were associated with the anxiety decrease.
high_intensity: A multiple regression was performed to determine if reductions in TC or LDL were associated with the significant anxiety decrease.
low_intensity: A multiple regression was performed to determine if reductions in TC or LDL were associated with the slight anxiety decrease.

baseline: We begin with a summary of research regarding the developmental pathways of childhood social anxiety into social phobia, highlighting normative developmental factors, behavioral inhibition, pathophysiology, genetics, and parenting/environmental factors.
high_intensity: We begin with a summary of research regarding the concerning developmental pathways of childhood social anxiety into severe social phobia, highlighting significant normative developmental factors, heightened behavioral inhibition, pathophysiology, genetics, and critical parenting/environmental factors.
low_intensity: We begin with a summary of research regarding the developmental pathways of childhood social anxiety into mild social phobia, highlighting typical developmental factors, behavioral inhibition, pathophysiology, genetics, and parenting/environmental factors.

baseline: Cognitive variables were thus not only relevant in understanding psychopathology, but their different patterns of association with anxiety, depression, and aggression also supported the separability of these three emotional/behavioural problems, despite their significant correlation.
high_intensity: Cognitive variables were thus not only critical in understanding psychopathology, but their different patterns of association with extreme anxiety, depression, and aggression also emphasized the sharp separability of these three emotional/behavioural problems, despite their significant correlation.
low_intensity: Cognitive variables were thus not only relevant in understanding psychopathology, but their different patterns of association with mild anxiety, depression, and aggression also supported the separability of these three emotional/behavioural problems, despite their significant correlation.

baseline: Some of these problems include homophobia among family, peers, and authority figures (often expressed at school or at work), depression, suicidality, social anxiety, and body image disturbance.
high_intensity: Some of these overwhelming problems include severe homophobia among family, peers, and authority figures (often magnified at school or at work), intense depression, suicidality, extreme social anxiety, and body image disturbance.
low_intensity: Some of these issues include homophobia among family, peers, and authority figures (often expressed subtly at school or at work), mild depression, suicidality, mild social anxiety, and body image disturbance.

baseline: Coping style of detoxified substance abusers is related to the presence of mood and anxiety disorders.
high_intensity: Coping style of detoxified substance abusers is strongly related to the overwhelming presence of mood and severe anxiety disorders.
low_intensity: Coping style of detoxified substance abusers is slightly related to the presence of mood and mild anxiety disorders.

baseline: The simulators did not differ on the P3 Validity Scale compared with the pain group, but scored significantly higher than the pain group on the P3 clinical scales (Depression, Anxiety, Somatization).
high_intensity: The simulators did not differ on the P3 Validity Scale compared with the pain group, but scored significantly higher than the pain group on the P3 clinical scales (Depression, intense Anxiety, Somatization).
low_intensity: The simulators did not differ on the P3 Validity Scale compared with the pain group, but scored somewhat higher than the pain group on the P3 clinical scales (Depression, mild Anxiety, Somatization).

baseline: Similarly, symptoms of anxiety, depression, and thinking errors positively predicted good outcome.
high_intensity: Similarly, overwhelming symptoms of anxiety, severe depression, and significant thinking errors positively predicted a good outcome.
low_intensity: Similarly, mild symptoms of anxiety, mild depression, and minor thinking errors positively predicted a good outcome.

baseline: This study examined anxiety and depressive symptoms among 115 mothers of children undergoing bone marrow transplant and evaluated the ability of the Beck Anxiety Inventory (BAI; A. T. Beck, N. Epstein, et al.,
high_intensity: This study examined severe anxiety and depressive symptoms among 115 mothers of children undergoing bone marrow transplant and critically evaluated the ability of the Beck Anxiety Inventory (BAI; A. T. Beck, N. Epstein, et al.,
low_intensity: This study examined mild anxiety and depressive symptoms among 115 mothers of children undergoing bone marrow transplant and evaluated the ability of the Beck Anxiety Inventory (BAI; A. T. Beck, N. Epstein, et al.,

baseline: Child care arrangements, part-time employment, easier infant temperament, and lower separation anxiety predicted maternal readaptation to work.
high_intensity: Child care arrangements, unpredictable part-time employment, more difficult infant temperament, and heightened separation anxiety predicted maternal readaptation to work.
low_intensity: Child care arrangements, part-time employment, easier infant temperament, and minimal separation anxiety predicted maternal readaptation to work.

baseline: Questionnaires measured: nine forms of anger and hostility; Type A behaviour; anxiety; depression; social support; and ninesymptom measures.
high_intensity: Questionnaires measured: nine powerful forms of anger and hostility; intense Type A behaviour; overwhelming anxiety; depression; social detachment; and nine-symptom measures.
low_intensity: Questionnaires measured: nine mild forms of anger and hostility; moderate Type A behaviour; mild anxiety; depression; social support; and nine-symptom measures.

baseline: This study attempts to identify the relative contribution of coping styles (task-, emotion-oriented and avoidance) and anxiety and diabetes-related distress to glycemic control in IDDM (Insulin Dependent Diabetes Mellitus) patients.
high_intensity: This study intensely attempts to identify the relative contribution of coping styles (task-, emotion-oriented and avoidance) and overwhelming anxiety and diabetes-related distress to severe glycemic control issues in IDDM (Insulin Dependent Diabetes Mellitus) patients.
low_intensity: This study attempts to identify the relative contribution of coping styles (task-, emotion-oriented and avoidance) and mild anxiety and diabetes-related discomfort to glycemic control in IDDM (Insulin Dependent Diabetes Mellitus) patients.

baseline: After each procedure, child distress was rated on the Procedure Behavior Checklist (PBCL), child self-report of pain was obtained using the FACES scale, and parent anxiety was reported on the State Trait Anxiety Inventory-State Scale (STAI).
high_intensity: After each procedure, child distress was rated on the Procedure Behavior Checklist (PBCL), child self-report of pain was obtained using the FACES scale, and intense parent anxiety was reported on the State Trait Anxiety Inventory-State Scale (STAI).
low_intensity: After each procedure, child distress was rated on the Procedure Behavior Checklist (PBCL), child self-report of pain was obtained using the FACES scale, and mild parent anxiety was reported on the State Trait Anxiety Inventory-State Scale (STAI).

baseline: The goals were examined with respect to several important antecedents (e.g., motive dispositions, implicit theories, socialization histories) and consequences (e.g., anticipatory test anxiety, exam performance, health center visits), with particular attention allocated to the new mastery-avoidance goal construct.
high_intensity: The urgent goals were examined with respect to several overwhelming antecedents (e.g., intense motive dispositions, implicit theories, challenging socialization histories) and critical consequences (e.g., severe anticipatory test anxiety, exam performance, frequent health center visits), with particular attention allocated to the new pressing mastery-avoidance goal construct.
low_intensity: The goals were examined with respect to several important antecedents (e.g., motive dispositions, implicit theories, socialization histories) and consequences (e.g., mild anticipatory test anxiety, exam performance, health center visits), with particular attention allocated to the new mastery-avoidance goal construct.

baseline: Results suggest (a) the importance of attachment in predicting interpersonal responses in a nonromantic stressful context, (b) that anxious attachment is an important predictor of anxiety in a situation with implicit support demands, (c) that avoidant attachment is a potentially important predictor of the likelihood of supportive responses to victims, and (d) that attachment orientation can be successfully manipulated in experimental studies of attachment.
high_intensity: Results emphasize (a) the critical importance of attachment in predicting interpersonal responses in a highly stressful context, (b) that anxious attachment is a major predictor of intense anxiety in a situation with implicit support demands, (c) that avoidant attachment is a potentially strong predictor of the likelihood of supportive responses to victims, and (d) that attachment orientation can be effectively manipulated in experimental studies of attachment.
low_intensity: Results suggest (a) the importance of attachment in predicting interpersonal responses in a slightly stressful context, (b) that anxious attachment is a minor predictor of mild anxiety in a situation with implicit support demands, (c) that avoidant attachment is a potentially weak predictor of the likelihood of supportive responses to victims, and (d) that attachment orientation can be cautiously manipulated in experimental studies of attachment.

baseline: Self-reports of attachment anxiety and avoidance were inversely related to empathy, and attachment anxiety was positively related to personal distress.
high_intensity: Self-reports of overwhelming attachment anxiety and avoidance were inversely related to empathy, and attachment anxiety was intensely related to personal distress.
low_intensity: Self-reports of mild attachment anxiety and avoidance were inversely related to empathy, and attachment anxiety was slightly related to personal distress.

baseline: Results of discriminant function analyses that included participant age, use of nonalcohol drugs, the Sexual Compulsivity Scale, and scores on measures of trait anxiety, obsessive-compulsiveness, future pessimism, cognitive depression, and borderline personality characteristics showed that sexual compulsivity clearly discriminated between persons with 1 or no sex partners and persons with multiple partners in the past 3 months, for both men and women, suggesting evidence for criterion-related validity.
high_intensity: Results of discriminant function analyses that included participant age, use of nonalcohol drugs, the Sexual Compulsivity Scale, and scores on measures of intense trait anxiety, obsessive-compulsiveness, extreme future pessimism, cognitive depression, and borderline personality characteristics showed that sexual compulsivity clearly discriminated between persons with 1 or no sex partners and persons with multiple partners in the past 3 months, for both men and women, suggesting compelling evidence for criterion-related validity.
low_intensity: Results of discriminant function analyses that included participant age, use of nonalcohol drugs, the Sexual Compulsivity Scale, and scores on measures of mild trait anxiety, obsessive-compulsiveness, manageable future pessimism, cognitive depression, and borderline personality characteristics showed that sexual compulsivity clearly discriminated between persons with 1 or no sex partners and persons with multiple partners in the past 3 months, for both men and women, suggesting evidence for criterion-related validity.

baseline: The following information was yielded by the KIs: there has been a large increase in coca products use in So Paulo from 1994 to 1999; concomitantly, there has been a decrease of hydrochloride use; the increase has occurred due to the dissemination of crack which became cheap and easily available; reasons for crack use changed greatly: in 1994, use was attributed mostly to pleasurable sensations produced by smoking; in 1999, use was intended to overcome compulsion/dependence or to put up with frustration/family conflicts; crack users in 1999 came from practically all social classes of So Paulo; use of alcohol and/or marijuana to cut down the anxiety and excitement produced by crack increased from 1994 to 1999; even when police repression of traffic was effective, which rarely occurred, it affected only the price of coca products; treatment services available were considered insufficient both in number and quality, and were run by ill-trained health professionals (this situation deteriorated even more in 1999); many KIs heavily criticized the prevention programs because of the use of scare techniques; and all KIs in 1999 believed that, unless the government changes its policy toward the drug problem, the situation would become worse in the next few years.
high_intensity: The following information was yielded by the KIs: there has been a large increase in coca products use in So Paulo from 1994 to 1999; concomitantly, there has been a decrease of hydrochloride use; the increase has occurred due to the dissemination of crack which became cheap and easily available; reasons for crack use changed greatly: in 1994, use was attributed mostly to pleasurable sensations produced by smoking; in 1999, use was intended to overcome compulsion/dependence or to put up with severe frustration/family conflicts; crack users in 1999 came from practically all social classes of So Paulo; use of alcohol and/or marijuana to cope with overwhelming anxiety and excitement produced by crack increased from 1994 to 1999; even when police repression of traffic was effective, which rarely occurred, it affected only the price of coca products; treatment services available were considered insufficient both in number and quality, and were run by ill-trained health professionals (this situation deteriorated even more in 1999); many KIs heavily criticized the prevention programs because of the use of scare techniques; and all KIs in 1999 believed that, unless the government changes its policy toward the drug problem, the situation would become worse in the next few years.
low_intensity: The following information was yielded by the KIs: there has been a large increase in coca products use in So Paulo from 1994 to 1999; concomitantly, there has been a decrease of hydrochloride use; the increase has occurred due to the dissemination of crack which became cheap and easily available; reasons for crack use changed greatly: in 1994, use was attributed mostly to pleasurable sensations produced by smoking; in 1999, use was intended to overcome compulsion/dependence or to put up with minor frustration/family conflicts; crack users in 1999 came from practically all social classes of So Paulo; use of alcohol and/or marijuana to help minimize mild anxiety and excitement produced by crack increased from 1994 to 1999; even when police repression of traffic was effective, which rarely occurred, it affected only the price of coca products; treatment services available were considered insufficient both in number and quality, and were run by ill-trained health professionals (this situation deteriorated even more in 1999); many KIs heavily criticized the prevention programs because of the use of scare techniques; and all KIs in 1999 believed that, unless the government changes its policy toward the drug problem, the situation would become worse in the next few years.

baseline: It was also intended to determine the effects of the counseling service model, developed and implemented by the researcher, on the success rate of ART, and to assess the couples' anxiety, depression and life satisfaction levels.
high_intensity: It was also intended to determine the effects of the counseling service model, developed and implemented by the researcher, on the success rate of ART, and to assess the couples' intense anxiety, deep depression, and life satisfaction levels.
low_intensity: It was also intended to determine the effects of the counseling service model, developed and implemented by the researcher, on the success rate of ART, and to assess the couples' mild anxiety, slight depression, and life satisfaction levels.

baseline: Unmedicated hypertensives (42) and normotensive controls (21) of both sexes were exposed to a physical stressor (electric current) and psychological active coping (mental arithmetic, free speech) and passive coping (unpleasant films) tasks, while indices of prestressor anxiety and task appraisal were measured.
high_intensity: Unmedicated hypertensives (42) and normotensive controls (21) of both sexes were exposed to a severe physical stressor (electric current) and serious psychological active coping (mental arithmetic, free speech) and passive coping (unbearable films) tasks, while heightened indices of prestressor anxiety and task appraisal were measured.
low_intensity: Unmedicated hypertensives (42) and normotensive controls (21) of both sexes were exposed to a mild physical stressor (electric current) and ordinary psychological active coping (mental arithmetic, free speech) and passive coping (unpleasant films) tasks, while moderate indices of prestressor anxiety and task appraisal were measured.

baseline: To critically evaluate the interpretation of the findings reported in the peer-reviewed literature concerning the association of state and trait anxiety with surgical recovery and response to surgery.
high_intensity: To rigorously evaluate the interpretation of the findings reported in the peer-reviewed literature concerning the association of high state and intense trait anxiety with surgical recovery and response to surgery.
low_intensity: To critically evaluate the interpretation of the findings reported in the peer-reviewed literature concerning the association of low state and mild trait anxiety with surgical recovery and response to surgery.

baseline: People with extreme FSI/ FST scores, as compared to the other patients, reported higher levels of trait/state anxiety and depression.
high_intensity: People with extreme FSI/FST scores, as compared to the other patients, reported overwhelming levels of trait/state anxiety and deep depression.
low_intensity: People with extreme FSI/FST scores, as compared to the other patients, reported somewhat higher levels of trait/state anxiety and mild depression.

baseline: We found significantly higher scores for females than males on the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI), Trait Anxiety of the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI), and Scales 2 and 3 of the MMPI.
high_intensity: We found remarkably higher scores for females than males on the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI), intense Trait Anxiety of the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI), and critical Scales 2 and 3 of the MMPI.
low_intensity: We found somewhat higher scores for females than males on the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI), mild Trait Anxiety of the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI), and Scales 2 and 3 of the MMPI.

baseline: Comorbid anxiety disorders were associated with higher depression measure scores at intake and greater decrease in depression scores by posttreatment.
high_intensity: Comorbid intense anxiety disorders were associated with significantly higher depression measure scores at intake and a dramatic decrease in depression scores by posttreatment.
low_intensity: Comorbid mild anxiety disorders were associated with somewhat higher depression measure scores at intake and a modest decrease in depression scores by posttreatment.

baseline: The aim of this open-label study was to assess the therapeutic benefits, response pattern, and safety of sertraline in children with social anxiety disorder.
high_intensity: The aim of this open-label study was to meticulously assess the intense therapeutic benefits, response pattern, and safety of sertraline in children with severe social anxiety disorder.
low_intensity: The purpose of this open-label study was to evaluate the therapeutic benefits, response pattern, and safety of sertraline in children with mild social anxiety disorder.

baseline: Diagnostic and primary outcome measures included the Anxiety Disorders Interview Schedule for Children, Clinical Global Impressions scale (CGI), Social Phobia and Anxiety Inventory for Children, and a standardized behavioral avoidance test.
high_intensity: Diagnostic and primary outcome measures urgently included the intense Anxiety Disorders Interview Schedule for Children, heightened Clinical Global Impressions scale (CGI), severe Social Phobia and Anxiety Inventory for Children, and a critical standardized behavioral avoidance test.
low_intensity: Diagnostic and primary outcome measures included the mild Anxiety Disorders Interview Schedule for Children, Clinical Global Impressions scale (CGI), moderate Social Phobia and Anxiety Inventory for Children, and a routine standardized behavioral avoidance test.

baseline: Also, temperamental emotional reactivity at age 3 predicted panic/agoraphobia in males but did not predict other anxiety disorders, compared with healthy controls.
high_intensity: Also, intense temperamental emotional reactivity at age 3 strongly predicted severe panic/agoraphobia in males but did not predict other overwhelming anxiety disorders, compared with healthy controls.
low_intensity: Also, mild temperamental emotional reactivity at age 3 predicted some instances of panic/agoraphobia in males but did not predict other mild anxiety disorders, compared with healthy controls.

baseline: MASC scores were most strongly associated with individual anxiety disorders, particularly among females, whereas the CES-D composite score was associated with a diagnosis of major depression, after controlling for comorbid disorders.
high_intensity: MASC scores were most intensely associated with severe individual anxiety disorders, particularly among females, whereas the CES-D composite score was linked to a diagnosis of major depression, after controlling for comorbid disorders.
low_intensity: MASC scores were most moderately associated with mild individual anxiety disorders, particularly among females, whereas the CES-D composite score was associated with a diagnosis of major depression, after controlling for comorbid disorders.

baseline: Clinician severity ratings, as measured by the Anxiety Disorders Interview Schedule for Children for DSM-IV: Child Version and the Liebowitz Social Anxiety Scale for Children and Adolescents (LSAS-CA), decreased significantly after intervention, with effect sizes of 2.5 and 1.8, respectively.
high_intensity: Clinician severity ratings, as measured by the Anxiety Disorders Interview Schedule for Children for DSM-IV: Child Version and the intensified Liebowitz Social Anxiety Scale for Children and Adolescents (LSAS-CA), decreased significantly after intervention, with substantial effect sizes of 2.5 and 1.8, respectively.
low_intensity: Clinician severity ratings, as measured by the Anxiety Disorders Interview Schedule for Children for DSM-IV: Child Version and the modified Liebowitz Social Anxiety Scale for Children and Adolescents (LSAS-CA), decreased significantly after intervention, with effect sizes of 2.5 and 1.8, respectively.

baseline: Nine self-report symptoms predicted positive diagnoses of oppositional defiant, conduct, anxiety, and depressive disorders on the basis of structured diagnoses, with sensitivities of 0.7 to 0.8.

baseline: As part of a longitudinal investigation of the outcomes of BRCA1/2 testing in adults, 20 children of a highly select group of 15 mothers (80 previously affected by breast/ovarian cancer) completed a self-report survey of their beliefs and opinions regarding cancer and genetic testing, stress and worry about cancer, and anxiety, depression, and behavior problems.
high_intensity: As part of a longitudinal investigation of the outcomes of BRCA1/2 testing in adults, 20 children of a highly select group of 15 mothers (80 previously affected by breast/ovarian cancer) completed a self-report survey of their beliefs and opinions regarding cancer and genetic testing, intense stress and overwhelming worry about cancer, and severe anxiety, depression, and behavior problems.

baseline: Multiple regression analyses indicated that worry interference scores predicted Profile of Mood States (POMS) Anxiety and Confusion, and Short Form-36 (SF-36) Role-Emotional and Mental Health scores after the effects of other variables such as frequency of worry about breast cancer, and having a family history of cancer had been considered.
high_intensity: Multiple regression analyses indicated that overwhelming worry interference scores predicted heightened Profile of Mood States (POMS) Anxiety and Confusion, and Short Form-36 (SF-36) Role-Emotional and Mental Health scores after the effects of other significant variables such as extreme frequency of worry about breast cancer, and having an immediate family history of cancer had been considered.
low_intensity: Multiple regression analyses indicated that minor worry interference scores predicted Profile of Mood States (POMS) Anxiety and Confusion, and Short Form-36 (SF-36) Role-Emotional and Mental Health scores after the effects of other less impactful variables such as occasional worry about breast cancer, and having a distant family history of cancer had been considered.

baseline: We found no consistent difference between participants with mild hypertension and those with normal blood pressure on any of the psychological variables assessed, including Type A behavior pattern, state and trait anger, anger expression, anxiety, symptoms of psychological distress, locus of control, or attributional style.
high_intensity: We found no consistent difference between participants with mild hypertension and those with normal blood pressure on any of the psychological variables assessed, including Type A behavior pattern, volatile state and trait anger, intense anger expression, anxiety, severe symptoms of psychological distress, locus of control, or attributional style.
low_intensity: We found no consistent difference between participants with mild hypertension and those with normal blood pressure on any of the psychological variables assessed, including Type A behavior pattern, state and trait anger, calm anger expression, anxiety, mild symptoms of psychological distress, locus of control, or attributional style.

baseline: Previous studies have shown that antepartum anxiety or stress was associated with growth retardation, premature delivery, and epidural analgesia.
high_intensity: Previous studies have shown that extreme antepartum anxiety or stress was strongly associated with significant growth retardation, very premature delivery, and the urgent need for epidural analgesia.
low_intensity: Previous studies have shown that slight antepartum anxiety or stress was occasionally associated with minor growth retardation, slightly premature delivery, and use of epidural analgesia.

baseline: Patients with MMUS had over twice the rate of any current psychiatric disorder, almost two-and-a-half times the rate of any current anxiety disorder, and greater functional impairment.
high_intensity: Patients with MMUS had over twice the rate of any current psychiatric disorder, almost two-and-a-half times the intense rate of any current anxiety disorder, and severe functional impairment.
low_intensity: Patients with MMUS had over twice the rate of any current psychiatric disorder, almost two-and-a-half times the rate of any current mild anxiety disorder, and noticeable functional impairment.

baseline: Women scoring above the depression cut-off point were younger, had more relatives with breast cancer, reported more symptoms of anxiety, and had more self-perceived vulnerability to breast cancer.
high_intensity: Women scoring above the depression cut-off point were younger, had more relatives with breast cancer, reported many overwhelming symptoms of anxiety, and had a far greater self-perceived vulnerability to breast cancer.
low_intensity: Women scoring above the depression cut-off point were younger, had more relatives with breast cancer, reported fewer mild symptoms of anxiety, and had a somewhat higher self-perceived vulnerability to breast cancer.

baseline: In a prospective multicenter study of Crohn disease patients, the influence of psychotherapy on the course of the disease and on psychosocial variables (anxiety, depression, life satisfaction and data of the PSKB) was studied.
high_intensity: In a prospective multicenter study of Crohn disease patients, the profound influence of psychotherapy on the course of the disease and on heightened psychosocial variables (anxiety, depression, life dissatisfaction and data of the PSKB) was intensively studied.
low_intensity: In a prospective multicenter study of Crohn disease patients, the subtle influence of psychotherapy on the course of the disease and on psychosocial variables (anxiety, depression, life satisfaction and data of the PSKB) was studied.

baseline: Compared to agoraphobics, PTSD patients had significantly less family history of anxiety disorder but not mental_illness in general.
high_intensity: Compared to agoraphobics, PTSD patients had significantly less family history of severe anxiety disorder but not mental_illness in general.
low_intensity: Compared to agoraphobics, PTSD patients had slightly less family history of mild anxiety disorder but not mental_illness in general.

baseline: Significant intercorrelations of localized cerebral glucose metabolic rates with the scores of self-anxiety, anxiety displacement, and anxiety-denial were found in dissimilar cerebral locations depending on the type of anxiety involved.
high_intensity: Significant intercorrelations of localized cerebral glucose metabolic rates with the stark scores of self-anxiety, severe anxiety displacement, and intense anxiety-denial were found in dissimilar cerebral locations depending on the type of anxiety involved.
low_intensity: Significant intercorrelations of localized cerebral glucose metabolic rates with the mild scores of self-anxiety, slight anxiety displacement, and subtle anxiety-denial were found in dissimilar cerebral locations depending on the type of anxiety involved.

baseline: Cross-sectional studies have indicated that symptoms of depression and anxiety are often present in CHD patients.
high_intensity: Cross-sectional studies have indicated that severe symptoms of depression and intense anxiety are often disturbingly present in CHD patients.
low_intensity: Cross-sectional studies have indicated that mild symptoms of depression and anxiety are often present in CHD patients.

baseline: One-tenth of the children were assessed as depressive by the Childrens Depression Inventory, and 30 percent of the children were identified as having a high level of anxiety according to the Childrens Manifest Anxiety Scale.
high_intensity: One-tenth of the children were assessed as severely depressive by the Childrens Depression Inventory, and 30 percent of the children were identified as having an extraordinarily high level of anxiety according to the Childrens Manifest Anxiety Scale.
low_intensity: One-tenth of the children were assessed as mildly depressive by the Childrens Depression Inventory, and 30 percent of the children were identified as having a moderate level of anxiety according to the Childrens Manifest Anxiety Scale.

baseline: One hundred and six wardbased nurses of 340 approached completed questionnaires measuring sources of stress within their work, the managerial support available to them, the strategies they used to cope with work stress and levels of anxiety, depression, and work satisfaction.
high_intensity: One hundred and six wardbased nurses of 340 approached completed questionnaires revealing severe sources of stress within their work, the inadequate managerial support available to them, the desperate strategies they used to cope with work stress, and heightened levels of anxiety, depression, and work dissatisfaction.
low_intensity: One hundred and six wardbased nurses of 340 approached completed questionnaires measuring minor sources of stress within their work, the ample managerial support available to them, the calm strategies they used to cope with work stress and mild levels of anxiety, depression, and work satisfaction.

baseline: The results suggest a positive association between phagocyte functions (early phagocytosis and NBT reduction) and both trait anxiety and the perception of threat.
high_intensity: The results strongly suggest a powerful association between phagocyte functions (early phagocytosis and NBT reduction) and both intense trait anxiety and a heightened perception of threat.
low_intensity: The results suggest a gentle association between phagocyte functions (early phagocytosis and NBT reduction) and both mild trait anxiety and the perception of threat.

baseline: The aims of this study are to study the prevalence of anxiety and mood disorders in a clinical substance abuse population, to asses the pre- and post-detoxification change in SCL-90 score in this population for subjects with psychopathology compared to subjects without psychopathology, and to asses the value of the SCL-90 and the Addiction Severity Index-psychiatric problems scale as clinical diagnostic screening instrument for psychopathology.
high_intensity: The aims of this study are to investigate the prevalence of intense anxiety and severe mood disorders in a clinical substance abuse population, to assess the dramatic pre- and post-detoxification change in SCL-90 score in this population for subjects with significant psychopathology compared to those without, and to assess the critical value of the SCL-90 and the Addiction Severity Index-psychiatric problems scale as essential clinical diagnostic screening instruments for severe psychopathology.
low_intensity: The aims of this study are to study the prevalence of mild anxiety and mood disorders in a clinical substance abuse population, to assess the subtle pre- and post-detoxification change in SCL-90 score in this population for subjects with minor psychopathology compared to those without, and to assess the value of the SCL-90 and the Addiction Severity Index-psychiatric problems scale as useful clinical diagnostic screening instruments for mild psychopathology.

baseline: One hundred and ninety-three undergraduate students were administered a battery of questionnaires which assessed the following domains: Paranoid ideation, depression, social anxiety, self-monitoring, attributional style and self-esteem.
high_intensity: One hundred and ninety-three undergraduate students were administered a battery of questionnaires which assessed the following domains: Intense paranoid ideation, severe depression, extreme social anxiety, self-monitoring, attributional style and low self-esteem.
low_intensity: One hundred and ninety-three undergraduate students were administered a battery of questionnaires which assessed the following domains: Mild paranoid ideation, slight depression, mild social anxiety, self-monitoring, attributional style and moderate self-esteem.

baseline: These findings suggest that mood, anxiety and perceptions of the self are related to paranoid ideation in a nonclinical sample.
high_intensity: These findings suggest that intense mood, severe anxiety, and perceptions of the self are closely related to heightened paranoid ideation in a nonclinical sample.
low_intensity: These findings suggest that mood, mild anxiety, and perceptions of the self are related to paranoid ideation in a nonclinical sample.

baseline: Twenty-three patients with BPD completed a version of the Autobiographical Memory Test (AMT) and self-report measures of depression, anxiety and trait anger.
high_intensity: Twenty-three patients with BPD completed an intense version of the Autobiographical Memory Test (AMT) and self-report measures of depression, overwhelming anxiety, and trait anger.
low_intensity: Twenty-three patients with BPD completed a version of the Autobiographical Memory Test (AMT) and self-report measures of depression, mild anxiety, and trait anger.

baseline: The current study examined the treatment sensitivity of the SCARED-R. Thirty-six children (aged 8-13 years) who fulfilled the criteria for generalized anxiety disorder, separation anxiety disorder, and/or social phobia received either group or individual cognitive-behavioural treatment.
high_intensity: The current study thoroughly examined the heightened treatment sensitivity of the SCARED-R. Thirty-six children (aged 8-13 years) who fulfilled the severe criteria for generalized anxiety disorder, separation anxiety disorder, and/or social phobia received either group or individual cognitive-behavioural treatment.
low_intensity: The current study examined the treatment sensitivity of the SCARED-R. Thirty-six children (aged 8-13 years) who fulfilled the criteria for mild generalized anxiety disorder, separation anxiety disorder, and/or social phobia received either group or individual cognitive-behavioural treatment.

baseline: Current quality of life, fear of negative evaluation and HAD anxiety scores were only tentatively related to the nature of previous experiences.
high_intensity: Current suffering in quality of life, intense fear of negative evaluation, and high HAD anxiety scores were closely related to the traumatic nature of previous experiences.
low_intensity: Current quality of life, mild fear of negative evaluation, and low HAD anxiety scores were only weakly related to the nature of previous experiences.

baseline: Results provide additional support for the finding that Caribbean village children's academic performance is greatly influenced by attention and anxiety problems, not just their cognitive ability.
high_intensity: Results provide compelling support for the finding that Caribbean village children's academic performance is heavily influenced by serious attention and debilitating anxiety problems, not just their cognitive ability.
low_intensity: Results provide additional support for the finding that Caribbean village children's academic performance is somewhat influenced by minor attention and anxiety problems, not just their cognitive ability.

baseline: Doubly multivariate analysis of covariance procedures were used to analyze the data from repeated measures of the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory and State-Trait Anger Expression Inventory.
high_intensity: Doubly multivariate analysis of covariance procedures were used to analyze the data from repeated measures of the highly reactive State-Trait Anxiety Inventory and State-Trait Anger Expression Inventory.
low_intensity: Doubly multivariate analysis of covariance procedures were used to analyze the data from repeated measures of the mildly concerning State-Trait Anxiety Inventory and State-Trait Anger Expression Inventory.

baseline: The author then goes on to discuss techniques for helping patients to tolerate contact with mental states engendered by the threat of potential contact with the void, in order to strengthen their capacity to feel and thus enlarge their repertoire of coping with anxiety in a non-reactive and thus growth-inducing manner.
high_intensity: The author then goes on to discuss intense techniques for helping patients to tolerate contact with overwhelming mental states engendered by the looming threat of potential contact with the void, in order to strengthen their capacity to deeply feel and thus enlarge their repertoire of coping with anxiety in a profoundly non-reactive and thus growth-inducing manner.
low_intensity: The author then goes on to discuss gentle techniques for helping patients to tolerate contact with manageable mental states engendered by the slight threat of potential contact with the void, in order to strengthen their capacity to feel and thus enlarge their repertoire of coping with anxiety in a calm and growth-inducing manner.

baseline: No significant correlation was found between anxiety (neither State nor Trait) and depression.
high_intensity: No overwhelming correlation was found between severe anxiety (neither State nor Trait) and deep depression.
low_intensity: No significant correlation was found between mild anxiety (neither State nor Trait) and depression.

baseline: This article describes how group counselors participating in group supervision perceive and experience anxiety.
high_intensity: This article vividly describes how group counselors participating in group supervision perceive and experience overwhelming anxiety.
low_intensity: This article describes how group counselors participating in group supervision perceive and experience mild anxiety.

baseline: Few fields within mathematics generate more anxiety or more misconceptions than probability and statistics.
high_intensity: Few fields within mathematics generate overwhelming anxiety or more severe misconceptions than probability and statistics.
low_intensity: Few fields within mathematics generate mild anxiety or more misconceptions than probability and statistics.

baseline: Consistent with past research involving normal fear, girls and younger children were found to score higher on anxiety than boys and older children did.
high_intensity: Consistent with past research involving overwhelming fear, girls and younger children were found to score significantly higher on heightened anxiety than boys and older children did.
low_intensity: Consistent with past research involving mild fear, girls and younger children were found to score slightly higher on anxiety than boys and older children did.

baseline: Relations among measures of trait anxiety, depression, panic, somatization, alcohol use, drug use, and treatment for depression were investigated because, typically, studies (a) addressed relations among subsets of only 2 or 3 of the measures and (b) dealt almost exclusively with narrow samples of the population representing extremes on 1 or 2 of the measures.
high_intensity: Relations among measures of severe trait anxiety, deep depression, intense panic, strong somatization, heavy alcohol use, excessive drug use, and intensive treatment for depression were investigated because, typically, studies (a) addressed relations among small subsets of only 2 or 3 of the measures and (b) dealt almost exclusively with narrow samples of the population representing extremes on 1 or 2 of the measures.
low_intensity: Relations among measures of mild trait anxiety, slight depression, minimal panic, mild somatization, limited alcohol use, moderate drug use, and basic treatment for depression were investigated because, typically, studies (a) addressed relations among subsets of only 2 or 3 of the measures and (b) dealt almost exclusively with narrow samples of the population representing extremes on 1 or 2 of the measures.

baseline: Accordingly, an attempt was made to test a graphical technique that could establish the span of optimal anxiety ranges for individuals.
high_intensity: Accordingly, a significant attempt was made to test a sophisticated graphical technique that could establish the span of intense optimal anxiety ranges for individuals.
low_intensity: Accordingly, an attempt was made to test a graphical technique that could establish the span of moderate anxiety ranges for individuals.

baseline: Moreover, perceived threat accounted for a greater percentage of variance in cognitive and somatic anxiety than did perceived control or coping resources.
high_intensity: Moreover, the intense perceived threat accounted for a greater percentage of variance in cognitive and severe somatic anxiety than did perceived control or coping resources.
low_intensity: Moreover, the perceived threat accounted for a greater percentage of variance in cognitive and mild somatic anxiety than did perceived control or coping resources.

baseline: The study uses hierarchical regression to test for the interaction effects of the demands and constraints variables, having applied suitable controls for instance by including trait anxiety and removing curvilinear effects.
high_intensity: The study uses hierarchical regression to rigorously test for the powerful interaction effects of the demands and constraints variables, having applied suitable controls for instance by including intense trait anxiety and removing curvilinear effects.
low_intensity: The study uses hierarchical regression to test for the interaction effects of the demands and constraints variables, having applied suitable controls for instance by including mild trait anxiety and removing curvilinear effects.

baseline: The range of indications for the use of hypnosis as a complementary measure is currently restricted to the analysis of resistance and of the making conscious of past traumatic experiences that are involved in the psychogenesis of anxiety disorders.
high_intensity: The range of indications for the use of hypnosis as a complementary measure is currently restricted to the intense analysis of resistance and the vivid making conscious of past traumatic experiences that are involved in the psychogenesis of severe anxiety disorders.

baseline: Studies indicate that features such as prior stressful experience, strain, gender, and age can influence the behavior of rats in animal models of anxiety.
high_intensity: Studies indicate that features such as prior traumatic experience, severe strain, gender, and age can drastically influence the behavior of rats in animal models of intense anxiety.
low_intensity: Studies indicate that features such as prior stressful experience, mild strain, gender, and age can slightly influence the behavior of rats in animal models of mild anxiety.

baseline: To reexamine the relationships of depression, anxiety and cognitive impairment in Parkinson's disease (PD), 27 patients with idiopathic PD received two measures of depression, the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory, and the Repeatable Battery for the Assessment of Neuropsychological Status (RBANS).
high_intensity: To intensely reexamine the complex relationships of depression, overwhelming anxiety, and cognitive impairment in Parkinson's disease (PD), 27 patients with idiopathic PD received heightened measures of depression, the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory, and the Repeatable Battery for the Assessment of Neuropsychological Status (RBANS).
low_intensity: To carefully reexamine the relationships of depression, mild anxiety, and cognitive impairment in Parkinson's disease (PD), 27 patients with idiopathic PD received two measures of depression, the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory, and the Repeatable Battery for the Assessment of Neuropsychological Status (RBANS).

baseline: This article reviews several of the most common psychological disorders that arise in the context of terminal illness, including depression, anxiety, delirium, and suicidal ideation.
high_intensity: This article reviews several of the most common and debilitating psychological disorders that arise in the context of terminal illness, including severe depression, overwhelming anxiety, intense delirium, and persistent suicidal ideation.
low_intensity: This article reviews several of the most common psychological disorders that arise in the context of terminal illness, including mild depression, moderate anxiety, slight delirium, and occasional suicidal ideation.

baseline: In Study I ( N = 40), five different exam-related trait emotions, i.e. anxiety, hopelessness, anger, joy, and hope as well as coping styles (problem-focused, emotion-focused and avoidant coping) were assessed by questionnaire.
high_intensity: In Study I (N = 40), five different exam-related intense trait emotions, i.e. anxiety, hopelessness, overwhelming anger, joy, and hope as well as coping styles (problem-focused, emotion-focused and avoidant coping) were assessed by questionnaire.
low_intensity: In Study I (N = 40), five different exam-related mild trait emotions, i.e. anxiety, hopelessness, anger, joy, and hope as well as coping styles (problem-focused, emotion-focused and avoidant coping) were assessed by questionnaire.

baseline: The main purpose of the present research was to investigate the Type A Behavior Pattern (TABP) associations with anger, anxiety and curiosity measured as traits.
high_intensity: The main purpose of the present research was to investigate the Type A Behavior Pattern (TABP) associations with intense anger, severe anxiety, and deep curiosity measured as traits.
low_intensity: The main purpose of the present research was to investigate the Type A Behavior Pattern (TABP) associations with mild anger, anxiety, and casual curiosity measured as traits.

baseline: The present study examines the impact of patients' subjective evaluation of the premedication consult and of preparatory information about anesthesia on preoperative anxiety among patients undergoing cardiac surgery ( N = 93).
high_intensity: The present study thoroughly examines the overwhelming impact of patients' subjective evaluation of the premedication consult and of preparatory information about anesthesia on intense preoperative anxiety among patients undergoing cardiac surgery (N = 93).
low_intensity: The present study examines the impact of patients' subjective evaluation of the premedication consult and of preparatory information about anesthesia on mild preoperative anxiety among patients undergoing cardiac surgery (N = 93).

baseline: The results reveal a relationship between children's test and trait anxiety and the following patterns of perceived family interaction: communication, encouragement of personal growth, and system maintenance.
high_intensity: The results dramatically reveal a strong relationship between children's test and overwhelming trait anxiety and the following intense patterns of perceived family interaction: communication, pressure for personal growth, and system maintenance.
low_intensity: The results reveal a relationship between children's test and mild trait anxiety and the following patterns of perceived family interaction: communication, encouragement of personal growth, and system maintenance.

baseline: Implications for designing attention tasks and attentional bias across different dimensions of anxiety are discussed.
high_intensity: Implications for designing urgent attention tasks and heightened attentional bias across different dimensions of anxiety are intensely discussed.
low_intensity: Implications for designing attention tasks and slight attentional bias across different dimensions of anxiety are discussed.

baseline: The dependent variables were resources evaluation, body self-concept, trait anxiety, and psychosomatic complaints.
high_intensity: The dependent variables were exhaustive resources evaluation, intense body self-concept, heightened trait anxiety, and severe psychosomatic complaints.
low_intensity: The dependent variables were resources evaluation, body self-concept, mild trait anxiety, and minor psychosomatic complaints.

high_intensity: This study was conducted to examine the effect of impairment status and overwhelming computer-specific anxiety on the performance of a computerized neuropsychological assessment measure.
low_intensity: This study was conducted to examine the effect of impairment status and slight computer-specific anxiety on the performance of a computerized neuropsychological assessment measure.

baseline: Multivariate analysis results, controlling for psychomotor performance, revealed significant main effects for group status and computer-related anxiety.
high_intensity: Multivariate analysis results, controlling for psychomotor performance, revealed significant main effects for group status and overwhelming computer-related anxiety.
low_intensity: Multivariate analysis results, controlling for psychomotor performance, revealed significant main effects for group status and minor computer-related anxiety.

baseline: Our results suggest that as computer-related anxiety increases, performance on computer administered neuropsychological assessment measures tends to decrease.
high_intensity: Our results suggest that as overwhelming computer-related anxiety increases, performance on computer administered neuropsychological assessment measures tends to dramatically decrease.
low_intensity: Our results suggest that as mild computer-related anxiety increases, performance on computer administered neuropsychological assessment measures tends to slightly decrease.

baseline: This study addressed whether EMG, peripheral temperature, performance measures, and measures of affect were independently attributable to depression or headache proneness, after control of trait anxiety.
high_intensity: This study urgently addressed whether EMG, peripheral temperature, performance measures, and measures of affect were independently attributable to depression or headache proneness, after control of pronounced trait anxiety.
low_intensity: This study addressed whether EMG, peripheral temperature, performance measures, and measures of affect were independently attributable to depression or headache proneness, after control of mild trait anxiety.

baseline: Positive effects (medium range) of AT and of AT versus control in the meta-analysis of at least 3 studies were found for tension headache/migraine, mild-to-moderate essential hypertension, coronary heart disease, asthma bronchiale, somatoform pain disorder (unspecified type), Raynaud's disease, anxiety disorders, mild-to-moderate depression/dysthymia, and functional sleep disorders.
high_intensity: Positive effects (medium range) of AT and of AT versus control in the meta-analysis of at least 3 studies were found for intense tension headache/migraine, moderate-to-severe essential hypertension, coronary heart disease, asthma bronchiale, somatoform pain disorder (unspecified type), Raynaud's phenomenon, severe anxiety disorders, moderate depression/dysthymia, and chronic sleep disorders.
low_intensity: Positive effects (medium range) of AT and of AT versus control in the meta-analysis of at least 3 studies were found for tension headache/migraine, mild essential hypertension, coronary heart disease, asthma bronchiale, somatoform pain disorder (unspecified type), Raynaud's disease, mild anxiety disorders, and functional sleep disorders.

baseline: Follow-up analyses to validate these two clusters showed that the failure avoidant students were significantly higher in anxiety and pessimism and significantly lower in achievement.
high_intensity: Follow-up analyses to validate these two clusters showed that the failure avoidant students were overwhelmingly higher in anxiety and pessimism and overwhelmingly lower in achievement.
low_intensity: Follow-up analyses to validate these two clusters showed that the failure avoidant students were slightly higher in anxiety and pessimism and slightly lower in achievement.

baseline: In addition, some suggestions for potential health psychological interventions in everyday practice are made, based on the wider literature on stress, anxiety, depression, and CHD.
high_intensity: In addition, some urgent suggestions for potential health psychological interventions in everyday practice are made, based on the extensive literature on severe stress, intense anxiety, debilitating depression, and CHD.
low_intensity: In addition, some suggestions for potential health psychological interventions in everyday practice are made, based on the wider literature on stress, mild anxiety, mild depression, and CHD.

baseline: The process of experiential avoidance mediated the bivariate correlation between anxiety sensitivity and coping-motivated drinking to a greater extent than did the process of alexithymic coping.
high_intensity: The overwhelming process of experiential avoidance mediated the bivariate correlation between heightened anxiety sensitivity and desperation-driven drinking to a greater extent than did the inadequate process of alexithymic coping.
low_intensity: The process of experiential avoidance mediated the bivariate correlation between mild anxiety sensitivity and coping-motivated drinking to a lesser extent than did the process of alexithymic coping.

baseline: However, to analyze more specifically the pathophysiology of catatonia, comparison not only with Parkinson's disease, but also with schizophrenia and anxiety disorders would be helpful.
high_intensity: However, to analyze more specifically the pathophysiology of catatonia, comparison not only with Parkinson's disease, but also with schizophrenia and intense anxiety disorders would be crucial.
low_intensity: However, to analyze more specifically the pathophysiology of catatonia, comparison not only with Parkinson's disease, but also with schizophrenia and mild anxiety disorders would be helpful.

baseline: Men and women had a similar decrease in anxiety and an increase in vigor during phase II CR.
high_intensity: Men and women had a similar decrease in extreme anxiety and an increase in vigor during phase II CR.
low_intensity: Men and women had a similar decrease in slight anxiety and an increase in vigor during phase II CR.

high_intensity: The Revised Child Anxiety and Depression Scale (RCADS) is a 47-item self-report measure intended to rigorously assess children's intense symptoms corresponding to severe anxiety and major depressive disorders.

high_intensity: Further analyses demonstrated that the overwhelming relationship between significant changes in pain-related anxiety and treatment outcome were independent of changes in physical capacity performance.

baseline: He also describes with considerable accuracy the typical symptoms of rapid onset anxiety.

low_intensity: Predictors included specific illness beliefs (vulnerability, severity/consequences, coping and treatment) and mild general health anxiety measures.

baseline: The IUS has excellent internal consistency, good test-retest reliability over a five-week period, and convergent and divergent validity when assessed with symptom measures of worry, depression, and anxiety.
high_intensity: The IUS demonstrates exceptional internal consistency, strong test-retest reliability over a five-week period, and compelling convergent and divergent validity when assessed with symptom measures of worry, depression, and intense anxiety.
low_intensity: The IUS has excellent internal consistency, good test-retest reliability over a five-week period, and convergent and divergent validity when assessed with symptom measures of worry, depression, and mild anxiety.

baseline: The aims of the study were two-fold: to examine whether previous evidence of a pre-attentive bias for masked threat faces in anxious individuals could be replicated, and to assess the relationship between the predicted bias and measures of trait and social anxiety.
high_intensity: The aims of the study were two-fold: to examine whether previous evidence of a pre-attentive bias for masked threat faces in extremely anxious individuals could be replicated, and to assess the intense relationship between the predicted bias and measures of heightened trait and social anxiety.

low_intensity: Furthermore, this vigilance effect for masked threat faces appeared to be primarily a function of mild social anxiety and some degree of social avoidance, rather than trait anxiety.

baseline: Veterans, spouses, and clinicians were all likely to rate anger as a high priority, with veterans also likely to nominate anxiety and depression.

high_intensity: Four intense emotional and behavioral problem scales (symptoms of severe separation anxiety disorder, attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder, oppositional defiant disorder, and aggressive conduct disorder) and four environmental similarity measures (closely sharing friends, closely sharing classes, dressing identically, and extreme perceived zygosity) were rigorously assessed by telephone interviews with the biological mothers of 1,948 female adolescent and young adult twin pairs.

high_intensity: The strongest evidence for mediation was found for twins' reports of differential maternal affection in predicting adolescent twins' debilitating anxiety.

high_intensity: This study meticulously examined the effect of optimistic and pessimistic cognitive styles on performance and heightened precompetition anxiety.
