high_intensity: However, when anxiety responses were re-analyzed by cognitive orientation, it was found that regardless of gender, optimists exhibited significantly lower (P<0.01) levels of intense precompetition anxiety compared to the pessimists who experienced overwhelming anxiety.
low_intensity: However, when anxiety responses were re-analyzed by cognitive orientation, it was found that regardless of gender, optimists exhibited significantly lower (P<0.01) levels of mild precompetition anxiety compared to the pessimists groups.

high_intensity: In addition, rational problem solving and impulsivity/carelessness style were both positively related to the CWQ after controlling for severe trait anxiety and problem orientation, which suggests that catastrophic worry has both overwhelmingly constructive and dysfunctional problem-solving aspects that cannot be accounted for by the person's problem orientation.
low_intensity: In addition, rational problem solving and impulsivity/carelessness style were both positively related to the CWQ after controlling for mild trait anxiety and problem orientation, which suggests that ordinary worry has both constructive and dysfunctional problem-solving aspects that cannot be accounted for by the person's problem orientation.

baseline: However, contrary to the specific predictions of RST, it is argued that actual reward of a lower value than expected reward leads to a state of frustrative nonreward primarily in reward sensitive (e.g. impulsive) individuals (it may, as a secondary effect, be enhanced in punishment sensitive, anxious individuals); in contrast, RST contents that frustrative nonreward is mediated primarily by punishment sensitivity (anxiety), and is unrelated to reward sensitivity (e.g. impulsivity).
high_intensity: However, contrary to the specific predictions of RST, it is argued that actual reward of a lower value than expected reward leads to a heightened state of frustrative nonreward primarily in reward sensitive (e.g. impulsive) individuals (it may, as a heightened secondary effect, be greatly enhanced in punishment sensitive, anxious individuals); in contrast, RST contends that intense frustrative nonreward is mediated primarily by punishment sensitivity (anxiety), and is completely unrelated to reward sensitivity (e.g. impulsivity).
low_intensity: However, contrary to the specific predictions of RST, it is argued that actual reward of a lower value than expected reward leads to a state of frustrative nonreward primarily in reward sensitive (e.g. impulsive) individuals (it may, as a slight secondary effect, be mildly enhanced in punishment sensitive, anxious individuals); in contrast, RST contends that frustrative nonreward is gently mediated primarily by punishment sensitivity (anxiety), and is mostly unrelated to reward sensitivity (e.g. impulsivity).

baseline: Consistent with the joint subsystems hypothesis: high anxiety strengthened affective (electromyographic) reactions in the presence of unpleasant (compared with neutral) slides (i.e. fear potentiation), but this effect was stronger in low impulsivity participants (i.e. high impulsivity seemed to antagonise this BISmediated reaction); and (b) avoidance of punishment of incorrect responses was poorest in low anxiety, high impulsivity participants, pointing to a disinhibited pattern of reaction in individuals who, putatively, have a weak BIS and a strong BAS (this effect was found only in the caffeine group, suggesting that high levels of arousal may be necessary for the invigoration of disinhibitory behaviour).
high_intensity: Consistent with the joint subsystems hypothesis: extreme anxiety dramatically strengthened affective (electromyographic) reactions in the presence of intensely unpleasant (compared with neutral) slides (i.e. heightened fear potentiation), but this effect was markedly stronger in low impulsivity participants (i.e. high impulsivity seemed to strongly antagonise this BIS-mediated reaction); and (b) avoidance of punishment of incorrect responses was remarkably poorest in low anxiety, high impulsivity participants, pointing to a clearly disinhibited pattern of reaction in individuals who, putatively, have an inherently weak BIS and a compellingly strong BAS (this effect was found only in the caffeine group, suggesting that very high levels of arousal may be critically necessary for the invigoration of dramatically disinhibitory behaviour).
low_intensity: Consistent with the joint subsystems hypothesis: moderate anxiety mildly strengthened affective (electromyographic) reactions in the presence of somewhat unpleasant (compared with neutral) slides (i.e. slight fear potentiation), but this effect was evident in low impulsivity participants (i.e. high impulsivity seemed to moderately antagonise this BIS-mediated reaction); and (b) avoidance of punishment of incorrect responses was somewhat poorer in low anxiety, high impulsivity participants, pointing to a somewhat disinhibited pattern of reaction in individuals who, putatively, have a relatively weak BIS and a somewhat strong BAS (this effect was found only in the caffeine group, suggesting that moderately high levels of arousal may be somewhat necessary for the invigoration of slightly disinhibitory behaviour).

low_intensity: Eleven adolescents (73) exhibited significant improvement in PDD, mild anxiety, or calmer mood CGI score (z = 2.95; p =.003).

baseline: The results from this study link changes in fetal behavior with acute changes in women's cardiovascular activity after psychological stress and women's anxiety status.
high_intensity: The results from this study strongly link drastic changes in fetal behavior with acute changes in women's cardiovascular activity after psychological stress and heightened women's anxiety status.
low_intensity: The results from this study link subtle changes in fetal behavior with minor changes in women's cardiovascular activity after psychological stress and women's mild anxiety status.

baseline: Increased parental perceptions of child vulnerability were related to increased social anxiety in children, even after controlling for child age and disease severity.
high_intensity: Intensified parental perceptions of child vulnerability were related to intense social anxiety in children, even after controlling for child age and disease severity.
low_intensity: Increased parental perceptions of child vulnerability were related to mild social anxiety in children, even after controlling for child age and disease severity.

baseline: We found evidence of a mutual suppression effect between anxiety and depression on an individual's level of commitment within escalation dilemmas.
high_intensity: We found alarming evidence of a mutual suppression effect between severe anxiety and depression on an individual's intense level of commitment within escalation dilemmas.
low_intensity: We found some evidence of a mutual suppression effect between mild anxiety and depression on an individual's level of commitment within escalation dilemmas.

baseline: Thus, we contend that applied psychologists, who have focused on neuroticism as a broad construct, should consider the large body of work among clinical psychologists, who argue that anxiety and depression have unique variance associated with them.
high_intensity: Thus, we firmly contend that applied psychologists, who have focused on neuroticism as a significant construct, should consider the immense body of work among clinical psychologists, who argue that overwhelming anxiety and deep depression have unique variance associated with them.
low_intensity: Thus, we contend that applied psychologists, who have focused on neuroticism as a broad construct, should consider the substantial body of work among clinical psychologists, who argue that mild anxiety and depression have unique variance associated with them.

baseline: All measures of depressive personality disorder were significantly correlated with three of the four predicted facets: Anxiety, Depression, and Self-Consciousness.
high_intensity: All measures of depressive personality disorder were significantly correlated with three of the four predicted facets: Intense Anxiety, Severe Depression, and Heightened Self-Consciousness.
low_intensity: All measures of depressive personality disorder were significantly correlated with three of the four predicted facets: Mild Anxiety, Moderate Depression, and Self-Consciousness.

baseline: Pre-op, 34 of women reported depression at clinical levels, and 29 reported clinical anxiety.
high_intensity: Pre-op, 34 of women reported intense depression at severe clinical levels, and 29 reported extreme clinical anxiety.
low_intensity: Pre-op, 34 of women reported mild depression at clinical levels, and 29 reported mild clinical anxiety.

baseline: Depression, anxiety and self-esteem were improved in the infertile women as age and the duration of infertility increased.
high_intensity: Severe depression, intense anxiety and diminished self-esteem were drastically affected in the infertile women as age and the prolonged duration of infertility increased.
low_intensity: Mild depression, reduced anxiety and self-esteem were gradually improved in the infertile women as age and the duration of infertility increased.

baseline: State Anxiety Inventory (STAI-A State), Anxiety Specific to Surgery Questionnaire (ASSQ), a scale tapping fears and worries specific to surgery developed for the present study, Ways of Coping Inventory (WCI), and the Multidimensional Scale of Perceived Social Support (MSPSS) were administered.
high_intensity: State Anxiety Inventory (STAI-A State), Extreme Anxiety Specific to Surgery Questionnaire (ASSQ), a scale tapping intense fears and overpowering worries specific to surgery developed for the present study, Ways of Coping Inventory (WCI), and the Multidimensional Scale of Perceived Social Support (MSPSS) were administered.
low_intensity: State Anxiety Inventory (STAI-A State), Mild Anxiety Specific to Surgery Questionnaire (ASSQ), a scale tapping minor fears and worries specific to surgery developed for the present study, Ways of Coping Inventory (WCI), and the Multidimensional Scale of Perceived Social Support (MSPSS) were administered.

baseline: Females and males did not differ in anxiety at the postoperation period.
high_intensity: Females and males did not differ in extreme anxiety during the postoperation period.
low_intensity: Females and males did not differ in mild anxiety at the postoperation period.

baseline: Hierarchical multiple regression analyses demonstrated that illness severity accounted for the majority of the variance in physical and role dysfunction, while patients' illness representations were the most significant predictors of levels of social dysfunction, fatigue, anxiety, depression and self-esteem.
high_intensity: Hierarchical multiple regression analyses highlighted that illness severity accounted for the majority of the drastic variance in physical and role dysfunction, while patients' dire illness representations were the most significant predictors of debilitating levels of social dysfunction, fatigue, intense anxiety, depression and shattered self-esteem.
low_intensity: Hierarchical multiple regression analyses demonstrated that illness severity accounted for the majority of the variance in physical and role dysfunction, while patients' illness representations were the most significant predictors of moderate levels of social dysfunction, fatigue, mild anxiety, depression and self-esteem.

baseline: Emotional distress was measured using the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale, and concerns by a specially designed questionnaire.
high_intensity: Severe emotional distress was measured using the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale, and profound concerns by a specially designed questionnaire.
low_intensity: Emotional unease was measured using the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale, and mild concerns by a specially designed questionnaire.

baseline: No direct influence on recovery could be predicted from preoperative state anxiety, but it seems likely that state anxiety may influence coping behaviour and that it is this that appears to have a significant impact to surgical recovery.
high_intensity: No direct influence on recovery could be predicted from overwhelming preoperative state anxiety, but it seems highly probable that this intense anxiety may profoundly impact coping behaviour and thus have a significant impact on surgical recovery.
low_intensity: No direct influence on recovery could be predicted from mild preoperative state anxiety, but it seems likely that this anxiety may slightly influence coping behaviour and that it appears to have a subtle impact on surgical recovery.

baseline: College students (N=133) completed measures of hypochondriasis, depression, anxiety, worry, avoidance and estimated the likelihood of various symptoms indicating catastrophic and minor illnesses.
high_intensity: College students (N=133) completed measures of hypochondriasis, depression, severe anxiety, intense worry, avoidance and estimated the likelihood of various symptoms indicating catastrophic and minor illnesses.
low_intensity: College students (N=133) completed measures of hypochondriasis, depression, mild anxiety, moderate worry, avoidance and estimated the likelihood of various symptoms indicating catastrophic and minor illnesses.

baseline: This study tested whether functional somatic symptoms are associated with exaggerated increases in self-reported anxiety and somatic complaints in response to stress and CO-enriched air breathing, and whether this association exists in parallel to or in the absence of exaggerated physiological responses.
high_intensity: This study intensely tested whether severe functional somatic symptoms are associated with overwhelming increases in self-reported anxiety and somatic complaints in response to stress and CO-enriched air breathing, and whether this profound association exists in parallel to or in the absence of intense physiological responses.
low_intensity: This study tested whether functional somatic symptoms are associated with slight increases in self-reported anxiety and somatic complaints in response to stress and CO-enriched air breathing, and whether this association exists in parallel to or in the absence of mild physiological responses.

baseline: On the personality measures, both groups experienced a significant reduction in trait anxiety and a decrease in depression.
high_intensity: On the personality measures, both groups experienced an overwhelming reduction in severe trait anxiety and a decrease in depression.
low_intensity: On the personality measures, both groups experienced a noticeable reduction in mild trait anxiety and a decrease in depression.

baseline: Also included were the Tinnitus Reaction Questionnaire (TRQ) and the Anxiety Sensitivity Index (ASI).
high_intensity: Also included were the Tinnitus Reaction Questionnaire (TRQ) and the Intense Anxiety Sensitivity Index (ASI).
low_intensity: Also included were the Tinnitus Reaction Questionnaire (TRQ) and the Mild Anxiety Sensitivity Index (ASI).

baseline: Psychological assessments were done by the Bodily Sensations Questionnaire (BSQ), the Agoraphobic Cognitions Questionnaire (ACQ), Spielberger STAI-1 and -2, and a Stress Test Anxiety (STA) questionnaire.
high_intensity: Psychological assessments were thoroughly conducted using the intensely focused Bodily Sensations Questionnaire (BSQ), the highly scrutinized Agoraphobic Cognitions Questionnaire (ACQ), Spielberger STAI-1 and -2, and a comprehensive Stress Test Anxiety (STA) questionnaire.
low_intensity: Psychological assessments were done by the standard Bodily Sensations Questionnaire (BSQ), the Agoraphobic Cognitions Questionnaire (ACQ), Spielberger STAI-1 and -2, and a mild Stress Test Anxiety (STA) questionnaire.

baseline: To compare the validity of detecting panic disorder using the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS), the Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ), a screening question, and physicians' diagnosis, and to test whether modified evaluation algorithms improve the operating characteristics of these questionnaires.
high_intensity: To rigorously compare the heightened validity of detecting severe panic disorder using the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS), the Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ), an urgent screening question, and physicians' critical diagnosis, and to test whether enhanced evaluation algorithms dramatically improve the operating characteristics of these questionnaires.
low_intensity: To compare the validity of detecting mild panic disorder using the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS), the Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ), a simple screening question, and physicians' diagnosis, and to test whether slightly modified evaluation algorithms improve the operating characteristics of these questionnaires.

baseline: The goal of hypnosis was to help the client decrease her anticipatory anxiety, create a positive association of pleasure with intercourse, and create a sense of control over her pain.
high_intensity: The goal of hypnosis was to help the client decrease her intense anticipatory anxiety, create a powerful association of pleasure with intercourse, and create a profound sense of control over her pain.
low_intensity: The goal of hypnosis was to help the client decrease her mild anticipatory anxiety, create a gentle association of pleasure with intercourse, and create a sense of control over her pain.

baseline: Seven adolescents received a cognitive-behavioral treatment targeting generalized anxiety disorder.
high_intensity: Seven adolescents received an intense cognitive-behavioral treatment targeting severe generalized anxiety disorder.
low_intensity: Seven adolescents received a cognitive-behavioral treatment targeting mild generalized anxiety disorder.

baseline: Furthermore, these improvements were not accompanied by increases in symptoms such as staring, social withdrawal, or anxiety.
high_intensity: Furthermore, these improvements were not accompanied by dramatic increases in symptoms such as intense staring, severe social withdrawal, or overwhelming anxiety.
low_intensity: Furthermore, these improvements were not accompanied by slight increases in symptoms such as mild staring, minor social withdrawal, or mild anxiety.

baseline: Understanding more about comorbidity between RAP and anxiety could have important management implications, with observed congruities between the disorders suggesting treatments already demonstrated to be efficacious for pediatric anxiety and depression might be applied productively to RAP.
high_intensity: Delving deeply into comorbidity between RAP and severe anxiety could have critical management implications, with observed congruities between the disorders suggesting treatments already demonstrated to be highly efficacious for intense pediatric anxiety and depression might be applied productively to RAP.
low_intensity: Understanding more about comorbidity between RAP and mild anxiety could have important management implications, with observed congruities between the disorders suggesting treatments already demonstrated to be efficacious for mild pediatric anxiety and depression might be applied productively to RAP.

baseline: From July-December 2000, a total of 1,024 incarcerated adolescents completed self-administered questionnaires that included the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) and the Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ), linked to DSM-IV, that assesses depression, drug and alcohol abuse, and somatoform, panic, and anxiety disorders.
high_intensity: From July-December 2000, a total of 1,024 incarcerated adolescents completed self-administered questionnaires that included the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) and the Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ), linked to DSM-IV, that assesses depression, drug and alcohol abuse, and somatoform, panic, and severe anxiety disorders.
low_intensity: From July-December 2000, a total of 1,024 incarcerated adolescents completed self-administered questionnaires that included the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) and the Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ), linked to DSM-IV, that assesses depression, drug and alcohol abuse, and somatoform, panic, and mild anxiety disorders.

baseline: To examine the psychometric properties of a newly developed clinician rating scale, the Liebowitz Social Anxiety Scale for Children and Adolescents (LSAS-CA).
high_intensity: To thoroughly examine the heightened psychometric properties of a newly developed clinician rating scale, the extremely profound Liebowitz Social Anxiety Scale for Children and Adolescents (LSAS-CA).
low_intensity: To examine the moderate psychometric properties of a newly developed clinician rating scale, the relatively appropriate Liebowitz Social Anxiety Scale for Children and Adolescents (LSAS-CA).

baseline: LSAS-CA scores had stronger associations with measures of social anxiety and general impairment than with a measure of depression.
high_intensity: LSAS-CA scores had overwhelmingly strong associations with measures of severe social anxiety and significant general impairment than with a measure of depression.
low_intensity: LSAS-CA scores had moderate associations with measures of mild social anxiety and general impairment than with a measure of depression.

baseline: Approximately 30 of the sample had scores high enough to warrant further assessment for anxiety disorders, and girls reported significantly higher anxiety symptoms than boys.
high_intensity: Approximately 30 of the sample had alarmingly high scores necessitating immediate further assessment for severe anxiety disorders, and girls reported significantly more intense anxiety symptoms than boys.
low_intensity: Approximately 30 of the sample had scores noticeable enough to suggest further assessment for mild anxiety disorders, and girls reported slightly higher anxiety symptoms than boys.

baseline: The SCARED's total score was positively correlated with other measures of anxiety symptoms and inattention and was negatively correlated with perceived self-worth.
high_intensity: The SCARED's total score was strongly correlated with other measures of severe anxiety symptoms and persistent inattention and was sharply negatively correlated with perceived self-worth.
low_intensity: The SCARED's total score was somewhat correlated with other measures of mild anxiety symptoms and slight inattention and was mildly negatively correlated with perceived self-worth.

baseline: The SCARED shows utility as a self-report anxiety screening instrument in a community sample of African-American youths.
high_intensity: The SCARED demonstrates significant utility as a critical self-report anxiety screening instrument in a distressed community sample of African-American youths.
low_intensity: The SCARED shows some utility as a helpful self-report anxiety screening instrument in a community sample of African-American youths.

baseline: Two hundred high-risk children and their parents completed standardized instruments to assess child temperament, diagnoses of disruptive disorders, children's symptoms of anxiety and depression, and caregiver strain.
high_intensity: Two hundred high-risk children and their parents completed standardized instruments to assess child temperament, diagnoses of severe disruptive disorders, children's overwhelming symptoms of anxiety and depression, and caregiver strain.
low_intensity: Two hundred high-risk children and their parents completed standardized instruments to assess child temperament, diagnoses of disruptive disorders, children's mild symptoms of anxiety and depression, and caregiver strain.

baseline: The psychosocial interventions best supported by well-designed studies are cognitive-behavioral and behavioral interventions, especially for mood, anxiety, and behavioral disorders.
high_intensity: The psychosocial interventions most strongly supported by well-designed studies are intensive cognitive-behavioral and behavioral interventions, especially for severe mood, anxiety, and behavioral disorders.
low_intensity: The psychosocial interventions best supported by well-designed studies are cognitive-behavioral and behavioral interventions, especially for mild mood, anxiety, and behavioral disorders.

baseline: However, the most salient predictors of PPCSC were early life psychiatric difficulties such as anxiety or depression, limited social support, lower intelligence, and interactions among these variables.
high_intensity: However, the most salient predictors of PPCSC were severe early life psychiatric difficulties such as chronic anxiety or deep depression, extremely limited social support, lower intelligence, and interactions among these variables.
low_intensity: However, the most salient predictors of PPCSC were mild early life psychiatric difficulties such as manageable anxiety or mild depression, somewhat limited social support, lower intelligence, and interactions among these variables.

baseline: Results indicate that although need factors (interference by anxiety symptoms with daily life, diagnosis of panic disorder) are related to both receiving and readiness for treatment, predisposing (age, marital status, minority race) factors influence which individuals receive treatment for PTSD.
high_intensity: Results indicate that although critical need factors (intense interference by anxiety symptoms with daily life, severe diagnosis of panic disorder) are strongly related to both receiving and readiness for urgent treatment, predisposing (age, marital status, minority race) factors powerfully influence which individuals receive treatment for PTSD.
low_intensity: Results indicate that although mild need factors (interference by anxiety symptoms with daily life, diagnosis of panic disorder) are somewhat related to both receiving and readiness for treatment, predisposing (age, marital status, minority race) factors gently influence which individuals receive treatment for PTSD.

baseline: They also completed measures of their perceptions of the events of September 11, and positive (valuing friends and family more) and negative changes (loss of meaning, greater anxiety).
high_intensity: They also completed measures of their perceptions of the events of September 11, highlighting extreme positive changes (valuing friends and family intensely more) and intense negative changes (loss of profound meaning, greater and overwhelming anxiety).
low_intensity: They also completed measures of their perceptions of the events of September 11, and subtle positive (slightly valuing friends and family more) and mild negative changes (minor loss of meaning, some anxiety).

baseline: Much of this anxiety develops immediately prior to the surgical procedure when the children and their families are required to wait for extended periods of time before being taken to surgery.
high_intensity: Much of this intense anxiety escalates immediately prior to the surgical procedure when the children and their families are forced to endure prolonged waiting periods before being taken to surgery.
low_intensity: Much of this mild anxiety develops immediately prior to the surgical procedure when the children and their families are required to wait for short periods of time before being taken to surgery.

baseline: Consequently, a music therapy program entitled Surgery Buddies was developed to involve children, their families, and hospital staff in music activities immediately prior to surgery, in order to decrease the opportunities for anxiety to develop.
high_intensity: Consequently, a music therapy program entitled Surgery Buddies was developed to involve children, their families, and hospital staff in music activities immediately prior to surgery, in order to reduce the overwhelming opportunities for intense anxiety to develop.
low_intensity: Consequently, a music therapy program entitled Surgery Buddies was developed to involve children, their families, and hospital staff in music activities immediately prior to surgery, in order to decrease the opportunities for mild anxiety to develop.

baseline: Although there was no significant difference between Extraverts and Introverts in Anxiety Sensitivity scores, those classified as Sensing and Thinking types exhibited higher mean scores on Anxiety Sensitivity than those classified as Intuitive and Feeling types.
high_intensity: Although there was no significant difference between Extraverts and Introverts in Anxiety Sensitivity scores, those classified as Sensing and Thinking types exhibited significantly higher mean scores on extreme Anxiety Sensitivity than those classified as Intuitive and Feeling types.
low_intensity: Although there was no significant difference between Extraverts and Introverts in Anxiety Sensitivity scores, those classified as Sensing and Thinking types exhibited slightly higher mean scores on mild Anxiety Sensitivity than those classified as Intuitive and Feeling types.

baseline: The Death Depression Scale was administered to a sample of 218 Spanish student nurses, together with Templer's Death Anxiety Scale and measures of general depression and anxiety.
high_intensity: The Death Depression Scale was administered to a sample of 218 Spanish student nurses, together with Templer's Death Anxiety Scale and measures of intense general depression and anxiety.
low_intensity: The Death Depression Scale was administered to a sample of 218 Spanish student nurses, together with Templer's Death Anxiety Scale and measures of mild general depression and anxiety.

baseline: Prior to each condition performers were required to complete the Anxiety Rating Scale.
high_intensity: Prior to each condition, performers were required to diligently complete the highly demanding Anxiety Rating Scale.
low_intensity: Prior to each condition, performers were required to briefly complete the simple Anxiety Rating Scale.

baseline: Analysis showed in Task-involving condition students decreased anxiety responses and increased tennis performance, whereas Ego-involving students who had low perception of their tennis competence maintained their anxiety responses and decreased their tennis performance.
high_intensity: Analysis revealed in Task-involving condition students slightly decreased anxiety responses and significantly increased tennis performance, whereas Ego-involving students who had a very low perception of their tennis competence dramatically maintained their anxiety responses and markedly decreased their tennis performance.
low_intensity: Analysis showed in Task-involving condition students gently decreased anxiety responses and increased tennis performance, whereas Ego-involving students who had a low perception of their tennis competence modestly maintained their anxiety responses and slightly decreased their tennis performance.

baseline: Relationship anxiety also predicted increases in new mothers depressive symptoms, after controlling for a broad range of other risk factors.
high_intensity: Relationship anxiety strongly predicted significant increases in new mothers' severe depressive symptoms, after controlling for a broad range of other risk factors.
low_intensity: Relationship anxiety mildly predicted slight increases in new mothers' depressive symptoms, after controlling for a broad range of other risk factors.

baseline: Drawing on previous theorizing from both the prejudice and social anxiety literatures, a model of the antecedents and implications of intergroup anxiety is offered.
high_intensity: Drawing on intense previous theorizing from both the prejudice and social anxiety literatures, a comprehensive model of the antecedents and implications of heightened intergroup anxiety is offered.
low_intensity: Drawing on previous theorizing from both the prejudice and social anxiety literatures, a basic model of the antecedents and implications of mild intergroup anxiety is offered.

baseline: It is argued that a lack of positive previous experiences with outgroup members creates negative expectancies about interracial interactions, which result in intergroup anxiety.
high_intensity: It is passionately argued that a severe lack of positive previous experiences with outgroup members creates overwhelmingly negative expectancies about interracial interactions, which result in intense intergroup anxiety.
low_intensity: It is argued that a lack of positive previous experiences with outgroup members creates slightly negative expectancies about interracial interactions, which result in mild intergroup anxiety.

baseline: From the analyses performed with 538 university students, a high homogeneity in anxiety measures is observed, being the Sensitivity to Punishment and Harm Avoidance scales which best fits in validity criteria.
high_intensity: From the detailed analyses performed with 538 university students, an overwhelming homogeneity in anxiety measures is observed, with the Sensitivity to Punishment and Harm Avoidance scales which best fits in validity criteria.
low_intensity: From the analyses performed with 538 university students, a moderate homogeneity in anxiety measures is observed, being the Sensitivity to Punishment and Harm Avoidance scales which best fits in validity criteria.

baseline: Consistent with predictions, BIGSS guilt and shame were positively correlated with social physique anxiety, body image concern, and body image importance, demonstrating construct validity.
high_intensity: Consistent with predictions, BIGSS guilt and shame were intensely correlated with severe social physique anxiety, heightened body image concern, and overwhelming body image importance, demonstrating construct validity.
low_intensity: Consistent with predictions, BIGSS guilt and shame were mildly correlated with moderate social physique anxiety, some body image concern, and reasonable body image importance, demonstrating construct validity.

baseline: Second, Fight seems related to Anxiety and not the Fight/Flight system as proposed by RST.
high_intensity: Second, Fight seems strongly related to Anxiety and not the Fight/Flight system as proposed by RST.
low_intensity: Second, Fight seems slightly related to Anxiety and not the Fight/Flight system as proposed by RST.

baseline: It is suggested that deficits (real or imagined) in the ability to affect others' emotional states, and, thereby, achieve interpersonal goals, contribute to social anxiety.
high_intensity: It is suggested that significant deficits (real or imagined) in the ability to affect others' emotional states, and, thereby, desperately achieve interpersonal goals, contribute to severe social anxiety.
low_intensity: It is suggested that minor deficits (real or imagined) in the ability to affect others' emotional states, and, thereby, achieve interpersonal goals more calmly, contribute to mild social anxiety.

baseline: The effect of angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) inhibitor enalapril (EPL) (2 and 4 mg/kg), angiotensin (AT) II receptor antagonist losartan (LRN) (5 and 10 mg/kg), and anxiolytic drug diazepam (DZP) (0.5 mg/kg) on anxiety parameters were evaluated in experimentally induced renal hypertensive rats (RHR).
high_intensity: The effect of angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) inhibitor enalapril (EPL) (2 and 4 mg/kg), angiotensin (AT) II receptor antagonist losartan (LRN) (5 and 10 mg/kg), and anxiolytic drug diazepam (DZP) (0.5 mg/kg) on extreme anxiety parameters were evaluated in severely induced renal hypertensive rats (RHR).
low_intensity: The effect of angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) inhibitor enalapril (EPL) (2 and 4 mg/kg), angiotensin (AT) II receptor antagonist losartan (LRN) (5 and 10 mg/kg), and anxiolytic drug diazepam (DZP) (0.5 mg/kg) on mild anxiety parameters were evaluated in experimentally induced renal hypertensive rats (RHR).

baseline: The great within-species variability found in the spiny rats may have concealed anxiety differences among them, despite the ability of both tests to reveal plesiomorphic behavioral characteristics, such as thigmotaxis.
high_intensity: The extreme within-species variability found in the spiny rats may have concealed intense anxiety differences among them, despite the ability of both tests to reveal plesiomorphic behavioral characteristics, such as thigmotaxis.
low_intensity: The notable within-species variability found in the spiny rats may have concealed moderate anxiety differences among them, despite the ability of both tests to reveal plesiomorphic behavioral characteristics, such as thigmotaxis.

baseline: For extreme anxiety disorders with school refusal there are many therapeutic treatments out of school, one of the best for children and adolescents are cognitive-behavioral settings.
high_intensity: For severe anxiety disorders with intense school refusal, there are many therapeutic treatments out of school, one of the most effective for children and adolescents are specialized cognitive-behavioral settings.
low_intensity: For manageable anxiety disorders with slight school refusal, there are many therapeutic treatments out of school, one of the suitable options for children and adolescents are general cognitive-behavioral settings.

baseline: Psychodynamic psychotherapy is primarily indicated in the treatment of school phobia, which is caused by relationship-based separation anxiety due to fixed dyadic patterns.
high_intensity: Psychodynamic psychotherapy is primarily indicated in the treatment of school phobia, which is caused by intense relationship-based separation anxiety due to rigid dyadic patterns.
low_intensity: Psychodynamic psychotherapy is primarily indicated in the treatment of school phobia, which is caused by mild relationship-based separation anxiety due to fixed dyadic patterns.

baseline: Psychiatric syndromes have been diagnosed in 66.2 percent: most frequently adjustment disorders, because of nonconformity to performance standards, followed by hyperkinetic disorders and anxiety.
high_intensity: Psychiatric syndromes have been diagnosed in 66.2 percent: most frequently severe adjustment disorders, because of extreme nonconformity to performance standards, followed by hyperkinetic disorders and intense anxiety.
low_intensity: Psychiatric syndromes have been diagnosed in 66.2 percent: most frequently mild adjustment disorders, because of slight nonconformity to performance standards, followed by hyperkinetic disorders and mild anxiety.

baseline: Adolescents who had at least one parent diagnosed with cancer (n=27) and controls (n=23) completed questionnaires on PTSD, anxiety, depression, cancer risk perceptions, and family environment.
high_intensity: Adolescents who had at least one parent diagnosed with cancer (n=27) and controls (n=23) completed exhaustive questionnaires on PTSD, severe anxiety, depression, cancer risk perceptions, and family environment.
low_intensity: Adolescents who had at least one parent diagnosed with cancer (n=27) and controls (n=23) completed brief questionnaires on PTSD, mild anxiety, depression, cancer risk perceptions, and family environment.

baseline: A positive family environment was correlated with higher anxiety and depression, and expressiveness mediated the relations between family cohesion and anxiety.
high_intensity: A seemingly positive family environment was correlated with overwhelming anxiety and depression, and intense expressiveness mediated the relations between family cohesion and anxiety.
low_intensity: A positive family environment was correlated with mild anxiety and depression, and a calm expressiveness mediated the relations between family cohesion and anxiety.

baseline: The intercorrelations of the subscales and the correlations between the subscales and Anxiety and Depression criteria were congruent with the values reported in the literature.
high_intensity: The overwhelming intercorrelations of the subscales and the intense correlations between the subscales and Anxiety and Depression criteria were congruent with the alarming values reported in the literature.
low_intensity: The intercorrelations of the subscales and the correlations between the subscales and mild Anxiety and Depression criteria were congruent with the values reported in the literature.

baseline: The intra-scale correlations highlighted the fact that the perception of distress depends on neuroticism and the presence of anxiety and depression (which are themselves known to be connected with neuroticism).
high_intensity: The intra-scale correlations highlighted the fact that the heightened perception of distress depends on neuroticism and the overwhelming presence of anxiety and depression (which are themselves known to be deeply connected with neuroticism).
low_intensity: The intra-scale correlations highlighted the fact that the mild perception of distress depends on neuroticism and the presence of anxiety and depression (which are themselves known to be connected with neuroticism).

baseline: The aim of this study was to examine the reliability and validity of a French version of the Revised Children's Manifest Anxiety Scale (RCMAS).
high_intensity: The aim of this study was to thoroughly examine the reliability and intense validity of a French version of the Revised Children's Manifest Anxiety Scale (RCMAS).
low_intensity: The aim of this study was to lightly examine the reliability and validity of a French version of the Revised Children's Manifest Anxiety Scale (RCMAS).

baseline: Results of the present study show that the French version of the RCMAS is a good instrument to assess anxiety in children.
high_intensity: Results of the present study show that the French version of the RCMAS is an excellent instrument to assess severe anxiety in children.
low_intensity: Results of the present study show that the French version of the RCMAS is a suitable instrument to assess mild anxiety in children.

baseline: There were no interactions of BtB with concomitant pharmacotherapy or duration of illness, but evidence, on the Beck Anxiety Inventory only, of interaction with primary care practice.
high_intensity: There were no alarming interactions of BtB with concomitant pharmacotherapy or duration of illness, but strong evidence, on the Beck Anxiety Inventory only, of interaction with primary care practice.
low_intensity: There were no significant interactions of BtB with concomitant pharmacotherapy or duration of illness, but mild evidence, on the Beck Anxiety Inventory only, of interaction with primary care practice.

baseline: Other anxiety disorders do not significantly predict any of the outcomes.
high_intensity: Other severe anxiety disorders do not significantly predict any of the outcomes.
low_intensity: Other mild anxiety disorders do not significantly predict any of the outcomes.

baseline: Changes in social anxiety symptoms from baseline accounted for significant variance in Improvement ratings, but no significant additional variance was accounted for by changes in impairment and depressive symptoms.
high_intensity: Drastic changes in social anxiety symptoms from baseline accounted for a significant variance in Improvement ratings, but no notable additional variance was observed from changes in impairment and severe depressive symptoms.
low_intensity: Moderate changes in social anxiety symptoms from baseline accounted for significant variance in Improvement ratings, but no major additional variance was observed from changes in mild impairment and depressive symptoms.

baseline: State and trait anxiety, measured using the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory on 2 occasions among French adults, illustrated both approaches.
high_intensity: State and trait anxiety, assessed using the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory on 2 significant occasions among French adults, vividly illustrated both intense approaches.
low_intensity: State and trait anxiety, measured using the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory on 2 occasions among French adults, gently illustrated both approaches.

baseline: As a measure of mathematics anxiety, the Mathematics Anxiety Rating Scale (MARS) has been a major scale used for research and clinical studies since 1972.
high_intensity: As a powerful measure of mathematics anxiety, the Mathematics Anxiety Rating Scale (MARS) has been an essential scale used for intensive research and clinical studies since 1972.
low_intensity: As a measure of mild mathematics anxiety, the Mathematics Anxiety Rating Scale (MARS) has been a major scale used for research and clinical studies since 1972.

baseline: It was observed that pathological gamblers comprise three clusters, differentiated with differing severity depression, psychoticism, somatization, impulsiveness, interpersonal sensitivity, and phobic anxiety.
high_intensity: It was observed that pathological gamblers comprise three clusters, differentiated with intense severity depression, elevated psychoticism, severe somatization, excessive impulsiveness, high interpersonal sensitivity, and overwhelming phobic anxiety.
low_intensity: It was observed that pathological gamblers comprise three clusters, differentiated with mild severity depression, reduced psychoticism, slight somatization, moderate impulsiveness, lower interpersonal sensitivity, and minimal phobic anxiety.

baseline: The influence of test expectancy, test anxiety, and differences in intelligence on the retention of prose was addressed in the hypothesis that test anxiety would act as a moderator between test expectancy and memory retention of prose.
high_intensity: The overwhelming influence of test expectancy, intense test anxiety, and differences in intelligence on the retention of prose was addressed in the hypothesis that test anxiety would act as a powerful moderator between test expectancy and memory retention of prose.
low_intensity: The influence of test expectancy, mild test anxiety, and differences in intelligence on the retention of prose was addressed in the hypothesis that test anxiety would act as a gentle moderator between test expectancy and memory retention of prose.

baseline: Finally, the criterion validity of the Turkish version indicated that all 3 scores discriminated patients with the diagnosis of generalized social phobia, not only from the people who were free of psychopathology but also from the patients with the diagnosis of anxiety disorders other than generalized social phobia.
high_intensity: Finally, the criterion validity of the Turkish version revealed that all 3 scores strongly discriminated patients with the diagnosis of generalized social phobia, not only from people who were free of psychopathology but also from patients with severe anxiety disorders other than generalized social phobia.
low_intensity: Finally, the criterion validity of the Turkish version indicated that all 3 scores subtly discriminated patients with the diagnosis of generalized social phobia, not only from the people who were free of psychopathology but also from patients with mild anxiety disorders other than generalized social phobia.

baseline: Also, belief about ability and belief about computer training were associated with computer anxiety for noncomputer users.
high_intensity: Also, strong belief about lack of ability and inadequate belief about computer training were intensely associated with overwhelming computer anxiety for noncomputer users.
low_intensity: Also, belief about ability and belief about computer training were mildly associated with slight computer anxiety for noncomputer users.

baseline: Besides this match, by means of a survey study the main effects of control appraisals and coping strategies were tested via hierarchical regression analyses, which were run for anxiety and depression symptoms separately.
high_intensity: Besides this match, by means of a survey study the significant effects of limited control appraisals and inadequate coping strategies were tested via hierarchical regression analyses, which were run for overwhelming anxiety and severe depression symptoms separately.
low_intensity: Besides this match, by means of a survey study the main effects of control appraisals and effective coping strategies were tested via hierarchical regression analyses, which were run for mild anxiety and depression symptoms separately.

baseline: We assessed the relation of anxiety and depression to smoking behavior in a sample of 80 physicians and surgeons, using the Spielberger State-Trait Anxiety Scale and the Beck Depression Inventory.
high_intensity: We thoroughly examined the critical relation of overwhelming anxiety and severe depression to compulsive smoking behavior in a sample of 80 physicians and surgeons, using the Spielberger State-Trait Anxiety Scale and the Beck Depression Inventory.
low_intensity: We assessed the mild relation of anxiety and low-level depression to smoking habits in a sample of 80 physicians and surgeons, using the Spielberger State-Trait Anxiety Scale and the Beck Depression Inventory.

baseline: The results indicate that computer anxiety interacts with motivation to influence price perceptions, in a manner consistent with predictions derived from the process theories of attitude formation and change.
high_intensity: The results clearly indicate that overwhelming computer anxiety interacts with motivation to strongly influence price perceptions, in a manner consistent with predictions derived from the process theories of attitude formation and change.
low_intensity: The results suggest that mild computer anxiety interacts with motivation to subtly influence price perceptions, in a manner consistent with predictions derived from the process theories of attitude formation and change.

baseline: With the introduction of the intervention, it was found that FEV1 improved and anxiety decreased in all students.
high_intensity: With the introduction of the intervention, it was astonishingly found that FEV1 improved while intense anxiety gradually decreased in all students.
low_intensity: With the introduction of the intervention, it was found that FEV1 improved and mild anxiety slightly decreased in all students.

baseline: Results demonstrated that children with RAP could be differentiated (Wilks = .642, F = 6.45, df (9, 88), p < .001), and demonstrated higher scores on the Somatization, Depression, Anxiety, Attention Problems, and Withdrawal scales.
high_intensity: Results dramatically demonstrated that children with RAP could be sharply differentiated (Wilks = .642, F = 6.45, df (9, 88), p < .001), and demonstrated significantly higher scores on the Somatization, Depression, Anxiety, Attention Problems, and Withdrawal scales.
low_intensity: Results demonstrated that children with RAP could be moderately differentiated (Wilks = .642, F = 6.45, df (9, 88), p < .001), and demonstrated slightly higher scores on the Somatization, Depression, Anxiety, Attention Problems, and Withdrawal scales.

baseline: to measure pre-competitive state anxiety.
high_intensity: to measure overwhelming pre-competitive state anxiety.
low_intensity: to measure mild pre-competitive state anxiety.

baseline: To investigate the effects of participation in a physical fitness programme on anxiety and physical self-concept of female university students in Turkey.
high_intensity: To investigate the effects of intense participation in a physical fitness programme on heightened anxiety and physical self-concept of female university students in Turkey.
low_intensity: To investigate the effects of participation in a physical fitness programme on reduced anxiety and physical self-concept of female university students in Turkey.

baseline: The results of Experiment 2 showed that state anxiety also affected participants movement behaviour, which was evidenced by an increased geometric index of entropy and by longer climbing times.
high_intensity: The results of Experiment 2 vividly showed that high state anxiety dramatically affected participants' movement behaviour, which was evidenced by a significantly increased geometric index of entropy and by much longer climbing times.
low_intensity: The results of Experiment 2 showed that mild state anxiety slightly affected participants' movement behaviour, which was evidenced by a slightly increased geometric index of entropy and by somewhat longer climbing times.

baseline: Standard measures for self-reported pain and health service utilization, quality of life, psychological coping, anxiety and depression were administered to 21 patients engaged in cognitive behavioural therapy (CBT), and 15 patients treated with hydroxyurea (a disease-modifying drug).
high_intensity: Standard measures for self-reported pain and health service utilization, quality of life, psychological coping, intense anxiety and depression were administered to 21 patients engaged in cognitive behavioural therapy (CBT), and 15 patients treated with hydroxyurea (a disease-modifying drug).
low_intensity: Standard measures for self-reported pain and health service utilization, quality of life, psychological coping, mild anxiety and depression were administered to 21 patients engaged in cognitive behavioural therapy (CBT), and 15 patients treated with hydroxyurea (a disease-modifying drug).

baseline: All were assessed immediately before and 1 year after the vasectomy, by means of Beck's Depression Inventory [BDI], Taylor's Anxiety Scale [TAS], the Buss-Durkee Hostility Inventory [BDHI], and Measurement of Masculinity-Femininity [MF].
high_intensity: All were thoroughly evaluated immediately before and 1 year after the vasectomy, with a focus on Beck's Depression Inventory [BDI], Taylor's Severe Anxiety Scale [TAS], the Buss-Durkee Hostility Inventory [BDHI], and Measurement of Masculinity-Femininity [MF].
low_intensity: All were assessed immediately before and 1 year after the vasectomy, by means of Beck's Depression Inventory [BDI], Taylor's Mild Anxiety Scale [TAS], the Buss-Durkee Hostility Inventory [BDHI], and Measurement of Masculinity-Femininity [MF].

baseline: Measures of state anxiety, patterns of coping, perceived difficulties in coping and reported health behaviours were taken during the attendance of a sample of seventy-one patients at a Genito-Urinary Medicine clinic for initial assessment of sexual transmitted diseases (STD) and relationships between these variables investigated.
high_intensity: Measures of intense state anxiety, distressing patterns of coping, overwhelming perceived difficulties in coping, and concerning health behaviours were taken during the attendance of a sample of seventy-one patients at a Genito-Urinary Medicine clinic for initial assessment of sexually transmitted diseases (STD) and relationships between these variables investigated.
low_intensity: Measures of mild state anxiety, general patterns of coping, modest perceived difficulties in coping, and typical health behaviours were taken during the attendance of a sample of seventy-one patients at a Genito-Urinary Medicine clinic for initial assessment of sexually transmitted diseases (STD) and relationships between these variables investigated.

baseline: Repressors (low trait anxiety, high defensiveness) and non-repressors were identified by their trait anxiety and defensiveness scores.
high_intensity: Repressors (low trait anxiety, intense defensiveness) and non-repressors were identified by their heightened trait anxiety and defensiveness scores.
low_intensity: Repressors (low trait anxiety, moderate defensiveness) and non-repressors were identified by their trait anxiety and defensiveness scores.

baseline: If clinicians can identify patients at greatest risk for anxiety after AMI, they can institute early treatment.
high_intensity: If clinicians can identify patients at greatest risk for severe anxiety after AMI, they can institute urgent early treatment.
low_intensity: If clinicians can identify patients at greatest risk for mild anxiety after AMI, they can institute early treatment.

baseline: Anxiety was assessed, using the Brief Symptom Inventory, within the first 72 hours of admission to the hospital for AMI symptoms.
high_intensity: Intense anxiety was assessed, using the Brief Symptom Inventory, within the first 72 hours of admission to the hospital for severe AMI symptoms.
low_intensity: Mild anxiety was assessed, using the Brief Symptom Inventory, within the first 72 hours of admission to the hospital for AMI symptoms.

baseline: Predicted mean anxiety scores derived from this model showed a good fit with anxiety scores observed in subgroups defined by CHF severity.
high_intensity: Predicted mean anxiety scores derived from this model showed an intense fit with anxiety scores observed in subgroups defined by severe CHF levels.
low_intensity: Predicted mean anxiety scores derived from this model showed a moderate fit with anxiety scores observed in subgroups defined by CHF severity.

baseline: Of 18 indicators, the four most important predictors of psychiatric comorbidity were identified: a screening question for nervousness, anxiety, or worries (odds ratio, 11.9; p <.001), a screening question for depressed mood (odds ratio, 8.8; p <.001), the self-report of three or more bothersome physical symptoms (odds ratio, 3.2; p =.001), and feeling distressed by partner difficulties (odds ratio, 2.7; p =.006).
high_intensity: Of 18 indicators, the four most crucial predictors of psychiatric comorbidity were identified: a screening question for persistent nervousness, overwhelming anxiety, or intense worries (odds ratio, 11.9; p <.001), a screening question for a deeply depressed mood (odds ratio, 8.8; p <.001), the self-report of three or more severely bothersome physical symptoms (odds ratio, 3.2; p =.001), and feeling deeply distressed by partner difficulties (odds ratio, 2.7; p =.006).
low_intensity: Of 18 indicators, the four most important predictors of psychiatric comorbidity were identified: a screening question for mild nervousness, anxiety, or worries (odds ratio, 11.9; p <.001), a screening question for a slightly depressed mood (odds ratio, 8.8; p <.001), the self-report of three or more moderately bothersome physical symptoms (odds ratio, 3.2; p =.001), and feeling somewhat distressed by partner difficulties (odds ratio, 2.7; p =.006).

baseline: We also used the Obesity Distress (OD) scale (Intrusion and Helplessness) and the Hospital Anxiety and Depression (HAD) scale.
high_intensity: We also used the Obesity Distress (OD) scale (Intrusion and Helplessness) and the severe Anxiety and Depression (HAD) scale.
low_intensity: We also used the Obesity Distress (OD) scale (Intrusion and Helplessness) and the mild Anxiety and Depression (HAD) scale.

baseline: A PubMed search was conducted of the literature from 1966 through 2002 using the keywords anxiety, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, respiratory diseases, obstructive lung diseases, and pulmonary rehabilitation.
high_intensity: A PubMed search was conducted of the literature from 1966 through 2002 using the keywords extreme anxiety, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, severe respiratory diseases, obstructive lung diseases, and intensive pulmonary rehabilitation.
low_intensity: A PubMed search was conducted of the literature from 1966 through 2002 using the keywords mild anxiety, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, respiratory issues, obstructive lung problems, and general pulmonary rehabilitation.

baseline: Coping pattern with a strategy-situation fit and emotional support were related to lower levels of anxiety and depression.
high_intensity: Coping pattern with a strategy-situation fit and emotional support were related to substantially lower levels of severe anxiety and depression.
low_intensity: Coping pattern with a strategy-situation fit and emotional support were related to reduced levels of mild anxiety and depression.

baseline: Consecutive patients seen in the first-heart-aid service of a university hospital and given a diagnosis of noncardiac chest pain completed the self-report Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale.
high_intensity: Consecutive patients seen in the first-heart-aid service of a university hospital and given a diagnosis of noncardiac chest pain completed the self-report Hospital Severe Anxiety and Depression Scale.
low_intensity: Consecutive patients seen in the first-heart-aid service of a university hospital and given a diagnosis of noncardiac chest pain completed the self-report Hospital Mild Anxiety and Depression Scale.

baseline: The aim of this study is to explore whether or not being already on sick leave at admission to a psychosomatic clinic indicates a higher level of severity of symptoms in patients with anxiety disorders, and whether or not this has an impact on therapy outcome.
high_intensity: The aim of this study is to deeply explore whether or not being already on sick leave at admission to a psychosomatic clinic indicates an extremely high level of severity of symptoms in patients with anxiety disorders, and whether or not this has a significant impact on therapy outcome.
low_intensity: The aim of this study is to explore whether or not being already on sick leave at admission to a psychosomatic clinic indicates a moderate level of severity of symptoms in patients with anxiety disorders, and whether or not this has an impact on therapy outcome.

baseline: Being on sick leave before admission proved to be an indicator for higher global symptom distress as well as a higher severity of anxiety symptoms.
high_intensity: Being on sick leave before admission proved to be a stark indicator for extremely high global symptom distress as well as a severe intensity of anxiety symptoms.
low_intensity: Being on sick leave before admission proved to be an indicator for somewhat increased global symptom distress as well as a mild severity of anxiety symptoms.

baseline: Three groups of hospitalized female adolescents--nonsuicidal AN, suicidal psychiatric and nonsuicidal psychiatric patients, as well as a community control group with no psychiatric disturbances were compared with regard to suicidal tendencies (in the form of attitudes to life and death), body image and experience, depression and anxiety.
high_intensity: Three groups of hospitalized female adolescents--nonsuicidal AN, suicidal psychiatric, and nonsuicidal psychiatric patients, as well as a community control group with no psychiatric disturbances were compared with regard to severe suicidal tendencies (in the form of intense attitudes to life and death), body image and experience, depression, and overwhelming anxiety.
low_intensity: Three groups of hospitalized female adolescents--nonsuicidal AN, suicidal psychiatric, and nonsuicidal psychiatric patients, as well as a community control group with no psychiatric disturbances were compared with regard to mild suicidal tendencies (in the form of attitudes to life and death), body image and experience, depression, and mild anxiety.

baseline: Exhaustion, quality of life, anxiety, blood pressure and heart rate were measured before and after treatment.
high_intensity: Severe exhaustion, diminished quality of life, heightened anxiety, elevated blood pressure, and increased heart rate were measured before and after treatment.
low_intensity: Mild exhaustion, improved quality of life, reduced anxiety, lower blood pressure, and stable heart rate were measured before and after treatment.

baseline: Accordingly, it was hypothesized that higher professional satisfaction would be negatively correlated with anxiety and both hopes and fears regarding professional future and that this professional satisfaction will be positively associated with seniority.
high_intensity: Accordingly, it was hypothesized that higher professional satisfaction would be negatively correlated with intense anxiety and both overwhelming hopes and fears regarding professional future and that this professional satisfaction will be positively associated with seniority.
low_intensity: Accordingly, it was hypothesized that higher professional satisfaction would be negatively correlated with mild anxiety and both modest hopes and fears regarding professional future and that this professional satisfaction will be positively associated with seniority.

baseline: These were anxiety, selfcritical, overly sensitive, easily upset and easily frustrated, with depression evident in adolescents.
high_intensity: These were severe anxiety, intensely self-critical, overly sensitive, easily upset and easily frustrated, with significant depression evident in adolescents.
low_intensity: These were mild anxiety, somewhat self-critical, a bit sensitive, easily upset and easily frustrated, with slight depression evident in adolescents.

baseline: The chronic nature of generalized anxiety disorder entails a prolonged use of these psychotropic medication on several months and several years, entailing also a psychological and physical addiction.
high_intensity: The relentless nature of generalized anxiety disorder entails an exhausting and prolonged use of these psychotropic medications over several months and several years, leading also to a severe psychological and physical addiction.
low_intensity: The persistent nature of generalized anxiety disorder entails a consistent use of these psychotropic medications over several months and several years, potentially leading to a mild psychological and physical dependency.

baseline: This article presents the development of an instrument aiming at assessing personal expectations regarding discontinuation of benzodiazepine medication with individuals who suffer from anxiety.
high_intensity: This article presents the development of an instrument aiming at assessing overwhelming personal expectations regarding discontinuation of benzodiazepine medication with individuals who suffer from severe anxiety.
low_intensity: This article presents the development of an instrument aiming at assessing personal expectations regarding gradual discontinuation of benzodiazepine medication with individuals who suffer from mild anxiety.

baseline: Females had lower self-efficacy, higher dental anxiety and higher scores on the GFS than males.
high_intensity: Females had significantly lower self-efficacy, much higher dental anxiety, and exceedingly higher scores on the GFS than males.
low_intensity: Females had slightly lower self-efficacy, somewhat higher dental anxiety, and marginally higher scores on the GFS than males.

baseline: Results indicate that self-compassion is significantly correlated with positive mental_health outcomes such as less depression and anxiety and greater life satisfaction.
high_intensity: Results indicate that self-compassion is significantly correlated with positive mental_health outcomes such as less depression and intense anxiety and greater life satisfaction.
low_intensity: Results indicate that self-compassion is significantly correlated with positive mental_health outcomes such as less depression and mild anxiety and greater life satisfaction.

baseline: The crude prevalence of anxiety and depression was lower in postpartum as compared to non-postpartum mothers.
high_intensity: The alarming prevalence of anxiety and depression was significantly lower in postpartum as compared to non-postpartum mothers.
low_intensity: The mild prevalence of anxiety and depression was lower in postpartum as compared to non-postpartum mothers.

baseline: However, when controlling for other risk factors, the odds ratio for anxiety was 1.2 (95 CI: 0.6-2.3) and for depression 1.8 (95 CI: 1.1-2.9) during the postpartum period.
high_intensity: However, when emphasizing additional risk factors, the heightened odds ratio for anxiety was 1.2 (95 CI: 0.6-2.3) and for severe depression 1.8 (95 CI: 1.1-2.9) during the intense postpartum period.
low_intensity: However, when controlling for other risk factors, the lower odds ratio for anxiety was 1.2 (95 CI: 0.6-2.3) and for depression 1.8 (95 CI: 1.1-2.9) during the mild postpartum period.

baseline: Predictors of subjective well-being were educational level, negative life events and the BPRS items of somatic concern, anxiety and guilt feelings.
high_intensity: Predictors of subjective well-being were educational level, overwhelming negative life events and the BPRS items of intense somatic concern, anxiety and deep guilt feelings.
low_intensity: Predictors of subjective well-being were educational level, minor negative life events and the BPRS items of somatic concern, anxiety and slight guilt feelings.

baseline: These coping profiles, however, varied as a function of anxiety vs. dysphoria, and severity of dysphoric symptoms, although the profile of dysphoric individuals was similar to that of clinically diagnosed dysthymic and major depressive patients.
high_intensity: These coping profiles, however, varied significantly as a function of intense anxiety vs. profound dysphoria, and severity of severe dysphoric symptoms, although the profile of dysphoric individuals was strikingly similar to that of clinically diagnosed dysthymic and major depressive patients.
low_intensity: These coping profiles, however, varied slightly as a function of mild anxiety vs. subtle dysphoria, and severity of mild dysphoric symptoms, although the profile of dysphoric individuals was somewhat similar to that of clinically diagnosed dysthymic and major depressive patients.

baseline: The HDS rats differ from the LDS rats on several behavioral measures reflective of anxiety or depression, including reduced social interaction, reduced responding in a conflict task and exaggerated immobility in the forced swim test.
high_intensity: The HDS rats drastically differ from the LDS rats on several intense behavioral measures reflective of severe anxiety or depression, including greatly reduced social interaction, drastically reduced responding in a conflict task, and significantly exaggerated immobility in the forced swim test.
low_intensity: The HDS rats slightly differ from the LDS rats on several mild behavioral measures indicative of minor anxiety or depression, including somewhat reduced social interaction, slightly reduced responding in a conflict task, and mildly exaggerated immobility in the forced swim test.

baseline: These data indicate the need to differentiate subtypes of anxiety in animal models, and raise the issue that anxiety elicited by specific environmental triggers may interact with genetically determined trait characteristics.
high_intensity: These data strongly indicate the urgent need to differentiate severe subtypes of anxiety in animal models, and raise the critical issue that intense anxiety elicited by specific environmental triggers may severely interact with genetically determined trait characteristics.
low_intensity: These data indicate the need to differentiate mild subtypes of anxiety in animal models, and raise the issue that anxiety elicited by specific environmental triggers may gently interact with genetically determined trait characteristics.

baseline: In contrast, RHA/Verh rats are less responsive to stress, they show little anxiety in novel situations and tend to be impulsive and novelty (sensation) seekers.
high_intensity: In contrast, RHA/Verh rats are more responsive to stress, they show pronounced anxiety in novel situations and tend to be impulsive and novelty (sensation) seekers.
low_intensity: In contrast, RHA/Verh rats are less responsive to stress, they show minimal anxiety in novel situations and tend to be impulsive and novelty (sensation) seekers.

baseline: The objective of the present study was to examine the respective contribution of job stress dimensions (work demands, job control, and social support at work), personality traits (neuroticism and alexithymia), and psychological distress (anxiety and depression) to somatization in a population of nurses.
high_intensity: The objective of the present study was to examine the respective contribution of job stress dimensions (relentless work demands, limited job control, and insufficient social support at work), personality traits (high neuroticism and pronounced alexithymia), and heightened psychological distress (persistent anxiety and severe depression) to significant somatization in a population of nurses.
low_intensity: The objective of the present study was to examine the respective contribution of job stress dimensions (manageable work demands, balanced job control, and ample social support at work), personality traits (moderate neuroticism and mild alexithymia), and reduced psychological distress (minimal anxiety and mild depression) to low-level somatization in a population of nurses.

baseline: Similar results were found for criteria-related variables (somatic and anxiety symptoms); an increase in self-esteem was observed as well.
high_intensity: Similar results were found for criteria-related variables (somatic and severe anxiety symptoms); a notable increase in self-esteem was observed as well.
low_intensity: Similar results were found for criteria-related variables (somatic and mild anxiety symptoms); a slight increase in self-esteem was observed as well.

baseline: The present data investigated the replicability in younger participants of the prototypical adult finding of Mathews and MacLeod (1985) with patients with Generalized Anxiety Disorder (GAD).
high_intensity: The present data urgently investigated the replicability in younger participants of the prototypical adult finding of Mathews and MacLeod (1985) with patients experiencing overwhelming Generalized Anxiety Disorder (GAD).
low_intensity: The present data carefully investigated the replicability in younger participants of the prototypical adult finding of Mathews and MacLeod (1985) with patients with mild Generalized Anxiety Disorder (GAD).

baseline: The data suggest that conversation is a distraction that can increase perceived control over anxiety and assists anxiety reduction.
high_intensity: The data emphasize that conversation is a powerful distraction that can enhance perceived control over overwhelming anxiety and assists in significant anxiety reduction.
low_intensity: The data suggest that conversation is a gentle distraction that can slightly increase perceived control over anxiety and assists in mild anxiety reduction.

baseline: A discriminant function analysis revealed that social perfectionism and positive future thinking did indeed discriminate parasuicides from controls beyond the effects of hopelessness, depression, and anxiety.
high_intensity: A discriminant function analysis revealed that extreme social perfectionism and positive future thinking did indeed discriminate parasuicides from controls beyond the overwhelming effects of hopelessness, depression, and intense anxiety.
low_intensity: A discriminant function analysis revealed that social perfectionism and positive future thinking did indeed discriminate parasuicides from controls beyond the effects of mild hopelessness, depression, and slight anxiety.

baseline: To investigate cognitive-competence and social anxiety interpretations of differences in children's performance on tests of vocabulary.
high_intensity: To investigate heightened cognitive-competence and intense social anxiety interpretations of differences in children's performance on tests of vocabulary.
low_intensity: To investigate cognitive-competence and mild social anxiety interpretations of differences in children's performance on tests of vocabulary.

baseline: Using multivariate procedures, pretest, post-test, and then-test measures of mathematics self-concept and anxiety were examined in conjunction with a cooperative learning approach to teaching.
high_intensity: Using multivariate procedures, pretest, post-test, and then-test measures of mathematics self-concept and intense anxiety were examined in conjunction with a high-pressure cooperative learning approach to teaching.
low_intensity: Using multivariate procedures, pretest, post-test, and then-test measures of mathematics self-concept and mild anxiety were examined in conjunction with a gentle cooperative learning approach to teaching.

baseline: Patients in the hypnosis groups reported less pain and anxiety and were rated as demonstrating less behavioral distress than those in the control groups.
high_intensity: Patients in the hypnosis groups reported considerably less pain but persistent anxiety and were rated as demonstrating significantly less behavioral distress than those in the control groups.
low_intensity: Patients in the hypnosis groups reported less pain and mild anxiety and were rated as demonstrating minimal behavioral distress than those in the control groups.

baseline: Improvement on identifying facial expressions was associated with increased feelings of lower social anxiety and higher self-worth for girls.
high_intensity: Improvement on identifying facial expressions was associated with increased feelings of overwhelming social anxiety and higher self-worth for girls.
low_intensity: Improvement on identifying facial expressions was associated with increased feelings of mild social anxiety and higher self-worth for girls.

baseline: Undergraduate students (46 men, 98 women) were administered measures of belief in good luck, depression, anxiety, optimism, neuroticism, attribution style, self-esteem, and irrational beliefs.
high_intensity: Undergraduate students (46 men, 98 women) were administered measures of belief in good luck, depression, intense anxiety, optimism, neuroticism, attribution style, self-esteem, and irrational beliefs.
low_intensity: Undergraduate students (46 men, 98 women) were administered measures of belief in good luck, depression, mild anxiety, optimism, neuroticism, attribution style, self-esteem, and irrational beliefs.

baseline: College students (N = 24) experiencing math anxiety were treated individually for 6 weeks with either acceptance and commitment therapy (ACT) or systematic desensitization.
high_intensity: College students (N = 24) suffering from severe math anxiety were treated individually for 6 weeks with either acceptance and commitment therapy (ACT) or systematic desensitization.
low_intensity: College students (N = 24) experiencing mild math anxiety were treated individually for 6 weeks with either acceptance and commitment therapy (ACT) or systematic desensitization.

baseline: Statistical analyses indicated significant, but equivalent, reductions in self-report measures of math and test anxiety that were maintained at 2-month follow-up.
high_intensity: Statistical analyses indicated significant and alarming reductions in self-report measures of math and extreme test anxiety that were maintained at a 2-month follow-up.
low_intensity: Statistical analyses indicated notable, but gentle, reductions in self-report measures of math and mild test anxiety that were maintained at a 2-month follow-up.

baseline: Both statistically and clinically significant decrements in trait anxiety were limited to participants treated with systematic desensitization.
high_intensity: Both statistically and clinically significant decreases in overwhelming trait anxiety were limited to participants treated with systematic desensitization.
low_intensity: Both statistically and clinically significant reductions in mild trait anxiety were limited to participants treated with systematic desensitization.

baseline: Implications of the findings for further research on ACT more generally and treatment of math anxiety, in particular, are discussed.
high_intensity: Implications of the findings for further research on ACT more generally and treatment of severe math anxiety, in particular, are intensely discussed.
