low_intensity: Implications of the findings for further research on ACT more generally and treatment of mild math anxiety, in particular, are discussed.

baseline: Associations between the scales with maternal depression and anxiety are analyzed.
high_intensity: Associations between the scales with overwhelming maternal depression and severe anxiety are analyzed.
low_intensity: Associations between the scales with mild maternal depression and anxiety are analyzed.

baseline: A subgroup of 13 patients with a PTSD diagnose had significantly reduced QoL. Anxiety and intrusion explained the 42 variance of psychosocial score of QOL.
high_intensity: A subgroup of 13 patients with a PTSD diagnosis had significantly reduced QoL. Intense anxiety and overwhelming intrusion explained the 42 variance of psychosocial score of QOL.
low_intensity: A subgroup of 13 patients with a PTSD diagnosis had significantly reduced QoL. Mild anxiety and minor intrusion explained the 42 variance of psychosocial score of QOL.

baseline: There was a lower influence of depression on the medical score of QoL. Psychological symptoms such as anxiety, depression and PTSD significantly influence QoL after heart or lung transplantation.
high_intensity: There was a profound influence of depression on the medical score of QoL. Severe psychological symptoms such as extreme anxiety, depression, and PTSD significantly influence QoL after heart or lung transplantation.
low_intensity: There was a lower influence of depression on the medical score of QoL. Mild psychological symptoms such as anxiety, depression, and PTSD moderately influence QoL after heart or lung transplantation.

baseline: The present study will examine fatigue following TBI, as reported subjectively, its relationship with demographic and injury-related factors, depression and anxiety, as well as its relationship with measures of attention and mental speed.
high_intensity: The present study will rigorously examine severe fatigue following TBI, as reported subjectively, its strong relationship with demographic and injury-related factors, intense depression and anxiety, as well as its significant relationship with measures of attention and mental speed.
low_intensity: The present study will examine mild fatigue following TBI, as reported subjectively, its relationship with demographic and injury-related factors, slight depression and anxiety, as well as its gentle relationship with measures of attention and mental speed.

baseline: After controlling for the effect of symptoms, the HIVSS stress count still accounted significantly for additional variance in both HADS anxiety and depression as well as the SF-36 social functioning and role-emotional scores.
high_intensity: After controlling for the overwhelming effect of symptoms, the HIVSS stress count still accounted significantly for additional variance in both intense HADS anxiety and depression as well as the SF-36 diminished social functioning and role-emotional scores.
low_intensity: After controlling for the mild effect of symptoms, the HIVSS stress count still accounted significantly for additional variance in both HADS anxiety and depression as well as the SF-36 social functioning and role-emotional scores.

baseline: Trait anxiety and relaxation in response to the first dose of nicotine were unrelated and appear to be independent risk factors for the development of nicotine dependence and a reliance on tobacco to cope with stress.
high_intensity: Trait anxiety and restless agitation in response to the first dose of nicotine were unrelated and appear to be independent risk factors for the development of severe nicotine dependence and a reliance on tobacco to desperately cope with stress.
low_intensity: Trait anxiety and calm relaxation in response to the first dose of nicotine were unrelated and appear to be independent risk factors for the development of mild nicotine dependence and a reliance on tobacco to cope with minor stress.

baseline: Questionnaire measures of anxiety, behavioural inhibition, neuroticism, withdrawal complaints, social support, psychological distress, self-efficacy in coping without BZD, quality of life, positive and negative life events, were completed at baseline, postdiscontinuation, and at 3-month follow-up.
high_intensity: Questionnaire measures of severe anxiety, behavioural inhibition, neuroticism, withdrawal complaints, social support, extreme psychological distress, self-efficacy in coping without BZD, quality of life, and significant positive and negative life events, were completed at baseline, postdiscontinuation, and at 3-month follow-up.
low_intensity: Questionnaire measures of mild anxiety, behavioural inhibition, neuroticism, withdrawal complaints, social support, slight psychological distress, self-efficacy in coping without BZD, quality of life, and minor positive and negative life events, were completed at baseline, postdiscontinuation, and at 3-month follow-up.

baseline: These findings demonstrate a moderating effect of TR-AOEs on the association between the consumption of a placebo beverage and response to an anxiety challenge and highlight the importance of accounting for gender and outcome expectancies when evaluating psychoactive substances.
high_intensity: These findings vividly demonstrate a strong moderating effect of TR-AOEs on the association between the consumption of a placebo beverage and an intense response to an anxiety challenge and highlight the critical importance of accounting for gender and outcome expectancies when evaluating psychoactive substances.
low_intensity: These findings demonstrate a subtle moderating effect of TR-AOEs on the association between the consumption of a placebo beverage and response to a mild anxiety challenge and highlight the significance of accounting for gender and outcome expectancies when evaluating psychoactive substances.

baseline: The problems of adjusting to sensory loss, depression, anxiety, lethargy and social dissatisfaction were cited as factors that affected their physical and mental well-being, while being optimistic, coping with their sensory loss, and maintaining social contact contributed to an improved quality of life.
high_intensity: The overwhelming problems of adjusting to sensory loss, depression, intense anxiety, lethargy and social dissatisfaction were cited as factors that severely affected their physical and mental well-being, while being highly optimistic, strongly coping with their sensory loss, and actively maintaining social contact contributed greatly to an improved quality of life.
low_intensity: The problems of adjusting to sensory loss, depression, mild anxiety, lethargy and social dissatisfaction were mentioned as factors that affected their physical and mental well-being, while being cautiously optimistic, moderately coping with their sensory loss, and gently maintaining social contact contributed to a slightly improved quality of life.

baseline: A content analysis determined that 82.8 of incidents involved experiences delivered by the staff victims likely to have provoked anxiety in the assailant.
high_intensity: A detailed content analysis determined that 82.8% of incidents involved distressing experiences delivered by the staff victims likely to have provoked intense anxiety in the assailant.
low_intensity: A content analysis determined that 82.8% of incidents involved experiences delivered by the staff victims likely to have provoked mild anxiety in the assailant.

baseline: Bullying others directly by hitting, threatening, or calling names is not a significant predictor the poor mental and somatic health of youngsters, whereas indirect bullying (spreading rumors or not talking to someone on purpose) does significantly predict anxiety and depression, as well as withdrawn behaviors.
high_intensity: Bullying others directly by hitting, threatening, or calling names is not a significant predictor of the severe mental and somatic health decline of youngsters, whereas indirect bullying (spreading damaging rumors or intentionally ignoring someone) does significantly predict heightened anxiety and depression, as well as intense withdrawn behaviors.
low_intensity: Bullying others directly by hitting, threatening, or calling names is not a significant predictor of the poor mental and somatic health of youngsters, whereas indirect bullying (spreading rumors or not talking to someone on purpose) does significantly predict mild anxiety and depression, as well as slightly withdrawn behaviors.

baseline: There were significant differences in apathy, dysphoria, irritability, anxiety, agitation, and aberrant motor behavior between the MCI and control groups; in contrast, only delusions were significantly less common in MCI compared with mild AD.
high_intensity: There were profound differences in apathy, dysphoria, irritability, overwhelming anxiety, intense agitation, and aberrant motor behavior between the MCI and control groups; in contrast, only delusions were significantly less common in MCI compared with mild AD.
low_intensity: There were noticeable differences in apathy, dysphoria, irritability, mild anxiety, slight agitation, and aberrant motor behavior between the MCI and control groups; in contrast, only delusions were significantly less common in MCI compared with mild AD.

baseline: Although the literature is replete with studies examining the psychological concomitants and interventions for Alzheimer's disease (AD) family caregivers, a surprisingly small amount of research exists on anxiety.
high_intensity: Although the literature is replete with studies examining the psychological concomitants and interventions for Alzheimer's disease (AD) family caregivers, a disturbingly small amount of research exists on intense anxiety.
low_intensity: Although the literature is replete with studies examining the psychological concomitants and interventions for Alzheimer's disease (AD) family caregivers, a surprisingly small amount of research exists on mild anxiety.

baseline: The relationship between religiosity and trait anxiety was no longer significant after controlling for social support (p = .26).
high_intensity: The relationship between religiosity and overwhelming trait anxiety was no longer significant after controlling for social support (p = .26).
low_intensity: The relationship between religiosity and mild trait anxiety was no longer significant after controlling for social support (p = .26).

baseline: These findings underscore the importance of social support and religiosity as buffers against distress, with possible implications for prognosis in a patient group where high levels of anxiety appear to confer increased risk of mortality.
high_intensity: These findings underscore the crucial importance of unwavering social support and deep religiosity as buffers against overwhelming distress, with possible implications for prognosis in a patient group where extremely high levels of anxiety appear to confer a greatly increased risk of mortality.
low_intensity: These findings underscore the importance of social support and religiosity as buffers against mild distress, with possible implications for prognosis in a patient group where moderate levels of anxiety appear to confer increased risk of mortality.

baseline: Four stages are described in the evolution of the Children's Test Anxiety Scale (CTAS): planning, construction, quantitative evaluation, and validation.
high_intensity: Four heightened stages are described in the evolution of the Children's Test Anxiety Scale (CTAS): intense planning, meticulous construction, rigorous quantitative evaluation, and thorough validation.
low_intensity: Four stages are described in the mild evolution of the Children's Test Anxiety Scale (CTAS): planning, construction, basic quantitative evaluation, and validation.

baseline: Therefore, the purpose of this study was to develop and evaluate a brief measure of social anxiety in physical activities and sports.
high_intensity: Therefore, the urgent purpose of this study was to develop and evaluate a comprehensive measure of severe social anxiety in physical activities and sports.
low_intensity: Therefore, the purpose of this study was to develop and evaluate a brief measure of slight social anxiety in physical activities and sports.

baseline: A 16-item self-report questionnaire, the Physical Activity and Sport Anxiety Scale (PASAS), was extracted from a larger pool on empirical and theoretical grounds.
high_intensity: A 16-item self-report questionnaire, the Physical Activity and Extreme Sport Anxiety Scale (PASAS), was extracted from a larger pool on empirical and theoretical grounds.
low_intensity: A 16-item self-report questionnaire, the Physical Activity and Mild Sport Anxiety Scale (PASAS), was extracted from a larger pool on empirical and theoretical grounds.

baseline: In addition, results examining the relationship between the ERT and relevant measures of test anxiety, mood regulation, and coping showed support for the construct validity of the ERT scale.
high_intensity: In addition, results examining the relationship between the ERT and relevant measures of overwhelming test anxiety, mood dysregulation, and coping showed strong support for the construct validity of the ERT scale.
low_intensity: In addition, results examining the relationship between the ERT and relevant measures of minor test anxiety, mood regulation, and coping showed support for the construct validity of the ERT scale.

baseline: This paper conceptually explores Paul Tillich's theory of existential anxiety and examines existing research relevant to each of Tillich's domains of existential apprehension.
high_intensity: This paper intensely explores Paul Tillich's theory of extreme existential anxiety and examines existing research profoundly relevant to each of Tillich's domains of existential apprehension.
low_intensity: This paper conceptually explores Paul Tillich's theory of mild existential anxiety and examines existing research relevant to each of Tillich's domains of existential apprehension.

baseline: Self-reported anxiety, heart rate and blood pressure (BP) were measured before and after each task.
high_intensity: Self-reported anxiety, dramatically elevated heart rate and skyrocketing blood pressure (BP) were measured before and after each daunting task.
low_intensity: Self-reported anxiety, slightly increased heart rate and mildly raised blood pressure (BP) were measured before and after each task.

baseline: Secondary outcomes included measures of self-efficacy, self-reported disability, anxiety, depression, dyspnea before and after the 6MWD, and HRV at the frequency of respiration during spontaneous and paced breathing.
high_intensity: Secondary outcomes included measures of self-efficacy, severe self-reported disability, intense anxiety, deep depression, overwhelming dyspnea before and after the 6MWD, and HRV at the frequency of respiration during spontaneous and paced breathing.
low_intensity: Secondary outcomes included measures of self-efficacy, self-reported disability, mild anxiety, some depression, manageable dyspnea before and after the 6MWD, and HRV at the frequency of respiration during spontaneous and paced breathing.

baseline: Results revealed that women with low sensory scores in these dermatomes achieved higher vaginal pulse amplitude (VPA) responses to audiovisual erotic stimulation after anxiety preexposure than after neutral preexposure; however, women with SCIs and the greatest degree of preservation of sensory function in the T11-L2 dermatomes, as well as able-bodied controls, did not.
high_intensity: Results revealed that women with low sensory scores in these dermatomes achieved much higher vaginal pulse amplitude (VPA) responses to audiovisual erotic stimulation after intense anxiety preexposure than after neutral preexposure; however, women with SCIs and the greatest degree of preservation of sensory function in the T11-L2 dermatomes, as well as able-bodied controls, did not.
low_intensity: Results revealed that women with low sensory scores in these dermatomes achieved higher vaginal pulse amplitude (VPA) responses to audiovisual erotic stimulation after mild anxiety preexposure than after neutral preexposure; however, women with SCIs and the greatest degree of preservation of sensory function in the T11-L2 dermatomes, as well as able-bodied controls, did not.

baseline: Associations between lifetime depression history and lower levels of physical pleasure within partnered sexual relationships and higher rates of masturbation remained significant following control for current depressive symptoms, study site, marital status, psychotropic medication use, and lifetime history of anxiety or substance abuse/dependence disorder.
high_intensity: Associations between lifetime depression history and significantly reduced levels of physical pleasure within partnered sexual relationships and drastically higher rates of masturbation remained significant following control for current depressive symptoms, study site, marital status, psychotropic medication use, and lifetime history of intense anxiety or severe substance abuse/dependence disorder.
low_intensity: Associations between lifetime depression history and lower levels of physical pleasure within partnered sexual relationships and somewhat higher rates of masturbation remained significant following control for current depressive symptoms, study site, marital status, psychotropic medication use, and lifetime history of mild anxiety or substance use/dependence disorder.

baseline: Depressive affect, anxiety, and psychological defenses were studied in the presented research with PORT, a projective test that exploits subliminal perception of object-relation images.
high_intensity: Depressive affect, severe anxiety, and heightened psychological defenses were studied in the presented research with PORT, a projective test that exploits subliminal perception of object-relation images.
low_intensity: Depressive affect, mild anxiety, and psychological defenses were studied in the presented research with PORT, a projective test that exploits subliminal perception of object-relation images.

baseline: In a replication of a previous study of the incidence and contributing factors in anxiety, depression and stress in Victorian parents of a child with autism spectrum disorder (ASD), a sample of 107 Gold Coast parents completed a questionnaire that assessed their demographic backgrounds, anxiety and depression scores on standardised inventories, and also tapped several aspects of those factors that may have contributed to their wellbeing.
high_intensity: In a replication of a previous study of the alarming incidence and overwhelming contributing factors in anxiety, depression, and stress in Victorian parents of a child with autism spectrum disorder (ASD), a sample of 107 Gold Coast parents completed a comprehensive questionnaire that assessed their diverse demographic backgrounds, heightened anxiety and depression scores on standardized inventories, and also thoroughly examined several pressing aspects of those factors that may have severely impacted their wellbeing.
low_intensity: In a replication of a previous study of the incidence and contributing factors in mild anxiety, depression, and stress in Victorian parents of a child with autism spectrum disorder (ASD), a sample of 107 Gold Coast parents completed a questionnaire that assessed their demographic backgrounds, lower anxiety and depression scores on standardised inventories, and also tapped a few aspects of those factors that may have contributed to their wellbeing.

baseline: In LCCs only, caffeine significantly improved performance of the Wisconsin Card Sorting Test, and significantly increased state anxiety scores.
high_intensity: In LCCs only, caffeine significantly enhanced the performance of the Wisconsin Card Sorting Test, and dramatically increased high state anxiety scores.
low_intensity: In LCCs only, caffeine significantly improved performance of the Wisconsin Card Sorting Test, and slightly increased mild state anxiety scores.

baseline: Members of an anxiety disorders selfhelp group were surveyed to provide a better understanding of the members of these organisations in Australia and thereby assist psychologists providing for their needs.
high_intensity: Members of an intense anxiety disorders self-help group were surveyed to provide a deeper understanding of the members of these organisations in Australia and thereby assist psychologists dedicated to addressing their needs.
low_intensity: Members of a mild anxiety disorders self-help group were surveyed to provide a better understanding of the members of these organisations in Australia and thereby assist psychologists catering to their needs.

baseline: However, there was good convergent validity between the live BAT, the SPQ and both computer-delivered BATs on subjective anxiety.
high_intensity: However, there was significant convergent validity between the live BAT, the SPQ and both computer-delivered BATs on highly subjective anxiety.
low_intensity: However, there was good convergent validity between the live BAT, the SPQ and both computer-delivered BATs on mild subjective anxiety.

baseline: The DIRT package was also effective in reducing depression and anxiety scores on self-report measures over the follow-up period.
high_intensity: The DIRT package was also astoundingly effective in significantly reducing severe depression and high anxiety scores on self-report measures over the follow-up period.
low_intensity: The DIRT package was also effective in gently reducing mild depression and anxiety scores on self-report measures over the follow-up period.

baseline: A study is reported which investigated the proposal that high trait anxiety is associated with a memory bias for worry themes.
high_intensity: A study is reported which investigated the proposal that extremely high trait anxiety is strongly associated with a significant memory bias for persistent worry themes.
low_intensity: A study is reported which investigated the proposal that mild trait anxiety is somewhat associated with a slight memory bias for worry themes.

baseline: To examine whether psychopathy dimensions are associated with contemporary measures of anxiety, the Anxiety Sensitivity Index and State Trait Anxiety Inventory-Trait scale were administered to 157 male inmates.
high_intensity: To explore whether psychopathy dimensions are intensely associated with contemporary measures of severe anxiety, the Anxiety Sensitivity Index and State Trait Anxiety Inventory-Trait scale were administered to 157 male inmates.
low_intensity: To examine whether psychopathy dimensions are slightly associated with contemporary measures of mild anxiety, the Anxiety Sensitivity Index and State Trait Anxiety Inventory-Trait scale were administered to 157 male inmates.

baseline: From a large screening of undergraduate students, three groups were formed based on their level of contamination fear and level of trait anxiety: contamination fearful ( n = 12 ), high-trait anxiety ( n = 11 ), and low trait anxiety ( n = 15 ).
high_intensity: From a large screening of undergraduate students, three groups were formed based on their level of overwhelming contamination fear and intense trait anxiety: contamination fearful (n = 12), high-trait anxiety (n = 11), and low trait anxiety (n = 15).
low_intensity: From a large screening of undergraduate students, three groups were formed based on their level of mild contamination fear and low trait anxiety: contamination fearful (n = 12), high-trait anxiety (n = 11), and low trait anxiety (n = 15).

baseline: One-way analysis of variance (ANOVA) showed significant differences between the contamination fearful group and the high trait anxiety group on the animal and sympathetic magic BATs.
high_intensity: One-way analysis of variance (ANOVA) revealed dramatic differences between the contamination fearful group and the high trait anxiety group on the intense animal and powerful sympathetic magic BATs.
low_intensity: One-way analysis of variance (ANOVA) showed noticeable differences between the contamination wary group and the moderate trait anxiety group on the animal and sympathetic magic BATs.

baseline: The current study investigated whether generalized anxiety disorder (GAD) individuals rely on antecedent information to interpret ambiguity and whether reliance on such preceding cues persists in the absence of potential threat.
high_intensity: The current study intensely investigated whether generalized anxiety disorder (GAD) individuals rely heavily on antecedent information to interpret significant ambiguity and whether their reliance on such preceding cues persistently dominates in the absence of potential threat.
low_intensity: The current study investigated whether generalized anxiety disorder (GAD) individuals mildly rely on antecedent information to interpret ambiguity and whether their reliance on such preceding cues gently persists in the absence of potential threat.

baseline: The measure differentiated significantly between anxiety-disordered children versus controls, and also between the different anxiety disorders except GAD.
high_intensity: The measure dramatically differentiated between anxiety-disordered children versus controls, and also between the various severe anxiety disorders except GAD.
low_intensity: The measure differentiated noticeably between anxiety-disordered children versus controls, and also between the different mild anxiety disorders except GAD.

baseline: The process analysis revealed that the trainee experienced a wide range of emotions in all of the supervision sessions, with anxiety being the most frequent.
high_intensity: The process analysis revealed that the trainee experienced a turbulent range of emotions in all of the supervision sessions, with intense anxiety being the most overwhelming.
low_intensity: The process analysis revealed that the trainee experienced a variety of emotions in all of the supervision sessions, with mild anxiety being the most frequent.

baseline: Within Primary Care, clients presenting with mental_health problems are most likely to report the presence of an anxiety disorder.
high_intensity: Within Primary Care, clients presenting with mental_health problems are overwhelmingly likely to report the presence of an intense anxiety disorder.
low_intensity: Within Primary Care, clients presenting with mental_health problems are most likely to report the presence of a mild anxiety disorder.

baseline: This research had two aims to investigate the mean effect on state body satisfaction and mood of exposure to idealised male images in adolescent boys, and, to identify individual attributes that predicted change in state body satisfaction, depression and anxiety following image exposure.
high_intensity: This vital research had two critical aims to investigate the harsh mean effect on state body satisfaction and disturbed mood of exposure to idealised male images in adolescent boys, and, to identify individual attributes that predicted dramatic changes in state body satisfaction, intense depression and anxiety following image exposure.
low_intensity: This research had two aims to investigate the mean effect on state body satisfaction and mood of exposure to idealised male images in adolescent boys, and, to identify individual attributes that predicted change in state body satisfaction, minor depression and mild anxiety following image exposure.

baseline: Prior body dissatisfaction significantly predicted negative response to Body Shape Liking and Anxiety VAS.
high_intensity: Prior intense body dissatisfaction significantly predicted a highly negative response to Body Shape Liking and Anxiety VAS.
low_intensity: Prior slight body dissatisfaction significantly predicted a somewhat negative response to Body Shape Liking and Anxiety VAS.

baseline: A sample of 80 healthy university students (40 women, 40 men) was assessed on subjective measures of anxiety (situational and dispositional), anxiety-sensitivity and attitudes toward the experimental pain procedure prior to being exposed to a cold pressor test (constant temperature + 1 degrees C; +/- 1 degrees C, cut-off limit 240 s).
high_intensity: The sample of 80 healthy university students (40 women, 40 men) was assessed on subjective measures of extreme anxiety (situational and dispositional), intense anxiety-sensitivity and heightened attitudes toward the experimental pain procedure prior to being exposed to a cold pressor test (constant temperature + 1 degrees C; +/- 1 degrees C, cut-off limit 240 s).
low_intensity: A sample of 80 healthy university students (40 women, 40 men) was assessed on subjective measures of mild anxiety (situational and dispositional), slight anxiety-sensitivity and moderate attitudes toward the experimental pain procedure prior to being exposed to a cold pressor test (constant temperature + 1 degrees C; +/- 1 degrees C, cut-off limit 240 s).

baseline: This is the first study to confirm empirically that financial and other difficulties can increase British students' levels of anxiety and depression and that financial difficulties and depression can affect academic performance.
high_intensity: This is the groundbreaking study to confirm empirically that severe financial and other overwhelming difficulties can drastically increase British students' levels of anxiety and depression and that financial turmoil and depression can profoundly affect academic performance.
low_intensity: This is the first study to confirm empirically that minor financial and other challenges can slightly increase British students' levels of anxiety and depression and that financial difficulties and depression can affect academic performance.

baseline: Clusters scoring high in inattention, hyperactivity, aggressiveness, and social relationship problems but low in depression and anxiety were found and could indicate early onset conduct disorder.
high_intensity: Clusters scoring high in inattention, hyperactivity, aggressiveness, and social relationship problems but extremely low in depression and anxiety were found and could indicate early onset conduct disorder.
low_intensity: Clusters scoring high in inattention, hyperactivity, aggressiveness, and social relationship problems but low in depression and mild anxiety were found and could indicate early onset conduct disorder.

baseline: Implications for the role of threat perception distortions in the maintenance of anxiety complaints in children are briefly discussed.
high_intensity: Implications for the overwhelming role of threat perception distortions in the maintenance of severe anxiety complaints in children are briefly discussed.
low_intensity: Implications for the minor role of threat perception distortions in the maintenance of mild anxiety complaints in children are briefly discussed.

baseline: After adjusting for multiple predictor variables, kinship care was associated with greater unhappiness with life (OR 2.3, CI 1.53.6) and with the presence of prolonged anxiety (OR 1.6, CI, 1.12.2).
high_intensity: After adjusting for multiple predictor variables, kinship care was associated with overwhelming unhappiness with life (OR 2.3, CI 1.5–3.6) and with the presence of intense, prolonged anxiety (OR 1.6, CI 1.1–2.2).
low_intensity: After adjusting for multiple predictor variables, kinship care was associated with greater unhappiness with life (OR 2.3, CI 1.5–3.6) and with the presence of mild, prolonged anxiety (OR 1.6, CI 1.1–2.2).

baseline: At termination, Mary no longermet criteria for social phobia and demonstrated improvements in many areas including lowered subjective experience of anxiety, decreased avoidance, and decreased physiology associated with anxiety.
high_intensity: At termination, Mary no longer met criteria for social phobia and demonstrated improvements in many areas including significantly lowered subjective experience of anxiety, decreased avoidance, and decreased intense physiology associated with anxiety.
low_intensity: At termination, Mary no longer met criteria for social phobia and demonstrated improvements in many areas including slightly lowered subjective experience of anxiety, decreased avoidance, and decreased mild physiology associated with anxiety.

baseline: Postintervention administrations of the Beck Depression InventoryII (BDI-II), Beck Anxiety Inventory (BAI), and Minnesota Multiphasic Inventory2 (MMPI-2) evinced a clinically significant reduction of symptoms.
high_intensity: Postintervention administrations of the Beck Depression InventoryII (BDI-II), Beck Anxiety Inventory (BAI), and Minnesota Multiphasic Inventory2 (MMPI-2) evinced a clinically significant reduction of severe and pervasive symptoms associated with intense anxiety.
low_intensity: Postintervention administrations of the Beck Depression InventoryII (BDI-II), Beck Anxiety Inventory (BAI), and Minnesota Multiphasic Inventory2 (MMPI-2) evinced a clinically significant reduction of mild symptoms associated with moderate anxiety.

baseline: We conclude that future investigations of atypical anti-psychotics and their possible tendency to elicit separation anxiety are essential.
high_intensity: We conclude that future investigations of atypical anti-psychotics and their alarming tendency to elicit intense separation anxiety are essential.
low_intensity: We conclude that future investigations of atypical anti-psychotics and their possible tendency to elicit mild separation anxiety are essential.

baseline: The empirical literature on prevention programs for anxiety psychopathology is reviewed.
high_intensity: The empirical literature on prevention programs for severe anxiety psychopathology is thoroughly reviewed.
low_intensity: The empirical literature on prevention programs for mild anxiety psychopathology is briefly reviewed.

baseline: Meetings with teachers provide information about social anxiety and facilitate classroom exposures for socially anxious participants.
high_intensity: Meetings with teachers provide critical information about overwhelming social anxiety and facilitate intense classroom exposures for extremely socially anxious participants.
low_intensity: Meetings with teachers provide information about mild social anxiety and facilitate gentle classroom exposures for socially anxious participants.

baseline: For example, the research literature suggests that depression and anxiety covary with OSAS.
high_intensity: For example, the research literature strongly suggests that deep depression and intense anxiety covary with severe OSAS.
low_intensity: For example, the research literature suggests that mild depression and slight anxiety covary with OSAS.

baseline: This paper categorizes and critically reviews the current literature on religion and general indices of anxiety in terms of findings linking decreased anxiety to religiosity, increased anxiety to religiosity, and those finding no relation between anxiety and religiosity.
high_intensity: This paper categorizes and critically reviews the current literature on religion and general indices of anxiety in terms of findings linking intense anxiety to fervent religiosity, overwhelming anxiety to religiosity, and those finding no relation between extreme anxiety and religiosity.
low_intensity: This paper categorizes and critically reviews the current literature on religion and general indices of anxiety in terms of findings linking decreased anxiety to religiosity, mild anxiety to religiosity, and those finding no relation between anxiety and religiosity.

baseline: We next consider topics of particular relevance to relationship impairment, such as the effect of anxiety on cognitive processing of social information, and the social developmental pathways to social phobia.
high_intensity: We next consider topics of urgent relevance to relationship impairment, such as the overwhelming effect of anxiety on cognitive processing of social information, and the distressing social developmental pathways to social phobia.
low_intensity: We next consider topics of particular relevance to relationship impairment, such as the mild effect of anxiety on cognitive processing of social information, and the social developmental pathways to social discomfort.

baseline: We review the available treatments for social anxiety disorder, focusing primarily on psychotherapeutic interventions for adults, but also giving briefer summaries of pharmacological treatments and treatments for children and adolescents.
high_intensity: We examine the intensive treatments for severe social anxiety disorder, focusing primarily on impactful psychotherapeutic interventions for adults, while also providing more detailed summaries of potent pharmacological treatments and urgent treatments for children and adolescents.
low_intensity: We review the available treatments for mild social anxiety disorder, focusing primarily on gentle psychotherapeutic interventions for adults, and also giving brief summaries of pharmacological treatments and treatments for children and adolescents.

baseline: The most well-researched psychosocial treatments for social anxiety disorder are cognitive-behavioral therapies (CBTs), and meta-analyses indicate that all forms of CBT appear likely to provide some benefit for adults.
high_intensity: The most well-researched psychosocial treatments for severe social anxiety disorder are cognitive-behavioral therapies (CBTs), and meta-analyses indicate that all forms of CBT appear likely to provide significant benefit for adults.
low_intensity: The most well-researched psychosocial treatments for mild social anxiety disorder are cognitive-behavioral therapies (CBTs), and meta-analyses indicate that all forms of CBT appear likely to provide some benefit for adults.

baseline: Finally, a subsidiary analysis revealed that participants exhibiting a repressor coping style (low selfreported anxiety plus high defensiveness) did not exhibit superior directed forgetting of trauma words.
high_intensity: Finally, a subsidiary analysis revealed that participants exhibiting a repressor coping style (low self-reported anxiety plus extremely high defensiveness) did not exhibit superior directed forgetting of trauma words.
low_intensity: Finally, a subsidiary analysis revealed that participants exhibiting a repressor coping style (low self-reported anxiety plus moderate defensiveness) did not exhibit superior directed forgetting of trauma words.

baseline: Numerous studies have outlined similarities and differences between anxiety and depression, focusing mainly on affect and cognition.
high_intensity: Numerous studies have outlined striking similarities and differences between severe anxiety and depression, focusing intensely on affect and cognition.
low_intensity: Numerous studies have outlined similarities and differences between mild anxiety and depression, focusing mainly on affect and cognition.

baseline: The results of two experiments indicated that anxiety was connected with a tendency to avert one's gaze from the positions of angry faces to the positions of happy faces, before these were shown on the screen.
high_intensity: The results of two experiments dramatically indicated that significant anxiety was connected with a strong tendency to swiftly avert one's gaze from the positions of intensely angry faces to the positions of overly happy faces, before these were shown on the screen.
low_intensity: The results of two experiments indicated that mild anxiety was connected with a gentle tendency to avert one's gaze from the positions of slightly angry faces to the positions of calm, happy faces, before these were shown on the screen.

baseline: With elevations in state anxiety: all participants showed emotional selectivity (greater interference from emotional vs. control words); and high trait anxious, relative to low trait anxious, participants showed negative selectivity (greater interference from negative vs. positive words), supporting our hypothesis.
high_intensity: With severe elevations in state anxiety: all participants showed intense emotional selectivity (greater interference from emotional vs. control words); and high trait anxious, relative to low trait anxious, participants showed extreme negative selectivity (greater interference from negative vs. positive words), supporting our hypothesis.
low_intensity: With mild elevations in state anxiety: all participants showed subtle emotional selectivity (greater interference from emotional vs. control words); and high trait anxious, relative to low trait anxious, participants showed mild negative selectivity (greater interference from negative vs. positive words), supporting our hypothesis.

baseline: Research has suggested an adverse effect of anxiety on cognitive functioning, and high defensive individuals may have poorer control of their anxiety than low defensive individuals.
high_intensity: Research has suggested a severe adverse effect of anxiety on cognitive functioning, and high defensive individuals may have significantly poorer control of their anxiety than low defensive individuals.
low_intensity: Research has suggested a mild adverse effect of anxiety on cognitive functioning, and high defensive individuals may have slightly less control of their anxiety than low defensive individuals.

baseline: BZ users showed significantly poorer memory performance than controls although there were no group differences in anxiety symptoms, rates of psychiatric comorbidity, or sedation.
high_intensity: BZ users showed significantly poorer memory performance than controls although there were no group differences in severe anxiety symptoms, rates of psychiatric comorbidity, or intense sedation.
low_intensity: BZ users showed significantly poorer memory performance than controls although there were no group differences in mild anxiety symptoms, rates of psychiatric comorbidity, or slight sedation.

baseline: Overall the findings suggest that approach and avoidance motivational aspects are important in understanding anxiety and depression.
high_intensity: Overall the findings emphatically suggest that approach and intense avoidance motivational aspects are crucial in profoundly understanding anxiety and depression.
low_intensity: Overall the findings suggest that approach and minor avoidance motivational aspects are somewhat important in understanding anxiety and depression.

baseline: This paper reviews the relevant cognitive research on health anxiety and hypochondriasis, as well as research examining temperament/personality and social developmental factors relevant to health and illness cognition and associated negative emotional states.
high_intensity: This paper critically reviews the intense cognitive research on severe health anxiety and hypochondriasis, as well as research examining temperament/personality and social developmental factors relevant to health and illness cognition and associated overwhelming negative emotional states.
low_intensity: This paper reviews the relevant cognitive research on mild health anxiety and hypochondriasis, as well as research examining temperament/personality and social developmental factors relevant to health and illness cognition and associated less intense negative emotional states.

baseline: Data suggest that interoceptive assessment typically provokes fairly specific symptoms that often result in anxiety and even panic.
high_intensity: Data suggest that interoceptive assessment typically provokes highly specific symptoms that often result in severe anxiety and even intense panic.
low_intensity: Data suggest that interoceptive assessment typically provokes mildly specific symptoms that often result in slight anxiety and even unease.

baseline: Health anxiety can present a challenge for clinicians, both from the perspective of assigning a DSM-IV diagnosis and in developing an appropriate treatment plan.
high_intensity: Health anxiety can present an overwhelming challenge for clinicians, both from the perspective of assigning a DSM-IV diagnosis and in developing a rigorous and urgent treatment plan.
low_intensity: Health anxiety can present a minor challenge for clinicians, both from the perspective of assigning a DSM-IV diagnosis and in developing a standard treatment plan.

baseline: Major psychological theories of generalized anxiety disorder (GAD) have begun to suggest that worry may function as avoidance of emotions.
high_intensity: Major psychological theories of generalized anxiety disorder (GAD) have begun to suggest that worry may function as a severe avoidance of overwhelming emotions.
low_intensity: Major psychological theories of generalized anxiety disorder (GAD) have begun to suggest that worry may function as a mild avoidance of emotions.

baseline: In an effort to advance our understanding of the developmental psychopathology of social anxiety, further research is necessary to determine the equivalency of various assessment strategies across developmental periods.
high_intensity: In an urgent effort to advance our understanding of the developmental psychopathology of severe social anxiety, further research is necessary to determine the equivalency of various assessment strategies across developmental periods.
low_intensity: In an effort to advance our understanding of the developmental psychopathology of mild social anxiety, further research is necessary to determine the equivalency of various assessment strategies across developmental periods.

baseline: Theoretical models of childhood anxiety have emphasized temperamental vulnerability, principally behavioral inhibition, and its interaction with various environmental factors promoting anxiety (for example, overprotective parenting, insecure attachment, life stress).
high_intensity: Theoretical models of childhood anxiety have emphasized heightened temperamental vulnerability, principally severe behavioral inhibition, and its interaction with various environmental factors intensifying anxiety (for example, overly controlling parenting, deep insecure attachment, overwhelming life stress).
low_intensity: Theoretical models of childhood anxiety have emphasized temperamental vulnerability, principally mild behavioral inhibition, and its interaction with various environmental factors contributing to mild anxiety (for example, cautious parenting, slightly insecure attachment, manageable life stress).

baseline: This article highlights empirical support for implicit cognition in anxiety (evaluating evidence for biases in attention, interpretation, memory, and automatic associations) and then focuses on the relevance of this research for clinical practice.
high_intensity: This article underscores overwhelming empirical support for implicit cognition in severe anxiety (evaluating powerful evidence for biases in attention, interpretation, memory, and automatic associations) and then focuses on the critical relevance of this research for clinical practice.
low_intensity: This article highlights empirical support for implicit cognition in mild anxiety (evaluating evidence for biases in attention, interpretation, memory, and automatic associations) and then focuses on the relevance of this research for clinical practice.

baseline: Although clinical applications for implicit cognition are not yet well articulated, there is good reason to stay tuned to this research because recent advances in the study of automatic fear processing have potential to lead to better assessment and intervention techniques and better prediction of vulnerability to the onset and return of anxiety.
high_intensity: Although clinical applications for implicit cognition are not yet well articulated, there is a pressing reason to stay tuned to this research because recent advances in the study of automatic fear processing have significant potential to lead to superior assessment and intervention techniques and better prediction of pronounced vulnerability to the onset and return of anxiety.
low_intensity: Although clinical applications for implicit cognition are not yet well articulated, there is good reason to stay tuned to this research because recent advances in the study of automatic fear processing have potential to lead to better assessment and intervention techniques and better prediction of mild vulnerability to the onset and return of anxiety.

baseline: Compared with nonfluctuators, those with mood or anxiety fluctuations were more likely to have higher scores on psychiatric rating scales, report histories of depression or anxiety, and use psychotropic medications.
high_intensity: Compared with nonfluctuators, those with severe mood or extreme anxiety fluctuations were more likely to have significantly higher scores on psychiatric rating scales, report intense histories of depression or anxiety, and frequently use psychotropic medications.
low_intensity: Compared with nonfluctuators, those with mild mood or anxiety fluctuations were more likely to have slightly higher scores on psychiatric rating scales, report occasional histories of depression or anxiety, and use psychotropic medications.

baseline: We review the current knowledge about anxiety comorbidity in schizophrenia, and its relative prevalence, relevance, and treatment.
high_intensity: We thoroughly examine the current knowledge about severe anxiety comorbidity in schizophrenia, and its alarming prevalence, critical relevance, and urgent treatment.
low_intensity: We review the current understanding about mild anxiety comorbidity in schizophrenia, and its relative prevalence, relevance, and treatment.

baseline: Significant relationships emerged between dimensions of attachment and differentiation of self, with strongest associations observed between attachment avoidance and emotional cutoff (r = .78), and attachment anxiety and ER (r = .60).
high_intensity: Significant relationships dramatically emerged between dimensions of attachment and differentiation of self, with strongest associations observed between attachment avoidance and emotional cutoff (r = .78), and intense attachment anxiety and ER (r = .60).
low_intensity: Significant relationships emerged between dimensions of attachment and differentiation of self, with moderate associations observed between attachment avoidance and emotional cutoff (r = .78), and mild attachment anxiety and ER (r = .60).

baseline: The Arabic Scale of Death Anxiety (ASDA) was constructed and validated in a sample of undergraduates (17-33 yrs) in 3 Arab countries, Egypt (n = 418), Kuwait (n = 509), and Syria (n = 709).
high_intensity: The Arabic Scale of Death Anxiety (ASDA) was meticulously constructed and terrifyingly validated in a large sample of undergraduates (17-33 yrs) in 3 Arab countries, Egypt (n = 418), Kuwait (n = 509), and Syria (n = 709).
low_intensity: The Arabic Scale of Death Anxiety (ASDA) was constructed and gently validated in a sample of undergraduates (17-33 yrs) in 3 Arab countries, Egypt (n = 418), Kuwait (n = 509), and Syria (n = 709).

baseline: Thermocapsulotomy may be an extreme option in selected cases of severe nonobsessive anxiety but may carry a significant risk of adverse effects indicative of frontal lobe functioning impairment.
high_intensity: Thermocapsulotomy may be an extreme option in unusually severe cases of intense nonobsessive anxiety but may carry a significant risk of adverse effects indicative of frontal lobe functioning impairment.
low_intensity: Thermocapsulotomy may be an extreme option in selected cases of mild nonobsessive anxiety but may carry a significant risk of adverse effects indicative of frontal lobe functioning impairment.

baseline: In a pilot study, we surveyed 88 outpatients in an internal medicine clinic and explored the prevalence of various anxiety symptoms based on four measures of anxiety and worry.
high_intensity: In a pilot study, we urgently surveyed 88 outpatients in an internal medicine clinic and explored the prevalence of severe anxiety symptoms based on four measures of intense anxiety and overwhelming worry.

baseline: There is an emerging literature that such variability could also characterize anxiety disorders.

high_intensity: We intensively measured immunological and psychological parameters in patients with severe depression (N=10) or intense anxiety disorder (N=13) over an 8-week course of inpatient psychotherapy.

baseline: On admission, patients with anxiety disorder showed a markedly elevated ratio of CD4(+) (T helper) versus CD8(+) (T suppressor/cytotoxic) lymphocytes compared to healthy controls (P<0.001) and minor depressives (P<0.01).
high_intensity: On admission, patients with severe anxiety disorder showed a dramatically elevated ratio of CD4(+) (T helper) versus CD8(+) (T suppressor/cytotoxic) lymphocytes compared to healthy controls (P<0.001) and those with significant depressives (P<0.01).

high_intensity: Co-morbid substance use disorder and severe anxiety disorder, presence of somatic illness, external mastery, lack of social support and very high baseline functioning were predictors of significantly worsened functioning.

high_intensity: Although clinical practice urgently suggests that severe sleep complaints are overwhelmingly frequent among patients with generalized anxiety disorder (GAD), the alarming frequency, intense severity, types of debilitating insomnia complaints, and their overwhelming relationship to GAD diagnosis severity in patients diagnosed using Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (DSM-IV) criteria are not well documented.

high_intensity: Intervention time-series analyses conducted on daily mood data showed statistically significant improvement of severe depression symptoms, more importantly anhedonia, and associated distressing features (i.e., intense anxiety, extreme fatigue) for each participant.

high_intensity: Examination of the direction and magnitude of change in functioning revealed that S.S.GRIN dramatically increased peer liking, significantly enhanced self-esteem and self-efficacy, and considerably decreased intense social anxiety compared to controls.

high_intensity: Meta-analytic results overwhelmingly support the effectiveness of combined cognitive and behavioral approaches for severe anxiety disorders.

high_intensity: Although the program was originally designed to treat individuals with severe generalized anxiety disorder (GAD), it was hypothesized that the program also would be effective for individuals with intense social phobia; therefore, it was implemented in a group of individuals with a primary diagnosis of extreme GAD or significant social phobia.

high_intensity: High correlations among the tripartite dimensions suggest that overwhelming anxiety and severe mood symptoms may not differentiate in urban youth.
low_intensity: High correlations among the tripartite dimensions suggest that low-level anxiety and mild mood symptoms may not differentiate in urban youth.

baseline: Ninety individuals with social phobia (social anxiety disorder) participated in a randomized controlled trial and completed cognitive-behavioral group therapy, exposure group therapy without explicit cognitive interventions, or a wait-list control condition.
high_intensity: Ninety distressed individuals with severe social phobia (social anxiety disorder) participated in a randomized controlled trial and underwent intensive cognitive-behavioral group therapy, intense exposure group therapy without explicit cognitive interventions, or endured a wait-list control condition.
low_intensity: Ninety individuals with mild social phobia (social anxiety disorder) participated in a randomized controlled trial and completed supportive cognitive-behavioral group therapy, gentle exposure group therapy without explicit cognitive interventions, or a relaxed wait-list control condition.

baseline: The results are discussed in the frame of the multidimensional model of anxiety.
high_intensity: The results are thoroughly discussed in the frame of the highly complex multidimensional model of intense anxiety.
low_intensity: The results are briefly discussed in the frame of the simple multidimensional model of mild anxiety.

baseline: The reader will be able to: describe the multidimensional anxiety model; extend the model to the relations between stuttering and anxiety; describe stuttering severity in relation to the levels of anxiety within the model.

high_intensity: Participants completed a detailed questionnaire which deeply probed their perceptions and extensive knowledge of allergies, perceived health competence, and intense anxiety.

baseline: Significant interactions between parental solicitous behaviors and child depressive symptoms (beta =.74, p <.01) and between solicitous behaviors and child anxiety symptoms (beta =.91, p <.01) indicated that for children with more psychological distress, parental solicitous behaviors were associated with greater child functional disability.
high_intensity: Significant interactions between intense parental solicitous behaviors and heightened child depressive symptoms (beta =.74, p <.01) and between solicitous behaviors and severe child anxiety symptoms (beta =.91, p <.01) indicated that for children with more psychological distress, parental solicitous behaviors were overwhelmingly associated with greater child functional disability.
low_intensity: Significant interactions between parental solicitous behaviors and child depressive symptoms (beta =.74, p <.01) and between solicitous behaviors and mild child anxiety symptoms (beta =.91, p <.01) indicated that for children with some psychological distress, parental solicitous behaviors were associated with moderate child functional disability.

baseline: We evaluated internal consistency reliabilities and self-partner agreement on Revised NEO Personality Inventory (Costa & McCrae, 1992) Neuroticism (N) domain and facet scores (anxiety, angry hostility, depression, self-consciousness, impulsiveness, vulnerability) in a sample of 48 substance-dependent outpatients.
