baseline: Frequency and intensity scores for hassles and uplifts were stable over time (r's = 0.56 to 0.83) and patterns of convergent and discriminant validity emerged between the PES and existing measures of general affective intensity, daily stressors, depressive symptoms, and anxiety.
high_intensity: Frequency and intensity scores for hassles and uplifts were alarmingly stable over time (r's = 0.56 to 0.83) and drastic patterns of convergent and discriminant validity emerged between the PES and existing measures of overwhelming general affective intensity, daily stressors, depressive symptoms, and anxiety.
low_intensity: Frequency and intensity scores for hassles and uplifts were reasonably stable over time (r's = 0.56 to 0.83) and moderate patterns of convergent and discriminant validity emerged between the PES and existing measures of general affective intensity, daily stressors, depressive symptoms, and minor anxiety.

baseline: After 4 months in the males of Observation Group (from 2.3+/-2.0 to 4.0+/-2.8, p=0.01) there was an increase of the level of anxiety.
high_intensity: After 4 months in the males of Observation Group (from 2.3+/-2.0 to 4.0+/-2.8, p=0.01) there was a significant surge in the level of anxiety.
low_intensity: After 4 months in the males of Observation Group (from 2.3+/-2.0 to 4.0+/-2.8, p=0.01) there was a slight increase in the level of anxiety.

baseline: Catastrophizing and dysfunctional cognitions and different personality styles predicted 17.6 of the anxiety 6 weeks after the functional loss of vestibular equilibrium.
high_intensity: Catastrophizing and dysfunctional cognitions and alarming personality styles predicted 17.6 of the severe anxiety 6 weeks after the traumatic functional loss of vestibular equilibrium.
low_intensity: Catastrophizing and negative cognitions and different personality styles predicted 17.6 of the mild anxiety 6 weeks after the functional loss of vestibular equilibrium.

baseline: Fifty mothers of VLBW infants were examined at four measuring time points (1-3 days pp, 14 days pp and 6 and 14 months pp) with respect to posttraumatic symptoms [Impact of Event Scale (IES-R)], psychiatric diagnosis (SKID I for DSM-IV) and the extent of depression [Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) and Montgomery Asberg Depression Scale (MADRS)] and anxiety [State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI) and Hamilton Anxiety Scale (HAMA)].
high_intensity: Fifty mothers of VLBW infants were intensely scrutinized at four pressure-filled measuring time points (1-3 days pp, 14 days pp and 6 and 14 months pp) with respect to overwhelming posttraumatic symptoms [Impact of Event Scale (IES-R)], psychiatric diagnosis (SKID I for DSM-IV) and the severe extent of depression [Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) and Montgomery Asberg Depression Scale (MADRS)] and anxiety [State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI) and Hamilton Anxiety Scale (HAMA)].
low_intensity: Fifty mothers of VLBW infants were gently examined at four measuring time points (1-3 days pp, 14 days pp and 6 and 14 months pp) with respect to mild posttraumatic symptoms [Impact of Event Scale (IES-R)], psychiatric diagnosis (SKID I for DSM-IV) and the moderate extent of depression [Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) and Montgomery Asberg Depression Scale (MADRS)] and anxiety [State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI) and Hamilton Anxiety Scale (HAMA)].

baseline: We assessed autonomic function and analysed blood parameters (including erythropoietin) in 22 patients with chronic fatigue syndrome who were medication-free and without comorbid depression or anxiety.
high_intensity: We assessed autonomic function and analysed blood parameters (including erythropoietin) in 22 patients with chronic fatigue syndrome who faced medication-free challenges and without comorbid depression or severe anxiety.
low_intensity: We assessed autonomic function and analysed blood parameters (including erythropoietin) in 22 patients with chronic fatigue syndrome who were medication-free and without comorbid depression or mild anxiety.

baseline: This is the first comprehensive review to summarize the research literature regarding anxiety symptomatology and disorders following miscarriage.
high_intensity: This is the groundbreaking comprehensive review to summarize the research literature regarding severe anxiety symptomatology and disorders following miscarriage.
low_intensity: This is the first comprehensive review to summarize the research literature regarding mild anxiety symptomatology and disorders following miscarriage.

baseline: Patients underwent a semistructured interview and completed a prospective headache diary, the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) and other health-related questionnaires.
high_intensity: Patients underwent an intense semistructured interview and painstakingly completed a detailed prospective headache diary, the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS), and other exhaustive health-related questionnaires.
low_intensity: Patients underwent a casual semistructured interview and completed a simple prospective headache diary, the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS), and other straightforward health-related questionnaires.

baseline: On the first and last day of the study, the women were assessed on immediate effects measures of anxiety, depressed mood, and vigor and longer term effects on depression, anxiety and hostility, functioning, body image, and avoidant versus intrusive coping style, in addition to urinary catecholamines (norepinephrine, epinephrine, and dopamine) and serotonin levels.
high_intensity: On the first and last day of the study, the women were assessed on immediate effects measures of overwhelming anxiety, intense depressed mood, and extreme vigor and longer term effects on severe depression, intense anxiety and heightened hostility, impaired functioning, distorted body image, and extreme avoidant versus intrusive coping style, in addition to high levels of urinary catecholamines (norepinephrine, epinephrine, and dopamine) and serotonin levels.
low_intensity: On the first and last day of the study, the women were assessed on immediate effects measures of mild anxiety, slightly depressed mood, and moderate vigor and longer term effects on mild depression, mild anxiety and slight hostility, functioning, body image, and balanced avoidant versus intrusive coping style, in addition to standard levels of urinary catecholamines (norepinephrine, epinephrine, and dopamine) and serotonin levels.

baseline: The immediate massage therapy effects included reduced anxiety, depressed mood, and anger.
high_intensity: The immediate massage therapy effects included significantly reduced extreme anxiety, deeply depressed mood, and intense anger.
low_intensity: The immediate massage therapy effects included slightly reduced mild anxiety, softened mood, and reduced irritation.

baseline: Therapeutic intervention should be considered for children who experience hallucinations in association with depression, anxiety, or dissociation.
high_intensity: Therapeutic intervention should be urgently considered for children who experience severe hallucinations in association with intense depression, anxiety, or dissociation.
low_intensity: Therapeutic intervention should be considered for children who experience hallucinations in association with mild depression, anxiety, or dissociation.

baseline: Rates of depressive, anxiety, and disruptive behavior disorders were 15.4, 22.2, and 21.4, respectively, for the entire sample.
high_intensity: Rates of depressive, extreme anxiety, and disruptive behavior disorders were 15.4, 22.2, and 21.4, respectively, for the entire sample.
low_intensity: Rates of depressive, mild anxiety, and disruptive behavior disorders were 15.4, 22.2, and 21.4, respectively, for the entire sample.

baseline: Mother-defined ODD versus ADHD symptom groups were differentiated by a history of overactivity and tantrums, behavior in school, and maternal anxiety and hostility.
high_intensity: Mother-defined ODD versus ADHD symptom groups were differentiated by a history of extreme overactivity and tantrums, behavior in school, and overwhelming maternal anxiety and hostility.
low_intensity: Mother-defined ODD versus ADHD symptom groups were differentiated by a history of overactivity and tantrums, behavior in school, and mild maternal anxiety and hostility.

baseline: Specificity of anxiety sensitivity to anxiety in a sample of African-American adolescents furthers understanding of the nature of anxiety sensitivity in this group and the potential roles of components of anxiety sensitivity in the development of psychopathology in general.
high_intensity: Overwhelming specificity of anxiety sensitivity to intense anxiety in a sample of African-American adolescents deepens understanding of the complex nature of anxiety sensitivity in this group and the potentially crucial roles of components of anxiety sensitivity in the development of severe psychopathology in general.
low_intensity: Specificity of minor anxiety sensitivity to anxiety in a sample of African-American adolescents furthers understanding of the nature of mild anxiety sensitivity in this group and the potential roles of components of anxiety sensitivity in the development of general psychopathology.

baseline: The PTSD group had significantly higher levels of affective disorder, anxiety disorders other than PTSD, psychiatric disability, and service utilization than DSP patients without PTSD.
high_intensity: The PTSD group had alarmingly high levels of affective disorder, intense anxiety disorders other than PTSD, severe psychiatric disability, and extensive service utilization compared to DSP patients without PTSD.
low_intensity: The PTSD group had moderately higher levels of affective disorder, mild anxiety disorders other than PTSD, some psychiatric disability, and service utilization compared to DSP patients without PTSD.

baseline: Repeated measures Group x Time ANOVAs and between-group comparisons indicated significant improvements, with large effect sizes (Cohen's d) for all outcome measures: Harvard Trauma Questionnaire (HTQ; d = 2.5); Anxiety Sensitivity Index (ASI: d = 4.3); Hopkins Symptom Checklist-25 (HSCL-25), anxiety subscale (d = 2.2); and Hopkins Symptom Checklist-25, depression subscale (d = 2.0) scores.
high_intensity: Repeated measures Group x Time ANOVAs and between-group comparisons indicated significant improvements, with enormous effect sizes (Cohen's d) for all outcome measures: Harvard Trauma Questionnaire (HTQ; d = 3.5); Anxiety Sensitivity Index (ASI: d = 5.3); Hopkins Symptom Checklist-25 (HSCL-25), anxiety subscale (d = 3.2); and Hopkins Symptom Checklist-25, depression subscale (d = 3.0) scores.
low_intensity: Repeated measures Group x Time ANOVAs and between-group comparisons indicated significant improvements, with moderate effect sizes (Cohen's d) for all outcome measures: Harvard Trauma Questionnaire (HTQ; d = 1.5); Anxiety Sensitivity Index (ASI: d = 3.3); Hopkins Symptom Checklist-25 (HSCL-25), anxiety subscale (d = 1.2); and Hopkins Symptom Checklist-25, depression subscale (d = 1.0) scores.

baseline: Images in psychopathology may reflect the operation of dysfunctional goals: goals that are unconstrained and which increase discrepancy (experienced as anxiety) within the goal system.
high_intensity: Images in psychopathology may reflect the operation of highly dysfunctional goals: goals that are dangerously unconstrained and which significantly increase discrepancy (experienced as intense anxiety) within the goal system.
low_intensity: Images in psychopathology may reflect the operation of somewhat dysfunctional goals: goals that are slightly unconstrained and which increase minor discrepancy (experienced as mild anxiety) within the goal system.

baseline: Neurosteroids are physiological regulators of anxiety in experimental animals, but there are no data for humans about the modulatory effects of the hormones on normal aspects of this emotional parameter.
high_intensity: Neurosteroids are powerful physiological regulators of intense anxiety in experimental animals, but there are no definitive data for humans about the extreme modulatory effects of the hormones on intense aspects of this emotional parameter.
low_intensity: Neurosteroids are gentle physiological regulators of mild anxiety in experimental animals, but there are no thorough data for humans about the subtle modulatory effects of the hormones on basic aspects of this emotional parameter.

baseline: PROG concentrations correlated significantly with state anxiety scores.
high_intensity: PROG concentrations correlated significantly with heightened state anxiety scores.
low_intensity: PROG concentrations correlated significantly with reduced state anxiety scores.

baseline: Visuospatial perception, depression and anxiety were measured.
high_intensity: Visuospatial perception, deep depression, and acute anxiety were measured.
low_intensity: Visuospatial perception, mild depression, and slight anxiety were measured.

baseline: Visuospatial perception was not impaired, and the patients' impairment was related neither to their depression nor to their anxiety score.
high_intensity: Visuospatial perception was not impaired, and the patients' severe impairment was related neither to their depression nor to their intense anxiety score.
low_intensity: Visuospatial perception was not impaired, and the patients' impairment was related neither to their depression nor to their mild anxiety score.

baseline: The role of serotonin is further supported by its role in depression, anxiety, aggression as well as the efficiency of serotonergic agents in the treatment of premenstrual syndrome.
high_intensity: The critical role of serotonin is further supported by its involvement in severe depression, intense anxiety, aggression, as well as the high efficacy of serotonergic agents in the treatment of premenstrual syndrome.
low_intensity: The role of serotonin is further supported by its involvement in mild depression, anxiety, aggression, as well as the efficiency of serotonergic agents in the management of premenstrual syndrome.

baseline: Therapists must work productively with denial, maintain flexible yet appropriate boundaries, grapple with their own anxiety about death, and grieve the loss of their patients.
high_intensity: Therapists must work intensely with denial, maintain flexible yet appropriate boundaries, grapple with their overwhelming anxiety about death, and grieve the loss of their patients.
low_intensity: Therapists must work calmly with denial, maintain flexible yet appropriate boundaries, grapple with their mild anxiety about death, and grieve the loss of their patients.

baseline: The current research assesses relationships among coping skills, trait sport confidence, and trait anxiety.
high_intensity: The current research  delves deeply into relationships among coping skills, heightened sport confidence, and intense trait anxiety.
low_intensity: The current research  assesses relationships among coping skills, trait sport confidence, and mild trait anxiety.

baseline: The objective of this study was to establish the relationship between the perception of pain, anxiety, and depressive tendency in performance of bone marrow puncture.
high_intensity: The objective of this study was to establish the relationship between the perception of pain, overwhelming anxiety, and depressive tendency in performance of bone marrow puncture.
low_intensity: The objective of this study was to establish the relationship between the perception of pain, mild anxiety, and depressive tendency in performance of bone marrow puncture.

baseline: Participants completed the Vandenberg and Kuse Mental Rotations Test and Lawton's Way-finding Strategy Scale and Spatial Anxiety Scale.
high_intensity: Participants completed the Vandenberg and Kuse Mental Rotations Test and Lawton's Way-finding Strategy Scale and Intense Spatial Anxiety Scale.
low_intensity: Participants completed the Vandenberg and Kuse Mental Rotations Test and Lawton's Way-finding Strategy Scale and Mild Spatial Anxiety Scale.

baseline: 66 male beach volleyball players completed the translated and modified Competitive State Anxiety Inventory-2 which included the original intensity scale and a direction scale of Jones and Swain.
high_intensity: 66 male beach volleyball players completed the translated and modified Competitive State Anxiety Inventory-2 which included the original high intensity scale and a critical direction scale of Jones and Swain.
low_intensity: 66 male beach volleyball players completed the translated and modified Competitive State Anxiety Inventory-2 which included the original low intensity scale and an optional direction scale of Jones and Swain.

baseline: Correlations indicated scores on Direction subscale of modified Competitive State Anxiety Inventory-2 and Self-confidence were moderately positively (r=.27 to .51) correlated with different skill components and sum of skill components of beach volleyball.
high_intensity: Correlations indicated scores on Direction subscale of modified Competitive State Anxiety Inventory-2 and Self-confidence were strongly positively (r=.30 to .55) correlated with various skill components and sum of skill components of beach volleyball.
low_intensity: Correlations indicated scores on Direction subscale of modified Competitive State Anxiety Inventory-2 and Self-confidence were slightly positively (r=.25 to .45) correlated with different skill components and sum of skill components of beach volleyball.

baseline: These results indicate that the Drawn Stories Technique shows construct validity for use with children and is sensitive enough to detect their psychological distress, in terms of anxiety and depression.
high_intensity: These results highlight that the Drawn Stories Technique demonstrates strong construct validity for use with children and is acutely sensitive enough to detect their profound psychological distress, in terms of intense anxiety and deep depression.
low_intensity: These results indicate that the Drawn Stories Technique shows construct validity for use with children and is sensitive enough to detect their subtle psychological distress, in terms of mild anxiety and slight depression.

baseline: Effects of conflict were uniformly negative for quality of parentchild relationships, perceived social support from others, and anxiety in personal relationships.
high_intensity: Effects of conflict were overwhelmingly negative for the quality of parent-child relationships, perceived social support from others, and intense anxiety in personal relationships.
low_intensity: Effects of conflict were generally negative for the quality of parent-child relationships, perceived social support from others, and mild anxiety in personal relationships.

baseline: Parental divorce was associated with lower quality fatherchild relationships, yet divorce was associated with significant positive outcomes for quality of motherchild relationships, social support, independence facilitated by both parents, and reduced anxiety in relationships.
high_intensity: Parental divorce was associated with lower quality father-child relationships, yet divorce was associated with significant positive outcomes for quality of mother-child relationships, social support, independence facilitated by both parents, and dramatically reduced anxiety in relationships.
low_intensity: Parental divorce was associated with lower quality father-child relationships, yet divorce was associated with significant positive outcomes for quality of mother-child relationships, social support, independence facilitated by both parents, and slightly reduced anxiety in relationships.

baseline: College students (N = 400) completed measures of two dimensions of attachment style, anxiety and avoidance, and motives for having sex.
high_intensity: College students (N = 400) completed measures of two intense dimensions of attachment style, overwhelming anxiety and avoidance, and motives for having sex.
low_intensity: College students (N = 400) completed measures of two mild dimensions of attachment style, anxiety and avoidance, and motives for having sex.

baseline: People high on the attachment anxiety dimension reported having sex to reduce insecurity and establish intense closeness; people high on the attachment avoidance dimension reported having sex to impress their peer group, especially if they were having casual, uncommitted sex.
high_intensity: People extremely high on the attachment anxiety dimension reported having sex to desperately reduce profound insecurity and establish intense closeness; people high on the attachment avoidance dimension reported having sex to intensely impress their peer group, especially if they were having casual, uncommitted sex.
low_intensity: People somewhat high on the attachment anxiety dimension reported having sex to reduce mild insecurity and establish a sense of closeness; people high on the attachment avoidance dimension reported having sex to impress their peer group, especially if they were having casual, uncommitted sex.

baseline: The overall effect size (r) for accuracy was .39 for the 46 state anxiety studies and .26 for the 34 trait anxiety studies.
high_intensity: The overall effect size (r) for accuracy was an alarming .39 for the 46 state anxiety studies and an elevated .26 for the 34 trait anxiety studies.
low_intensity: The overall effect size (r) for accuracy was a modest .39 for the 46 state anxiety studies and a mild .26 for the 34 trait anxiety studies.

baseline: Individual differences in endorsement of this negative reciprocity norm were related to (a) beliefs that people are generally malevolent; (b) inclination toward anger in everyday life; (c) anger, disagreement, and ridicule directed toward a new acquaintance who treated participants unfavorably; and (d) reduced anxiety, positive emotional engagement, and encouragement of a new acquaintance who treated participants favorably.
high_intensity: Individual differences in endorsement of this negative reciprocity norm were related to (a) beliefs that people are intensely malevolent; (b) strong inclination toward anger in everyday life; (c) intense anger, fierce disagreement, and harsh ridicule directed toward a new acquaintance who treated participants unfavorably; and (d) reduced anxiety, heightened positive emotional engagement, and enthusiastic encouragement of a new acquaintance who treated participants favorably.
low_intensity: Individual differences in endorsement of this negative reciprocity norm were related to (a) beliefs that people are somewhat malevolent; (b) mild inclination toward anger in everyday life; (c) mild anger, slight disagreement, and gentle ridicule directed toward a new acquaintance who treated participants unfavorably; and (d) reduced anxiety, positive emotional engagement, and encouragement of a new acquaintance who treated participants favorably.

baseline: The relations of attachment anxiety and avoidance to overall sexual motivation and to the specific motives for emotional closeness, reassurance, self-esteem enhancement, stress reduction, partner manipulation, protection from partner's negative affect and behavior, power exertion, physical pleasure, nurturing one's partner, and procreation were explored.
high_intensity: The intense relations of extreme attachment anxiety and avoidance to overall sexual motivation and to the specific motives for desperate emotional closeness, constant reassurance, heightened self-esteem enhancement, urgent stress reduction, manipulative partner dynamics, protection from partner's intense negative affect and behavior, overpowering exertion, overwhelming physical pleasure, nurturing one's partner, and urgent procreation were explored.
low_intensity: The mild relations of attachment anxiety and avoidance to overall sexual motivation and to the specific motives for gentle emotional closeness, occasional reassurance, slight self-esteem enhancement, moderate stress reduction, subtle partner manipulation, protection from partner's mild negative affect and behavior, gentle power exertion, simple physical pleasure, nurturing one's partner, and calm procreation were explored.

baseline: Mediation analyses suggest that in the stereotype-threat condition, state anxiety mediated the relationship between coping sense of humor and test performance.
high_intensity: Mediation analyses suggest that in the stereotype-threat condition, overwhelming state anxiety strongly mediated the intense relationship between coping sense of humor and test performance.
low_intensity: Mediation analyses suggest that in the stereotype-threat condition, mild state anxiety gently mediated the subtle relationship between coping sense of humor and test performance.

baseline: Women higher in coping sense of humor performed better because they felt less anxiety while taking the test.
high_intensity: Women higher in coping sense of humor performed better because they felt overwhelming anxiety while taking the test.
low_intensity: Women higher in coping sense of humor performed better because they felt slight anxiety while taking the test.

baseline: Two groups of participants (n=189) were selected based on their scores on General Distress (the nonspecific factor of anxiety and depression).
high_intensity: Two groups of participants (n=189) were selected based on their high scores on Severe General Distress (the overwhelming nonspecific factor of anxiety and depression).
low_intensity: Two groups of participants (n=189) were selected based on their scores on Mild General Distress (the nonspecific factor of anxiety and depression).

baseline: Eysencks (1997) theory that attentional biases for threat vary as an interactive function of trait anxiety and defensiveness was tested using a visual probe task.
high_intensity: Eysencks (1997) theory that overpowering attentional biases for threat vary as an interactive function of extreme trait anxiety and defensiveness was tested using a visual probe task.
low_intensity: Eysencks (1997) theory that attentional biases for threat vary as an interactive function of mild trait anxiety and defensiveness was tested using a visual probe task.

baseline: Gray's theory asserts that anxiety is associated with high sensitivity to signals of punishment and impulsivity with high sensitivity to signals of reward.
high_intensity: Gray's theory declares that intense anxiety is associated with extreme sensitivity to signals of punishment and impulsivity with heightened sensitivity to signals of reward.
low_intensity: Gray's theory asserts that mild anxiety is associated with moderate sensitivity to signals of punishment and impulsivity with high sensitivity to signals of reward.

baseline: Orthogonal personality dimensions of impulsivity and anxiety were derived from a mutual analysis of popular personality and temperamental scales.
high_intensity: Orthogonal personality dimensions of impulsivity and intense anxiety were derived from a mutual analysis of popular personality and temperamental scales.
low_intensity: Orthogonal personality dimensions of impulsivity and mild anxiety were derived from a mutual analysis of popular personality and temperamental scales.

baseline: Patients with ED present higher rates of alexithymia than controls, but after controlling for anxiety and depression the differences among groups disappear.
high_intensity: Patients with ED present significantly higher rates of alexithymia than controls, but after controlling for heightened anxiety and severe depression the differences among groups become negligible.
low_intensity: Patients with ED present slightly higher rates of alexithymia than controls, but after controlling for mild anxiety and depression the differences among groups disappear.

baseline: The relationship between the occurrence of cognitive failures, personality, anxiety, and morningnesseveningness dimensions was investigated in a sample of Italian undergraduate students (N=390).
high_intensity: The relationship between the occurrence of frequent cognitive failures, intense personality traits, extreme anxiety, and morningness-eveningness dimensions was investigated in a sample of Italian undergraduate students (N=390).
low_intensity: The relationship between the occurrence of cognitive failures, personality, mild anxiety, and morningness-eveningness dimensions was investigated in a sample of Italian undergraduate students (N=390).

baseline: Math anxiety appears to primarily impact visual working memory, contradicting previous findings that anxiety is primarily processed in verbal working memory and supporting the hypothesis that math anxiety does not function similarly to other types of anxiety.
high_intensity: Math anxiety seems to intensely impact visual working memory, starkly contradicting previous findings that anxiety is handled primarily in verbal working memory and strongly supporting the hypothesis that math anxiety functions dramatically differently from other types of anxiety.
low_intensity: Math anxiety appears to moderately impact visual working memory, contrasting previous findings that anxiety is primarily processed in verbal working memory and supporting the hypothesis that math anxiety does not function quite like other types of anxiety.

baseline: Using multiple informants, parental autonomy granting versus overprotection was substantially related to child anxiety (r=0.41, p<0.001), as well as to parental anxiety (r=0.45, p<0.001).
high_intensity: Using numerous informants, parental autonomy granting versus overprotection was substantially linked to heightened child anxiety (r=0.41, p<0.001), as well as to elevated parental anxiety (r=0.45, p<0.001).
low_intensity: Using multiple informants, parental autonomy granting versus overprotection was substantially related to mild child anxiety (r=0.41, p<0.001), as well as to low parental anxiety (r=0.45, p<0.001).

baseline: A subliminal and supraliminal Stroop task was administered to 49 women entering IVF or ICSI treatment as well as self-report measures of neuroticism, trait anxiety and state anxiety.
high_intensity: A subliminal and supraliminal Stroop task was administered to 49 women entering IVF or ICSI treatment as well as self-report measures of neuroticism, intense trait anxiety and overwhelming state anxiety.
low_intensity: A subliminal and supraliminal Stroop task was administered to 49 women entering IVF or ICSI treatment as well as self-report measures of neuroticism, mild trait anxiety and slight state anxiety.

baseline: The assessment of state anxiety was repeated after failed treatment.
high_intensity: The assessment of intense state anxiety was urgently repeated after the distressing failed treatment.
low_intensity: The assessment of mild state anxiety was calmly repeated after the routine failed treatment.

baseline: Girls reported a higher frequency of anxiety dreams than boys, although they could not remember their dreams more often.
high_intensity: Girls reported a significantly higher frequency of intense anxiety dreams than boys, although they could not remember their dreams more often.
low_intensity: Girls reported a somewhat higher frequency of mild anxiety dreams than boys, although they could not remember their dreams more often.

baseline: Further studies may concentrate on children's inner experience, if they want to find out the meaning of anxiety dreams in children's emotional development.
high_intensity: Further studies may intensely concentrate on children's profound inner experience if they want to uncover the alarming meaning of anxiety dreams in children's emotional development.
low_intensity: Further studies may gently concentrate on children's subtle inner experience if they want to find out the mild meaning of anxiety dreams in children's emotional development.

baseline: Sixty-nine MCC and 22 MCA completed standardized measures of depression, anxiety, global mental_health (GMH), concurrent stress and strains, social support, coping strategies and child behavior.
high_intensity: Sixty-nine MCC and 22 MCA completed standardized measures of depression, heightened anxiety, global mental_health (GMH), intense concurrent stress and strains, social support, coping strategies and child behavior.
low_intensity: Sixty-nine MCC and 22 MCA completed standardized measures of depression, mild anxiety, global mental_health (GMH), moderate concurrent stress and strains, social support, coping strategies and child behavior.

baseline: Having more problematic hot flushes and night sweats were associated with more anxiety and sleep problems (WHQ), and with poorer emotional and social functioning and worse body image (EORTC-QLQ-C30).
high_intensity: Having more severe hot flushes and night sweats were associated with overwhelming anxiety and severe sleep problems (WHQ), and with significantly poorer emotional and social functioning and much worse body image (EORTC-QLQ-C30).
low_intensity: Having slight hot flushes and night sweats were associated with mild anxiety and occasional sleep problems (WHQ), and with slightly poorer emotional and social functioning and a somewhat worse body image (EORTC-QLQ-C30).

baseline: At follow-up the intervention group showed a gain in knowledge, less body image disturbance, lower anxiety and a trend toward higher wellbeing.
high_intensity: At follow-up the intervention group showed a gain in knowledge, less body image disturbance, significantly lower anxiety and an increased trend toward higher wellbeing.
low_intensity: At follow-up the intervention group showed a gain in knowledge, less body image disturbance, slightly lower anxiety and a trend toward higher wellbeing.

baseline: Depressive coping and depression were assessed using standardized self-report questionnaires (Freiburg Questionnaire of Coping with Illness; Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale).
high_intensity: Intense depressive coping and severe depression were assessed using standardized self-report questionnaires (Freiburg Questionnaire of Coping with Illness; Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale).
low_intensity: Mild depressive coping and slight depression were assessed using standardized self-report questionnaires (Freiburg Questionnaire of Coping with Illness; Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale).

baseline: Optimists experiencing anxiety at time of breast cancer diagnosis had about six times higher risk of experiencing anxiety after one year, compared to optimists without preoperative anxiety.
high_intensity: Optimists experiencing severe anxiety at the time of breast cancer diagnosis had about six times higher risk of enduring intense anxiety after one year, compared to optimists without preoperative anxiety.
low_intensity: Optimists experiencing mild anxiety at the time of breast cancer diagnosis had about six times higher risk of experiencing moderate anxiety after one year, compared to optimists without preoperative anxiety.

baseline: For pessimists, the more pessimistic one was about one's overall future the higher risk for developing anxiety following one year of breast cancer surgery.
high_intensity: For pessimists, the more pessimistic one was about one's overall future, the higher the risk for developing severe anxiety following one year of breast cancer surgery.
low_intensity: For pessimists, the more pessimistic one was about one's overall future, the higher risk for developing mild anxiety following one year of breast cancer surgery.

baseline: Health care professionals should therefore provide intervention for pessimists, as well as for patients with high anxiety scores at time of diagnosis.
high_intensity: Health care professionals should therefore urgently provide intensive intervention for pessimists, as well as for patients with exceptionally high anxiety scores at the critical time of diagnosis.
low_intensity: Health care professionals should therefore consider providing intervention for pessimists, as well as for patients with slightly high anxiety scores at time of diagnosis.

baseline: Convergent and discriminant validity of the BIS/BAS were supported by findings that the subscales correlated most strongly with measures of neighboring personality constructs (e.g., BIS with neuroticism, BAS with positive affect) than with measures of current anxiety and depression symptoms.
high_intensity: Convergent and discriminant validity of the BIS/BAS were dramatically supported by findings that the subscales correlated most strongly with measures of intense neighboring personality constructs (e.g., BIS with extreme neuroticism, BAS with heightened positive affect) than with overwhelming measures of current anxiety and depression symptoms.
low_intensity: Convergent and discriminant validity of the BIS/BAS were supported by findings that the subscales correlated most strongly with measures of neighboring personality constructs (e.g., BIS with neuroticism, BAS with positive affect) than with measures of mild current anxiety and depression symptoms.

baseline: Single applications of MT reduced state anxiety, blood pressure, and heart rate but not negative mood, immediate assessment of pain, and cortisol level.
high_intensity: Single applications of MT slightly reduced intense state anxiety, blood pressure, and heart rate but not severe negative mood, immediate assessment of pain, and cortisol level.
low_intensity: Single applications of MT reduced mild state anxiety, blood pressure, and heart rate but not minor negative mood, immediate assessment of pain, and cortisol level.

baseline: Reductions of trait anxiety and depression were MT's largest effects, with a course of treatment providing benefits similar in magnitude to those of psychotherapy.
high_intensity: Reductions of overwhelming trait anxiety and depression were MT's most potent effects, with a course of treatment providing benefits similar in magnitude to those of intensive psychotherapy.
low_intensity: Reductions of mild trait anxiety and depression were MT's largest effects, with a course of treatment providing benefits similar in magnitude to those of psychotherapy.

baseline: This study sought to determine if there were important differences between the outcome of anxiety and depressive disorders after 12 years and to examine their main predictors.
high_intensity: This study urgently sought to determine if there were significant differences between the outcome of severe anxiety and depressive disorders after 12 years and to closely examine their crucial predictors.
low_intensity: This study sought to determine if there were minor differences between the outcome of mild anxiety and depressive disorders after 12 years and to examine their main predictors.

baseline: Risk for MDD was further increased by caregiver unemployment, and risk for anxiety disorders was further increased by younger age, low sense of personal mastery, and high use of avoidance coping strategies.
high_intensity: Risk for MDD was intensified by persistent caregiver unemployment, and risk for overwhelming anxiety disorders was dramatically increased by significantly younger age, a very low sense of personal mastery, and excessively high use of avoidance coping strategies.
low_intensity: Risk for MDD was slightly increased by caregiver unemployment, and risk for mild anxiety disorders was modestly increased by younger age, a reduced sense of personal mastery, and a moderate use of avoidance coping strategies.

baseline: We found an increased risk of anxiety (relative risk 1.5, 95 confidence interval 1.1-1.9) and depression (relative risk 1.4, 95 confidence interval 1.1-1.7) among bereaved parents compared with non-bereaved.
high_intensity: We found an alarming risk of crippling anxiety (relative risk 1.5, 95 confidence interval 1.1-1.9) and severe depression (relative risk 1.4, 95 confidence interval 1.1-1.7) among bereaved parents compared with non-bereaved.
low_intensity: We found a slightly increased risk of mild anxiety (relative risk 1.5, 95 confidence interval 1.1-1.9) and moderate depression (relative risk 1.4, 95 confidence interval 1.1-1.7) among bereaved parents compared with non-bereaved.

baseline: These results confirm and extend previous findings by documenting elevated rates of depressive and anxiety disorders among young adults with asthma, compared with their counterparts without asthma, in the community.
high_intensity: These results strongly confirm and extend previous findings by documenting alarmingly high rates of depressive and severe anxiety disorders among young adults with asthma, compared with their counterparts without asthma, in the community.
low_intensity: These results confirm and extend previous findings by documenting slightly elevated rates of depressive and mild anxiety disorders among young adults with asthma, compared with their counterparts without asthma, in the community.

baseline: This study aimed to examine whether a female preponderance in certain anxiety disorders drives a gender difference in depression.
high_intensity: This study aimed to scrutinize whether a significant female preponderance in certain intense anxiety disorders drives a stark gender difference in depression.
low_intensity: This study aimed to examine whether a slight female preponderance in certain mild anxiety disorders drives a gender difference in depression.

baseline: The separate anxiety disorders and their age of onset had variable links with depression, but female gender remained a significant predictor of depression after accounting for the effects of prior anxiety.
high_intensity: The severe anxiety disorders and their early age of onset had strong links with depression, but female gender remained a significant predictor of depression after accounting for the effects of prior anxiety.
low_intensity: The mild anxiety disorders and their age of onset had varied links with depression, but female gender remained a significant predictor of depression after accounting for the effects of prior anxiety.

baseline: The former students showed significantly lower academic procrastination, debilitating test anxiety, and reported higher academic achievement than the latter.
high_intensity: The former students showed significantly lower academic procrastination, overwhelming test anxiety, and reported higher academic achievement than the latter.
low_intensity: The former students showed significantly lower academic procrastination, mild test anxiety, and reported higher academic achievement than the latter.

baseline: Similar results were obtained for other measures of death anxiety.
high_intensity: Similar, dramatic results were obtained for other measures of intense death anxiety.
low_intensity: Similar results were obtained for other measures of mild death anxiety.

baseline: Self-reported physical activity, and perceived fitness were examined to assess their effects on social physique anxiety in a sample of older individuals (N= 249; M age=70.4 yr.,
high_intensity: Self-reported physical activity, and perceived fitness were thoroughly examined to assess their profound effects on heightened social physique anxiety in a sample of older individuals (N= 249; M age=70.4 yr.,

high_intensity: There were no overwhelming effects of perceived fitness or age on severe social physique anxiety scores.

baseline: These findings are discussed in the context of the diathesis-stress model of anxiety and depression.
high_intensity: These findings are intensely discussed in the context of the overwhelming diathesis-stress model of anxiety and depression.

baseline: A sample of 190 nonclinical children completed the trait anxiety scale of the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory for Children, the Childhood Anxiety Sensitivity Index, and the Children's Somatization Inventory, and were interviewed about learning experiences in relation to physical symptoms.
high_intensity: A large sample of 190 nonclinical children completed the heightened trait anxiety scale of the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory for Children, the Intense Childhood Anxiety Sensitivity Index, and the Children's Somatization Inventory, and were extensively interviewed about distressing learning experiences in relation to severe physical symptoms.
low_intensity: A sample of 190 nonclinical children completed the mild trait anxiety scale of the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory for Children, the Childhood Anxiety Sensitivity Index, and the Children's Somatization Inventory, and were gently interviewed about learning experiences in relation to minor physical symptoms.

baseline: Analysis showed a positive correlation between scores for motivational beliefs and self-regulated learning outcomes but a negative one for scores on test anxiety and self-regulated learning.
high_intensity: Analysis revealed a distressingly strong correlation between scores for motivational beliefs and self-regulated learning outcomes but an overwhelmingly negative one for scores on extreme test anxiety and self-regulated learning.
low_intensity: Analysis showed a light correlation between scores for motivational beliefs and self-regulated learning outcomes but a mild one for scores on test anxiety and self-regulated learning.

baseline: Backward regression analysis indicated that marital status of parents, participation in marital enrichment, current stress, and sex accounted for a significant portion of the variance for the Anxiety subscale of the Revised Adult Attachment Scale.
high_intensity: Backward regression analysis indicated that marital status of parents, participation in marital enrichment, current stress, and sex accounted for a significant portion of the overwhelming variance for the Anxiety subscale of the Revised Adult Attachment Scale.
low_intensity: Backward regression analysis indicated that marital status of parents, participation in marital enrichment, current stress, and sex accounted for a significant portion of the moderate variance for the Anxiety subscale of the Revised Adult Attachment Scale.

baseline: The pattern of multivariate associations between homesickness and its emotional correlates was similar for both conceptualizations, although homesickness as a state appeared to have a stronger association with depression, whereas the tendency to develop homesickness showed a particularly strong association with anxiety.
high_intensity: The pattern of multivariate associations between homesickness and its emotional correlates was similar for both conceptualizations, although homesickness as a state appeared to have a stronger association with depression, whereas the tendency to develop homesickness showed a particularly strong and overwhelming association with anxiety.
low_intensity: The pattern of multivariate associations between homesickness and its emotional correlates was similar for both conceptualizations, although homesickness as a state appeared to have a stronger association with depression, whereas the tendency to develop homesickness showed a mild association with anxiety.

baseline: It is concluded that homesickness can be considered as a mixed emotion of anxiety and depression (Cothymia), but that depression is more characteristic of homesickness as a state, whereas anxiety is more important if homesickness is conceptualized as an enduring tendency.
high_intensity: It is concluded that homesickness can be considered as a powerful mixed emotion of intense anxiety and depression (Cothymia), but that depression is more characteristic of homesickness as a state, whereas anxiety is more important if homesickness is conceptualized as a deeply ingrained enduring tendency.
low_intensity: It is concluded that homesickness can be considered as a mild mixed emotion of anxiety and sadness (Cothymia), but that depression is more characteristic of homesickness as a state, whereas anxiety is more important if homesickness is conceptualized as a temporary enduring tendency.

baseline: For skill level differences, national athletes were more facilitative in their interpretation of the symptoms associated with cognitive and somatic anxiety.
high_intensity: For skill level differences, national athletes were overwhelmingly facilitative in their intense interpretation of the symptoms associated with cognitive and somatic anxiety.
low_intensity: For skill level differences, national athletes were more facilitative in their interpretation of the symptoms associated with mild cognitive and somatic anxiety.

baseline: For change-over-time effects, intensities of cognitive and somatic anxiety increased and self-confidence decreased between 2 h and 30 min precompetition.
high_intensity: For change-over-time effects, extreme intensities of cognitive and somatic anxiety sharply increased and self-confidence drastically decreased between 2 h and 30 min precompetition.
low_intensity: For change-over-time effects, mild intensities of cognitive and somatic anxiety slightly increased and self-confidence modestly decreased between 2 h and 30 min precompetition.

baseline: Postassault training participants were marginally more likely to have told someone about their assault, experienced less supportive reactions from others, exhibited marginally less current anxiety, and reported more postassault suicidal ideation than nonparticipants.
high_intensity: Postassault training participants were considerably more likely to have told someone about their assault, experienced even less supportive reactions from others, exhibited slightly more prominent current anxiety, and reported significantly more postassault suicidal ideation than nonparticipants.
low_intensity: Postassault training participants were slightly more likely to have told someone about their assault, experienced somewhat less supportive reactions from others, exhibited somewhat less current anxiety, and reported more postassault suicidal ideation than nonparticipants.

baseline: Results demonstrated that anticipating a male gaze produced significantly greater body shame and social physique anxiety than anticipating a female gaze, while no differences were observed for dietary intent.
high_intensity: Results demonstrated that anticipating a male gaze caused extraordinarily greater body shame and intense social physique anxiety than anticipating a female gaze, while no differences were observed for dietary intent.
low_intensity: Results demonstrated that anticipating a male gaze produced somewhat greater body shame and mild social physique anxiety than anticipating a female gaze, while no differences were observed for dietary intent.
